review.user_review_title: Funny as a novelty, and good for self torture - 2.5 stars
review.user_review:
Previously, I had sampled Lester's Fixins Sweet Corn Soda, a rather bizarre beverage. Now, with Buffalo Wing Soda in hand, I was about to imbibe yet another dubious offering from ol' Lester. With slight trepidation, I pried the bottle cap off of this evil beverage and took a sniff --"Okay," I foolishly thought to myself, "it smells a little bit strange, but not as bad as I expected." (I was in denial)! Finally, I took my first swig... In reality, it tasted sort of like a citrus soda that had been spiked with a couple teaspoons of hot sauce. The spiciness gave a slight burning sensation to my esophagus, and a funky aftertaste lingered for a while after I had finished the beverage. Subsequently, "rot gut" began to settle in, and any lingering "open mindedness" that I still had toward this soda faded away exponentially...
As I type this review, the empty bottle sits next to me; I've now become acutely and unequivocally aware of the noxious smell continually wafting from the opening: An unsettling hybrid scent of hot sauce and sickly sweetness.

I like the novelity of this soda, but I don't think that I'll be drinking it again.

review.user_review:
Weighing in at a wonderful 10% ABV, St Bernardus Abt 12 is everything that you would expect from a quality Belgian Abbey ale: Full bodied, layered with a complexity of flavors, and opening up to its full potential as it gets closer to room temperature.

It is an opaque brown ale with an amalgamated bouquet of dark fruit/dark cherries and brewers' yeast.

There is a noticable velvety mouthfeel, and a dark fruit/dark cherry sweetness in the aftertaste -- yet not in a cloyingly sweet way.

For a 10% ABV ale, it is a fairly smooth libation - yet it still provides a nice warmth that only such high octane ales can provide; the more that I allow the ale to "open up," the more similar to a glass of wine it becomes for me -- quite miraculous!

Is is an excellent Belgian ale; I will purchase this product again.

description: From the brewer: The St.Bernardus Abt 12 is recognized as one of the best ales in the World. For the occassion of our 60th Anniversary our Brewmaster Bert Van Hecke created a unique and special variety of the St. Bernardus Abt 12. This 'Special Edition' contains hops from Poperinge: Challenger and Golding, and has been brewed with black, amber, Munich and pale ale malts. Alc. 11% Vol.

review.user_review_title: The unfortunate circumstances surrounding a once great Belgian ale...
review.user_review:
During the late 1990's and early 2000's, this was one of my favorites. Back then, the 750ml bottle was the only option; I would purchase it to share with friends, trying to introduce them to something new in the beer world. Strangely, the beer then left the Minnesota markets for a couple of years. Needless to say I was quite displeased with this. Despite my efforts, there was just no way that I could logistically get my hands on this now precious and coveted ale. Then just a couple of years ago, Leffe resurfaced again - this time exclusively in 6 pack form. Moreover, it was now in virtually every liquor store that carried at least a minimal selection of imported beers. Although I was pleased that Leffe had returned, it just didn't feel quite right; it was now too ubiquitous, and I missed the old 750 ml corked bottles. Now, in the past year or so, the 750ml bottles have returned. Additionally, the sticker price is surprisingly much cheaper (approximately $4 - $6) than its Belgian competitors. Once again, I was glad to see the return of the quintessentially Belgian corked bottle for Leffe. However, the significantly reduced cost of the ale made me a bit suspicious. Regardless, like reacquainting with an old friend, I decided to pick up a bottle to see if Leffe was still one of Belgium's finest. While there is no doubt that Leffe is still a quality Belgian ale, there seems to be something slightly different with this product, some subtilities that seem to be lacking. I noticed it mainly in the finish of the beer; there seemed to be a vaguely noticeable "thinness" that I've sometimes associated with cheaper quality American brews. I started to "smell a rat," so I decided to dig a little bit deeper into recent information about Leffe; what I uncovered made my heart sink a little bit...
It seems that one major step in the wrong direction for Leffe occurred in 2004. It was during this time that Interbrew, the company that owned the rights to Leffe, merged with the Brazilian brewing company AmBev. Changing the company name to InBev following the merger, the conglomerate earned itself a very negative reputation as a ruthless predator in the beer manufacturing world. It is also noteworthy to point out that this was roughly the same time period in which Leffe became conspicuously absent from the shelves of Minneapolis liquor stores. Coincidence? Maybe, but I'm willing to bet that it wasn't. In November 2008, InBev purchased Budweiser giant Anheuser-Busch for $52 billion. Changing the name to "Anheuser-Busch InBev" (or "AB InBev" for short), the newly formed conglomerate was now the world's #1 beer manufacturer. Moreover, multiple resources that I read cited the fact that AB InBev was now using corn and other cost-effective measures in their brewing process for Leffe -- something that was not being done previously. In one fell swoop, this explains the recent widespread distribution, the suspiciously low cost, and the noticeably different taste of a once great Belgian ale. As I write this, I keep shaking my head; I feel a bit duped and betrayed (unfortunately, Leffe is just the tip of the iceberg - other quality beers such as Franziskaner, Bass, Goose Island, and Hoegaarden are also owned by AB InBev).

By most accounts that I've read, AB InBev seems to have garnered a reputation for buying up smaller beer companies and either callously altering their brewing processes (in the name of cost-effective measures) or working toward closing the products lines down altogether. There's lots of negative information out there in regard to this company... I may need to reconsider how often (if at all) I should purchase products that support such a dubious organization.

review.user_review_title: Tastes like Mountain Dew flavored with cane sugar...
review.user_review: KICKAPOO JOY JUICE, first marketed in 1965, gets its name from a concoction made by characters from the Li'l Abner comic series.  The image on the bottle comes strait from the comic series; a hillbilly named "Hairless Joe," and a Native American named "Lonesome Polecat" are raising bottles into the air in celebratory fashion, lauding the creation of their mysterious libation.  Were this product to be mass marketed today, I'm fairly certain that there would be a slight backlash in regard to the negative racial stereotypes being portrayed.  However, for those who grew up reading the Li'l Abner series, this niche soda seems to serve as a nice bit of nostalgia.  As for the flavor of this beverage, it pretty much tastes like Mountain Dew or Mello Yellow, sweetened with sugar rather than high fructose corn syrup.

review.user_review: I picked up a bottle of this unique soda at JIM'S APPLE FARM - an awesome seasonal store located in southern MN.  Seeing as today is "[[ASIN:B008M7HGAA Talk Like a Pirate Day]]," and the bottle's artwork has a nice skull and crossbones motif, it only seemed fitting to share this crazy beverage with co-workers.  I pried open the bottle and took a sniff, wherein I noticed a slightly herbal scent; considering the long list of herbal ingredients on the label, this wasn't particularly suprising.  I then poured the nearly blood red elixir into a cup and took an initial swallow.  I was rather suprised by the initial bitterness of the soda; it definitely wasn't what I was expecting!  Continuing with a couple more swallows, I then started to notice a slight burning sensation in my esophagus -- this, no doubt, came from the jalapeño oil that was infused into the beverage.  I wasn't sure if I liked this soda at first.  However, the more that I drank it, the more that I came to enjoy this bizarre concoction.  It also seemed to cure my morning craving for caffeine, so that was pretty cool too.  My co-workers weren't so thrilled with this beverage, but I thought that it was pretty good. At the very least, it makes for good discussion as a novelty item.

review.user_review_title: Some things never seem to change - Artificial banana flavoring is one of them...
review.user_review:
If you've ever eaten a piece of banana flavored Laffy Taffy, or if you've ever had a banana flavored Popsicle, you already have a general idea as to the taste of this soda. Artificial banana flavoring is a bit strange; it doesn't taste at all like a real banana, yet we've all been conditioned to accept this odd flavor's designation as such. Interestingly, the soda's ingredients list says "extract flavor" rather than "artificial flavor." However, the word "banana" isn't found anywhere in the ingredients list, so I'm assuming that the flavor is artificial -- at the very least, it sure tastes like it's artificial.

If you enjoy artificial banana flavor, you'll most likely appreciate this novelty soda.
I found this bizarre offering at JIM'S APPLE FARM, a seasonal store located in southern MN. (If you plan to visit the area between now and Thanksgiving, I highly recommend that you pay them a visit).

review.user_review_title: Nothing says "pure refreshment" like windshield washer blue soda!
review.user_review: Fall is in the air in Minnesota; the corn has turned golden brown, the leaves are beginning to change, and apple season is in full swing.  So naturally, I made yet another pilgrimage to JIM'S APPLE FARM (if you're going to be visiting southern MN between now and Thanksgiving, I highly recommend paying them a visit). As is par for the course during this time of year, the place was overrun with throngs of crazy apple lovers.  Apples are nice and all, however, the REAL treasures found at this place are all of the amazing variants of candy and, especially, the dozens of bizarre brands of soda that line the shelves!  Fighting my way past the "Honeycrisp Harolds" and the "apple butter Bettys," I finally found myself standing in front of the state's largest selection of off-the-wall sodas - truly a sublime thing to behold!  The last time that I visited this soda pop mecca, I left slighty disappointed because I wasn't financially prepared to delve in unfettered.  This time, however, I came prepared and bought a bevy of rainbow colored, carbonated ambrosia;  among my numerous selections was the wonderfully retro GOODY BLUE POP.  Electric blue in color, sweetened with pure cane sugar and "natural and artificial flavors," -- It's pretty much what you'd expect (complete with a noticable aftertaste either from the Blue # 1 dye, the cane sugar, or both).  I don't think that I'd purchase a whole 12 pack of this soda. However, for nostalgia's sake, it would be worth purchasing a couple of bottles.  Get at least a half dozen people willing to chip in, and THEN purchase a 12 pack of this stuff!

review.user_review:
While on my way down to southern MN, I stopped by JIM'S APPLE FARM (the state's largest candy store - I highly recommend paying them a visit) and purchased a couple bottles of "Lester's Fixins Sweet Corn Soda." Great novelity gag gift. However, if I drank any more of this stuff, "gag gift" would take on a literal meaning. After prying off the bottle cap, I took a sniff ; it smelled EXACTLY like canned corn! It was a little humorous and disgusting at the same time...
After the initial swallow, a weird amalgamation of mawkish sweetness and canned corn aftertaste, it eventually became easier to drink the soda. (The trick was to take multiple gulps to avoid the aftertaste as much as possible). Soon my taste buds capitulated, and I was mainly tasting the "Pure Cane Sugar," and only a hint of corn aftertaste. (How ironic, a "sweet corn" soda flavored with cane sugar instead of high fructose corn syrup!) However a couple of little involuntary burps brought the sickly corn flavor of this bizarre beverage immediately back to my palate. Kind of nasty...
Once again, this soda makes a funny discussion piece. However, in terms of refreshment...I think that I'll drink something else!

* - The slogan on the bottle of Lester's Fixins Sweet Corn Soda.

review.user_review: I’ve been a fan of these low sugar gummy treats for awhile now, and these are among the best I’ve tried and I think they’re worth the money, even though they’re on the pricey side compared to traditional gummy candies. This variety pack is the best way to try all of the options. The peach rings are my favorite of the bunch, but the sour kids are a lot like the real thing, and so are the red fishies. The sour watermelon slices are also very tasty. I do have to say that eating too many of these does cause some GI upset for me (everyone is different), so just something to be aware of...I have to pace myself with these. Great value for low sugar gummy candies, especially at the current sale price ($22.99/$2.87 per pouch).

review.user_review: These individual Lifesaver gummy pouches are big! You’re getting a lot of candy in this 12-pack (84 ounces in total…that’s 5.25 pounds)! They’re so fruity, flavorful and great quality—I’m such a fan of gummy candy, and these really hit the spot when I want something chewy. With that said, these are sweet, so definitely be VERY mindful that there’s 7 servings in each bag, which equals 630 calories per bag, and 126 grams of sugar…YOWZA!! The Collision version in the blue bags are really fun to get 2 flavors meshed together…cute idea. These are really tasty and fresh, but my goodness they’re a big diet buster if you’re not careful with the portion size.

review.user_review_title: Prop65 Warning, Not A Fan Overall
review.user_review: Not a huge fan of these gummies. First of all, the California Prop65 warning on each packet is a little unsettling—I believe it has something to do with the pouch the candy is packaged in and not the food itself, but it still gave me an icky feeling as I was gearing up to try these. The actual gummies have good flavor and texture, but they taste so much like my elderberry zinc gummies that I take when I’m trying to fight off a cold, so this correlation is hard for me to mentally get over and think of these as a candy substitute and not a vitamin. I definitely wouldn’t let kids try them with the Prop65 warning. These are pass for me despite the good overall quality and flavor.

review.user_review_title: My Favorite Brand For Low Sugar Gummies
review.user_review: I’ve been a fan of the Project7 low sugar gummy treats for awhile now. They are by far the best I’ve tried and I think they’re worth the money, even though they’re on the pricey side. This variety pack is the best way to try all of the options. The apple rings are my favorite of the bunch, but the sour worms and bears are super delicious too. I love that you get a lot of treats in each bag, which really feels satiating when you have a craving. The sour options are a very close dupe of other authentic sour coatings (like sour patch kids). I truly feel these are the best low sugar gummy treats you’ll find. Fingers crossed for peach rings to launch one day! I'm sold!

review.user_review_title: The Originals Are Great, But Not The Other Flavors
review.user_review: I didn’t care for this Sour Jacks assortment overall. The Original flavor bags are really good—the texture is chewy, with a nice bite and the flavor variety keeps things interesting. The Watermelon and the Wildberry variety were not as good, as I didn’t care for the texture of these, as they were softer than the Originals, but mostly because the flavors are somewhat bland in comparison. I’d buy the Originals again, but I’d skip the other flavors. Four stars for the Originals, 2 stars for the Watermelon and Wildberry.

review.user_review: First of all, these gummies are so cute! For vegan gummies, the texture is phenomenal and they have a genuine chew you would expect. There’s a pleasant tartness and the outer crunch adds some nice texture. The mango flavor is good, and it has that authentic mango flavor profile infused into a gummy candy. I also got to try the strawberry and watermelon ones in this line, and I feel the strawberry has a better overall flavor profile (I don't love the watermelon), but these are still very good. Such a nice treat when I have a gummy craving.

review.user_review_title: Flavor Is A Letdown, Texture Is Great!
review.user_review: First of all, these gummies are so cute! For vegan gummies, the texture is phenomenal and they have a genuine chew you would expect. There’s a pleasant tartness and the outer crunch adds some nice texture. With that said, the watermelon flavor is not the best. It’s vaguely reminiscent of watermelon, but I may just be telling myself that since I know there’s actual watermelon used for the flavor. Even so, it’s more of a watermelon rind flavor instead of a juicy watermelon. I’d love to see this one reformulated, because watermelon gummies are delicious in theory, but not so much with this execution.

review.user_review: I didn’t expect these apple rings to be my favorite treat out of all of the Project Seven low-sugar gummies that I've tried! These are sooooo good! They’re a little bit multicolored, which looks fun, and the apple flavor is spot-on with an authentic sour coating, and the chewiness is perfect! These are wonderfully fruity, delicious and satisfying! I hope they make these in peach rings next! Definitely recommend these!

review.user_review_title: Super Delicious Sour Worms Without The Sugar!
review.user_review: These low sugar gummy worms are really tasty! The texture is a little softer (less chewy) than traditional gummy worms, but they definitely still make you feel like you’re eating a gummy treat. The sour coating is perfect, and “authentic” to other sour gummies. I was expecting really long worms based on the picture, but they’re actually on the shorter side (about 3/4 the length of my pinky finger). I had no trouble eating the whole mini bag, and enjoyed every bite.  I didn’t feel guilty about it either knowing these aren’t loaded with sugar. Glad that 8 bags in this multipack for lots of snacking. Price is a little high, but they’re a great treat!

review.user_review: My gummy candy-loving heart is so happy after eating these Pink Panda treasure gummies (pink wrapper) and sour gummies (yellow wrapper)! They really have a perfect chewy texture, great fruit flavor, and the sour ones have spot-on tartness comparable to the patch kids. I've also tried other low sugar gummy candy (Smart Sweets), but these have a better texture and flavor to me. Just be careful about eating too many due to the fiber content. A serving is a whole pouch, but that is too much for my GI tract (half a pouch is about right for me), but I will definitely restock these because of the excellent taste without the sugar!

review.user_review: These strawberry and raspberry gummies are delicious. They definitely have the texture and chew of a fruit snack with a juicy and sweet flavor, so they’re like a fruit snack meets chewy candy hybrid. The ingredient components are nice for a “candy” and you only need to eat 3 or 4 of them to get your fill. I’d say they could reduce the sugar a bit and they’d still be sweet and tasty (they have 16 grams of sugar in 7 gummies, with 15 grams as added sugar). They arrived very fresh, and kids will definitely love them!

target.user_review:
Very fresh 25 mullein tea herbal bags. No added sugars.
This is from the leaves and flowers.
Brew bags for 3 to 5 mins in boiling water.
One bag can be used 2 to 3 times during the day.
Caffeine free and Additives free.
The taste is ok, and I used 100% pure stevia powder.
If you have asthma this will help you.
For my problem from having pneumonia 5 yrs and getting breathless off and on, this did not help me, but helped my granddaughter who has asthma.

review.user_review_title: Nice, but not as strong as I like it!
review.user_review:
If I’m going to drink tea which I do allot it’s going to be a healthy tea.
This is caffeine free, organic , non GMO.
Yogi tea is my favorite brand of teas, and this is the first time I’m trying this
Sweet Ginger Citrus Turmeric Vitality tea.

I cook using Turmeric powder in allot of dishes, and it has to have Pepper or Pepperine in it to absorb in your body. I grind fresh pepper.
This tea does not have any pepper in it, but it does have allot of other organic healthy herb's .
I also put a little pure stevia in my tea.
That said I did not find this tea to be very strong, and I’m a little disappointed!
I did taste a little turmeric taste that is not my favorite, but I liked the Citrus taste in this, but still
It was weak compare to my other Yogi teas that I buy by the 6 boxes.
I did receive 6 boxes, and 16 tea bags to one box.
When I try this again , I’m going to use Two tea bags and hopefully it will taste stronger for me.
If so I will be back with a update if I like it being stronger, or I just put another type of Yogi tea in this.

review.user_review_title: Organic Dandelion tea in tea bags, great for a healthy liver.
review.user_review:
When I ordered this Organic Dandelion tea I didn’t realize it came in tea bags to my delight. I can take these tea bags with me to a restaurant that doesn’t have the tea of my choice etc.
The tin it came in is lovely and very useful for other teas also. Mine tin had a couple very small dents.

I used stevia with this tea as I usually do with my tea.
This Wild Bless tea had a more nutty taste to me! I will drink it as I know what a healthy tea Dandelion tea is.
I’m not a drinker but it’s excellent for your liver. People that eat sugar can have a fatty liver like a alcoholic can, but there are other benefits for health drinking Dandelion tea,
And this is a good healthy dandelion tea. .

review.user_review_title: Organic, felt relaxed after drinking this.
review.user_review:
Organic. A.good Relaxing tea blend.
This looks like very dried whole herb flowers, with a nice Fresh scent.
I filled a tea ball, and put this in my cup with hot water.
Let it seep for over 3 mins pulling this up and down in the cup.

I thought it tasted good but wasn’t strong enough for me.
But I do want to say , I’m a older women and I notice I’m not tasting food and teas as strong as I use too.
The combination of the different teas are very good, and I did feel Relaxed.

There is a goodly amount of tea in the bag.

description: My Land’s organic Olympus Mountain tea is a soothing aromatic herbal tea, containing the Sideritis Scardica plant Chamomile and Lemon verbena from Mount Olympus, Greece. It can be consumed anytime though it's beneficial for relaxing or bed time. Our Greek Mountain Tea is made from the dried flowers, leaves, and stems of the Sideritis herb. It is grown and hand-picked from the slopes of Mount Olympus in the traditional ways so as to preserve its wonderful natural flavor and nutrition. Smooth and deliciously appealing, our organic Olympus herbal tea is an ideal companion for cold winter days. Great as iced tea.

description: Start your morning with a cup of this uplifting organic green tea blend and you’ll instantly want to make it a daily ritual. Boil water, steep a tea bag for 2-3 minutes, then settle in to sip your stress away. This green tea sencha comprises ginger, fennel, dandelion, tulsi, turmeric and lavender -- natural ingredients that have traditionally been used for medicinal purposes. High in antioxidants and with a mild amount of caffeine, the wellness tea’s nutritional benefits abound and include improved immunity, digestive health and sleep. Savor Kehl-Kronenhof 100% Certified Organic Herbal Green Tea Wellness Blend throughout the day, by itself or with meals, as part of a flavorful, nutritious diet. This tea can be enjoyed warm or chilled over ice for a refreshing drink.

review.user_review_title: Nice tea, but was expecting a more fruity flavor, or didnt use enough!
review.user_review:
I’m a tea drinker but only herb tea’s.
I have Hibiscus tea in the house, but this tea has other dried fruits in it, and it is not as strong
As my other Hibiscus tea that is mainly Hibiscus, although the taste was nice. I also added a little bit of stevia to this.

Many people drink Hibiscus tea for high blood pressure which I do not have, but since this seemed very mild
And not much Hibiscus taste I do not think this would be the Hibiscus tea you would drink for high blood pressure.
Although a lovely tea, I didn’t get the taste of the fruit in this!

I used my electric glass tea maker that you press the button for the heat of the tea, I then scooped up the tea
In a fairly big tea ball, put it in my glass cup to let it seep.
I just didn’t get the punch of flavor I expected. Maybe I didn’t use enough, although
I had more then one large cup!

review.user_review_title: Special Full leaf Chamomile tea, Very relaxing. Update. Weak tea.
review.user_review:
Update. After drinking this tea a few more times, it's very weak. (I'm a tea drinker) ..To get more of a flavor I have to use 2 tea bags for a cup of tea. I do not use a large mug.
I went from a 5 star to a 3 star.

Chamomile Tea is my favorite Organic herb tea.

Wickedly Prime tea is Not your grocery store type of tea.
The Tea bags come in a clear see through cellophane bag,with a slit that makes it easy to open.
On the clear bag it says “Wickedly Prime” in black on the front.Keeps the bags inside very fresh.
The Tea Bags are not your regular paper bags. There a fine Sachet bag filled with tea in a triangle bag.
The bags are filled with Full leaf Chamomile, I can see part of the flower in the bag, and Passion flower, Lavender, Peppermint, and Lemongrass.
I’m impressed by the presentation of the box and packaging.
I’m thinking this is healthier then other Chamomile teas I have.
It has a good flavor, but I do not think it is as strong as all the other chamomile organic teas I have drank..
That said, My Husband thinks the Flavor was strong, wonderful, and this is a relaxing tea.
(As people get older they lose there taste buds, Zinc can help bring the taste back, and I have not taken zinc in a long time. Going to order more zinc on Amazon.)

This is enjoyable to drink, and is a lovely gift if your going to someones home, or what to share a nice organic tea.
We only drink organic tea, and this is a hit in our home.

5 Star

description: Imagine an emerald green field at the foothills of the Andes, dotted as far as the eye can see with the white nodding heads of daisies. That's where the flowers for this Chamomile tea grow. Undisturbed, organically, the way nature intended. Exceptional in flavor and aroma, this Chamomile variety is considered one of the best in the world. Each sip chases away worries, soothes the stomach and relaxes the body. The Garden of the Andes organic tea farm is nestled in the lush valleys of the Andes Mountains. Blessed with crisp alpine air, fed by crystal waters of mountain lakes and streams, abundant in nutrient-rish soil, this idyllic environment produces vigorous plants with exquisite aromas, flavors and health benefits. Using the latest sustainable practices and traditional growing methods, Garden of the Andes nurtures the finest indigenous herbs and flowers to create highly praised tea blends.

target.user_review:
Item: Stephen's Gourmet Hot Cocoa
Purchase: Gift From My Aunt, (she has money to buy only Gourmet items)
Amount Given: 5 Packages (Single Serve) Mixed Flavors

Review

I was giving these as a gift. They had been sitting in my aunt's long haul truck for a while. She can't drink them because now she is on a diet so she passed them on to me. I figured that like more things with the word "Gourmet" on them that is premade that is would be nasty. I was delightfully wrong.

I love this brand. It tasted amazing, was quick and easy to make, and I didn't have to add milk after microwaving to make it taste good either. I plan to purchase this on my own over and over again now, no matter the price in the stores. I love it, and I can't wait to taste every single flavor. A must have, two thumbs up.

description: Made from only the finest ingredients, Stephen's Gourmet White Chocolate Hot Cocoa is quite simply one of the richest, creamiest, most flavorful cocoas you've tasted. It is made with only the finest ingredients, such as Ivory Coast beans milled in Holland, extra fine sugar, natural flavorings, coconut oil creamer and more. Taste a cup and you will see why everyone is talking about Stephen's hot chocolate, which comes in a 16 oz size. It is a delicious way to warm up on a cold afternoon and relax. It's made with zero trans fats and is gluten free. Stephen's gourmet hot cocoa is the way cocoa was meant to taste.Stephen's Gourmet White Chocolate Hot Cocoa:

description: Do you love unique, high-quality coffee? So, do we!
An excellent cup of coffee can make a huge difference in your daily life. But, taking coffee from one of the world’s most sought areas can create a whole new experience.
Introducing Montkava Ethiopian and Honduras Coffee Beans Selection
Enjoy A Real Cup of Coffee and Experience the Difference

Immerse your senses and challenge your taste buds with gourmet coffee sourced from one of the world's most sought areas. We sourced 100% arabica coffee beans from Ethiopia and Honduras, medium roasted them to perfection to bring out the best characteristics of these remarkable coffee beans. The thick body and earthy crisp aroma resonate with the exceptional medium roasted taste for a smooth, balanced, and satisfying cup of coffee that every coffee lover will love and enjoy.
Wake up to the essences of sweet, dark chocolate and citrus from the Honduras single origin coffee or the bright and fruity flavors with sweat notes of the Yirgacheffe coffee beans.
Whether you want to start your day, share chitchat with friends, or relax in the afternoon, a cup of Montkava whole bean coffee will make every moment savor.
Quality You Can Rely on

We have sourced our coffee beans from the high altitude highlands of Ethiopia and Honduras. The beans are grown on family farms in two of the world's premier coffee growing regions. To guarantee the high quality of our fresh roasted coffee, we carefully source quality high-altitude beans that burst with rich, smooth flavor, then roast them perfectly and package them immediately to preserve the freshness, world-class aroma and flavor of these gourmet coffees.
Package Includes:
1* 250g Ethiopian whole bean
1* 250g Ethiopian whole bean
1* 250g Honduras Coffee
1* 250g Honduras Coffee

target.user_review:
Do you like dark chocolate? Do you like almond bark? If so, you'll probably like these, The almonds are chopped finer than you find in other almond barks, but I rather like that as you get an even distribution of almonds throughout the bark.

But it's the dark chocolate that really shines here. It's an intense dark chocolate and appears to be a very good quality. As the product name says, these are "thins" -- more like "chips" but still recognizable as almond bark. There's also a slight hint of sea salt. I was a little concerned that it would be too salty -- not no. It's really just about perfect -- just that little after taste of salty brightness.

Definitely would purchase these as a tasty after dinner snack. They're so intensely chocolaty that only a couple of chips is all it takes for a satisfying end-of-meal treat. Good stuff here!

They’re thin, breakable pieces of dark chocolate and sea salt packed full with snackable inclusions in a re-sealable bag so you can snack whenever and wherever you want! So, what are you waiting for? Get your bag and snack on some #snackingchocolate!

review.user_review:
Large bag of Dove dark chocolates, three varieties in three different color foil wrappers making for a very attractive collection when displayed in a candy dish.

If you're familiar with Dove's dark chocolate, you'll feel right at home with these. The flavors are plain solid dark chocolate, dark and white chocolate swirl, and dark chocolate surrounding a soft caramel filling. Yummy! As always, it's quite rich -- I find I'm perfectly satisfied after eating just a few of these.

This would be a nice addition to a Valentine's gift for the dark chocolate lover in your life. Really fine chocolate!

review.user_review_title: Regular peanut Snickers with a *hint* of hazelnut flavor ...
review.user_review:
Snickers has long been one of my favorite candy bars. So I was curious to see how hazelnuts would work with the basic "formula."

The bottom line: this is still the same basic Snickers bar: caramel, nougat, chocolate, and peanuts -- with the addition of some hazelnuts. I get the hazelnut flavor -- barely perceptible, but present. But if "Hazelnut" is going to be featured on the label, I would expect the flavor to be more pronounced.

On the plus side -- you get two "bars" in each large package: one for now, and one for later, so that's a nice packaging plus.

Don't get me wrong -- these are still very good as far as "Snickers" is concerned. But they need to increase the proportion of hazelnuts (eliminating some of the peanuts) to make it worth the prominence of labeling this as "SNICKERS Hazelnut."

If you want a traditional Snickers with just a hint of hazelnut flavor, these will work. But otherwise, just go for the regular Snickers.

review.user_review:
I'm an unrepentant chocoholic, and I'm usually an equal-opportunity chocoholic, meaning I'll eat just about anything that isn't pure drek. Hershey's is a decent brand, with generally good products, not as good as some brands, but probably better than others. So I kind of knew what to expect with these almond chocolate bars.

You get 5 large-ish milk chocolate bars with just the right amount of crunchy almonds. Each bar breaks into 8 nuggets -- reminiscent of [[ASIN:B001FA1DZK Hershey's Nuggets, Milk Chocolate with Almonds, 12-Ounce Bags (Pack of 4)]]. Yes, the quality is consistent with Hershey's brand -- creamy, a bit sweet (it is, after all, milk chocolate), etc. The gift box is nice. But at the current price (twenty-five dollars) it's just not very economical, especially when you check out other options. If this were Scharffen Berger or Guittard quality, it might be worth the extra cost. But for Hershey's? You be the judge. Only you know if it's worth it to you. I'll pass.

review.user_review:
These Almond Dark Chocolate Nut Crisp Bars aren't bad. They're very crispy with a decent amount of dark chocolate, not too "killer" for dieters (Weight Watchers points value for 1 bar: 4 pts; for 2 bars: 7 pts).

They not very big, and don't offer a lot of protein or fiber, but they ARE tasty, slightly sweet, slightly salty, crunchy. I didn't detect much almond flavor; I tasted more peanuts than anything.

Basically, I like these OK, but given a choice, I'd probably opt for something with more fiber than these, and more filling. These are just too much like "candy" for my taste.

review.user_review:
My favorite candy bar has been Snickers for a lot of years. I just love the combination of milk chocolate, nougat, creamy caramel, and crunchy peanuts. Yum!

This is that same yummy candy bar in an unwrapped bit-sized form. The serving size of 8 pieces is less than 200 calories -- not a *huge* diet hit. I repackage these into snack-size zipper bags and keep them in the freezer -- that way, I'm not tempted to overdo.

They're a bit pricey here on Amazon (I paid around twenty dollars for the 5 bags), but it's nice to have the convenience of ordering online.

Will definitely order again!

review.user_review_title: My favorite candy bar in a bite-sized nugget ...
review.user_review:
Snickers has been my favorite candy bar since I was a child (and that's a LOT of years!). There's just something about the combination of salty peanuts, creamy caramel, soft nougat, swathed in milk chocolate. Yummm!

This new form -- small nuggets of Snickers -- is a welcome addition to the Snickers line. These are unwrapped -- yay! no wrappers to dispose of -- making them much easier to get to when you need to satisfy that Snickers craving.

They also work well in baking -- they're small enough to use in cookies in place of chocolate chips (OK, yes, they're bigger than chocolate chips, but still small enough that they will work), or toss on top of brownies.

Definitely a keeper in my pantry.

review.user_review_title: If you like "regular" Hershey's Milk Chocolate bars ...
review.user_review:
... you'll probably like these.

The flavor is almost the same -- although I find these to taste a bit "sweeter" for some reason.

The texture is ... interesting. Not crunchy, not "soft"; imagine "whipping" melted chocolate so that the consistency is similar to whipped cream, then letting it harden into a chocolate bar shape.

It melts the same as regular Hershey's milk chocolate (bar, kiss, whatever). The best thing about these is that you feel like you're getting more per serving, since the bars are about 1/2" thick, but the same width and length as a regular bar. Granted, that extra space is just air, but the overall feeling is that you're getting a larger serving for the same dietary damage.

I liked these OK -- not sure I'll purchase again, but definitely wanted to try them at least once.

review.user_review:
Certain members of my family are mint+chocolate addicts. Peppermint bark, filled peppermint chocolates, chocolate mint cookies, anything that combines mint with chocolate.

This year, we got both the dark and milk chocolate varieties of these Ghirardelli peppermint bark squares. We liked both flavors, probably preferred the dark chocolate, but found both to have a nice balance of mint to chocolate. The crushed peppermint candy bits in the white chocolate top add a nice crunch, too.

The price here is very good, too. Definitely a keeper!

description: Product Description

The Ghirardelli Chocolate Company is a manufacturer and marketer of premium chocolate products. Incorporated in 1852 and in continuous operation since then, Ghirardelli has the richest heritage of any American chocolate company. Ghirardelli continues to honor its heritage to this day. Ghirardelli is one of the few companies in America that controls the entire chocolate manufacturing process, from cocoa bean to finished product. This control over the manufacturing process, combined with Ghirardelli’s proprietary bean blend and unique methods of roasting and processing, ensures that you are rewarded with the highest quality and richest products. Ghirardelli’s product line includes its signature SQUARES chocolate, chocolate bars, other chocolate confections, baking chocolate, and chocolate beverages. Ghirardelli premium chocolate is available at your local grocery store, drug store, mass-merchandise store, specialty store, department store, and Ghirardelli shops. In addition, Ghirardelli sells industrial products for the confectionery, bakery, dairy, and food service industries.

160 Years of Quality Chocolate

Ghirardelli Chocolate Company proudly manufactures high quality, premium chocolate products in the U.S.A. Incorporated in 1852 and in continuous operation since, Ghirardelli has the richest heritage of any American chocolate company. Ghirardelli is one of the few chocolate companies that controls the entire chocolate manufacturing process, from cocoa bean to finished product. This control over the manufacturing process, combined with Ghirardelli's proprietary bean blend and unique methods of roasting and processing, ensures that you are rewarded with the highest quality and richest products.
Ghirardelli's product line includes its signature chocolate squares, chocolate bars, baking chocolate and chocolate beverages. Try them today.
— The Ghirardelli Story —

In 1849, when Domingo Ghirardelli immigrated to the United States from his homeland of Italy, he had dreams of striking it rich in the California Gold Rush. He settled on opening a tent-store in Stockton, CA, selling various supplies and confections to fellow miners. With his new business proving successful, Domingo decided to open a store and hotel in San Francisco. After a major fire in 1851 destroyed his businesses, he began to rebuild. In 1852, he formed a new confectionery company that would soon become the Ghirardelli Chocolate Company. Domingo would be proud to see how his chocolate company has not only grown, but flourished over the years. It started as a dream in the mid-1800s and it is now a thriving company and a leading brand of premium chocolate.

review.user_review:
We've enjoyed a variety of these Hershey's Pot of Gold chocolates, but our favorite is this one.

They're not too big, not too sweet, either. There's a perfect balance of chocolate to caramel to nuts, too. Other similar products tend to have too much of one component or another -- usually too much chocolate -- so we try to purchase these when we can find them.

Amazon's price is not bad -- these tend to run six or seven dollars per box IF I can find them at all locally.

I may buy a few boxes to tuck away in the freezer to have on hand for later in the year.

review.user_review:
Ghirardelli Chocolate produces consistently high-quality chocolate products, and these dark chocolate peppermint bark squares are no exception.

I LOVE peppermint bark, and I love dark chocolate, so this pairing is a match made in heaven. These delightful squares are just the right size for an afternoon snack with a cup of tea (or a glass of wine!). I like having them on hand for a quick chocolate "hit" during the holidays, or a small reward for finishing my holiday shopping early. (I tend to procrastinate ... )

The price here is OK -- not great, but getting them delivered to my home (or my relatives/friends) is worth a few cents more per package.

. Ghirardelli — Moments of Timeless Pleasure
160 Years of Quality Chocolate

Ghirardelli Chocolate Company proudly manufactures high quality, premium chocolate products in the U.S.A. Incorporated in 1852 and in continuous operation since, Ghirardelli has the richest heritage of any American chocolate company. Ghirardelli is one of the few chocolate companies that controls the entire chocolate manufacturing process, from cocoa bean to finished product. This control over the manufacturing process, combined with Ghirardelli's proprietary bean blend and unique methods of roasting and processing, ensures that you are rewarded with the highest quality and richest products.
Ghirardelli's product line includes its signature chocolate squares, chocolate bars, baking chocolate and chocolate beverages. Try them today.
— The Ghirardelli Story —

In 1849, when Domingo Ghirardelli immigrated to the United States from his homeland of Italy, he had dreams of striking it rich in the California Gold Rush. He settled on opening a tent-store in Stockton, CA, selling various supplies and confections to fellow miners. With his new business proving successful, Domingo decided to open a store and hotel in San Francisco. After a major fire in 1851 destroyed his businesses, he began to rebuild. In 1852, he formed a new confectionery company that would soon become the Ghirardelli Chocolate Company. Domingo would be proud to see how his chocolate company has not only grown, but flourished over the years. It started as a dream in the mid-1800s and it is now a thriving company and a leading brand of premium chocolate.

They're really THAT good.

product.title: TEAZEN Organic Jeju Green Tea Bags - 100% Pure Green Tea From Korea, 40 Count Individually Wrapped, Eco-Friendly Resealable Tea Bags
features: 100% Natural Jeju Green Tea: Organically grown carefully with First Flush young leaves that are harvested in early spring. Therefore, it has less bitter taste and a deep & rich flavor. The volcanic soil of Jeju has a high amount of organic matter which makes the land ideal for cultivating green tea leaves.
Plastic-Free & Pulp Tea Bag: TEAZEN cares for the environment and our customer's health. Therefore, we have created a plastic-free tea bag product using nothing but recycled paper.

description: Bancha is the second most consumed green tea after Sencha and is more of an everyday tea for regular consumption. It is harvested from the second flush of sencha between summer and autumn and is gently roasted to develop a nutty sweet flavor and golden infusion. Bancha tea is rich in antioxidants and has a mild caffeine level due to its roasting process. Both qualities make it the preferred choice for tea lovers which can be enjoyed at any time of the day. NaTeavia Organic Bancha is a true Japanese-grown green tea. It comes from the region of Kagoshima in Japan and is a great tasting healthy tea to drink regularly. Store in a Dark, Cool Place Green tea is very sensitive to heat and humidity. Once the tea bag is opened, store it in an airtight tea canister and keep it in a dry, dark, and cool location.

review.user_review_title: best brand for bread and APF
review.user_review: I use the KA's brand for al bread making,  and this is an extension of their bread flour: there is 13.3% protein level [4g], the same as their 5lb bread flour.  all intent and purposes this is the flour you should use for bread making, especially for sourdough as that needs a strong protein structure to lift with the starter.  I love this brand for the consistent quality and reliability.

description: Perfect for baked goods requiring extra strength! If you are looking for a high gluten flour from a brand that you can trust, look no further than King Arthur High Gluten Flour. review.user_review_title: very high protein % and yet good for your digestive track.
review.user_review: this is not Gf, but it is an ancient grain, which is much better for your digestion as our gene hasn't evolved and adapted fully to the modern grain [hence Celiac and gluten sensitive symptoms].  This flour has over 14% protein, which is great for gluten build.  I use about 30% of this flour with strong bread flour and rye flour combo.  Just know you need to treat this flour like WWF and hence add addition 10% [of its flour weight]of water to the recipe.  Love it for bread and making pasta.

review.user_review_title: A brand that loves their products and tad expensive, but worth it for a delicious finish.
review.user_review: I love this brand as I started sampling their flour and grain offering.  They do love their flour and grains.  I never tried pastry flour before. It has 9% protein, in line with all purpose plain flour and definitely not enough gluten for bread making unless you add vitae gluten.  The brand offers the ASH count for this flour 0.55%, which is an average high of bran that is kept in the flour.  I was curious on the sweet and savory pastry for my British baking…yum. Light and a soft crumble. Worked really well for quiche.

review.user_review_title: Ancient grain and yummy with any sourdough recipes.
review.user_review: It’s like white whole wheat flour, but its ancient grain, which I love using in my sourdough baking.  I used it in sourdough pizza and it adds a great flavor and texture.  Always add 10% more water when you are dealing with whole grains.  Love this product as it’s quite hard to find this in any major supermarkets.  Plan to use this in my sourdough flour blend for my next bread.

description: Whole spelt flour is stone ground from whole grain spelt kernels, producing a fine powder. Spelt is an ancient grain and wheat species that has been cultivated for thousands of years. We bring you the finest, the purest, best quality, 100% all-natural whole spelt Flour in a resealable pouch!  Whole spelt flour has many uses and is a fantastic ingredient to keep in your kitchen. Baking with Whole spelt flour lends its light texture and mildly sweet flavor to your tasty kitchen creations. Use whole spelt flour in your breads, cakes, pastas, cookies, muffins, pancakes, waffles, pizza crusts and much more!  Specialty diet? No problem! Whole spelt flour will suit many diets. Whole spelt flour is soy free and nut free. Our single ingredient whole spelt flour is whole grain, kosher, vegan, all natural and non-GMO. Wow! If you are looking for a healthier cooking or baking option, you found it right here!  Did someone say health? Whole spelt flour is whole grain and all natural. Unlike white flours that are mostly carbs and bare of nutrition, whole spelt flour is milled together with the nutrition rich and fiber loaded bran and germ, making a super healthy flour packed with fiber, protein and beneficial nutrition!  Whole spelt flour is a great 1:1 alternative to wheat flour. Whole spelt flour makes a softer and lighter texture and has less gluten then wheat flour, making baked goods that are lighter on the stomach and easier to digest. Use spelt flour alone or blend with wheat flour for great tasting homemade goodies!

This brand is one of the understated producers out there and they need to get their products into some of the larger stores like WFs.

review.user_review_title: It’s true, bread tastes better from freshly ground flour. Great for sourdough bread
review.user_review: First time I am grinding my whole flour.  I used a spare coffee grinder to intermittently grind 400g of flour to make my sourdough bread.  I am aware freshly grind berries to make bread has a higher protein level, and I noticed that during bulk fermentation - the gluten build was much faster than with KA’s bread flour.  I was very happy with the end result, the oven spring happened. The taste was yummy.  I will need to invest in a grain grinder - not cheap.  But I make all the bread at home now.

target.user_review_title: Great tasting syrups, and the pumps make them so easy to use!
target.user_review: This set of Sweet Sensations Sugar Free Salted Caramel Coffee Flavoring Syrup, that includes two bottles of syrup, along with pump tops for each, are the perfect addition to any cup of coffee and/or coffee bar. I'm a coffee fanatic, and love having flavored syrups in many flavors to go in whatever coffee concoction I come up with. Salted caramel is one of my absolute favorites! Getting two bottles of sugar-free salted caramel syrup, along with a gold pump dispenser for each one, makes adding the syrup to my coffees, lattes, and cappuccinos easy and mess free. Plus, the pump tops can be used over and over again. These syrups are so yummy, so you cannot possibly go wrong with this set. These would go great in a housewarming or coffee lover's gift basket, or just as a tasty treat for yourself. I would absolutely recommend this syrup and pump top set!

Sugar Free Peach Syrup:

In 1925, Rinaldo and Ezilda Torre visited family in Lucca, Italy. The two returned home to their native San Francisco with something very important: handwritten recipes, which they used to create authentic flavored syrups. These syrups helped Rinaldo and Ezilda reintroduce the Italian soda to their neighborhood. Years later, our syrup was used to create the world’s first flavored latte! We’ve remained a family-owned company -- adhering to the high quality standards that Rinaldo and Ezilda set nearly 90 years ago. Each and every syrup, sauce, and smoothie is created with care and pride. That’s a promise from our entire family -- including the more than 100 members that make up the team. We started with just five syrups. Today, you can use more than 100 of our naturally flavored syrups, sauces and beverage bases in coffees, sodas, teas, smoothies, cocktails and more. And we’re excited to bring you new taste traditions and flavors as we move forward.

review.user_review_title: Makes a nice strawberries and cream milkshake.
review.user_review:
This is a large one gallon jug of Strawberry Syrup that tastes pretty good. It is made with acceptable ingredients that I don't mind giving it to my grandkids. The jug is large, and needs to be refrigerated after opening, so make sure you have room.
I froze oat milk in an ice tray to make milk cubes. Then, added them to my Ninja blender, along with this syrup, and a little silk creamer.
It makes some pretty good strawberries and cream milkshakes. We did end up adding a bit of monk fruit to them to give them a bit more sweetness.
This syrup has a nice flavor that is not exactly like fresh strawberries, but is a good substitute in many yummy drinks and other treats. We will have this gone in short order, as everyone loved the milkshakes. We will try icees next.
If you need a lot of strawberry syrup that is not concentrated, I would recommend giving this one a try.

review.user_review_title: Light in flavor and sweetness. Very thin.
review.user_review: This Skinny Elephant Sugar Free Mocha Syrup is a water like consistency "syrup" flavoring. It is light on flavor and sweetness, but still tastes pretty good. I have to add it to a strong cup of dark roast. Otherwise I want to add too much, watering it down a bit. I can tell it has Sucralose, but it doesn't have as much sweetness or the strong aftertaste as other brands. It is not quite as sweet as I like, but my daughter in law will love having it as an option at my coffee bar. I think it is a great option for those who can't have, or are cutting out, sugar. I would recommend it!

review.user_review_title: Beautiful sampler kit! Excellent gift idea.
review.user_review:
This Ten Acre Gifts Coffee Syrup Sampler Gift Set is such a lovely set of coffee syrups. It includes all of my favorite flavors, Salted Caramel, French Vanilla, and Hazelnut. I had to try the Salted Caramel first, and it is so yummy!
My coffee cannot be black. It has to have some flavor added to it. The Salted Caramel, along with a bit of creamer, makes a very yummy cup of coffee. They really have the flavor down pat. While many syrups taste chemical like, I didn't get that with this brand. I can't wait to try the others!
This sampler kit comes very nicely packaged, with beautiful bottles, and yummy syrups. They're good size bottles, and will last for a while, depending on how much you love them. Mine will not be around for very long... 
While these are a bit expensive for my daily syrup budget, they would make an excellent housewarming, holiday, or any time gift. I would absolutely recommend them!

description: It was 1925 in the flourishing Italian community of san Francisco. Rinaldo and ezilda torre blended their first torani Italian syrups using authentic recipes brought from Lucca, Italy. The enterprising couple shared their naturally flavored syrups throughout their north beach neighborhood. Mixing their rich torani syrups with sparkling water and ice, they introduced the classic Italian sodas to cafe owners. This bright, refreshing creation quickly caught on with thirsty customers. In time, torani' s reputation for creating syrups of the highest quality and greatest variety grew. Today, torani is the best-selling specialty syrup in north America and a sign of good taste around the world. What began as five traditional Italian flavors has expanded to more than 80 naturally flavored syrups and a host of creative flavoring ingredients. Each torani product is still made using only the finest ingredients and a careful blend of all-natural extracts. For the finest ingredients and beverage creativity, reach for torani.

review.user_review_title: Nice, bright flavor that is not all that sweet.
review.user_review: I have never tried anything in Rose flavor, so this Social Mixers Simple Syrup for Cocktails is a bit different than I expected. It doesn't seem to be a rose like floral taste or smell, to me. It is very light, bright, and a bit fruity and honeysuckle like. Maybe that is what Rose tastes like, I don't know. I have absolutely nothing to compare it to. It is not as sweet as most syrup, but it goes well in my morning coffee and also in my smoothies. It is a new and tasty flavor for me that I enjoy. It is quite pricey for 8 ounces, so it would not be in my budget, nor is it that exciting for me to purchase it for that price in the future. It is tasty, and for those who can spring for it, or just love Rose flavored syrup, I would definitely recommend it.

review.user_review_title: Beautiful bottle, but not a lot of flavor... Of any kind.
review.user_review:
This Ten Acres Gifts Irish Cream Flavored Syrup comes in the most beautiful bottle, with a gorgeous gold foiled covered top. The bottle is very thick and the labeling looks top-notch. However, upon opening the syrup, I took a taste of it on my finger, and there's not much flavor to it. I could taste sweet and a bit of chemical like flavoring, but I didn't really get an Irish Cream taste. I'm not very certain exactly what it tastes like, but it's definitely not an authentic or traditional Irish cream flavor.
I used it in an iced coffee, but all it did was sweeten it. It didn't really add much, if any, real flavor to it at all. I'm really saddened by this, because I was really looking forward to getting some wonderful Irish Cream flavoring for my coffees. The bottle is beautiful, and I will definitely be reusing it, but I don't see myself repurchasing this syrup. It is not my favorite.

review.user_review_title: Good caramel flavored syrup. Yummy in my coffee!
review.user_review:
This All Natural Caramel Syrup by Good Times Coffee Co. has a good caramel flavor and a pretty nice consistency. It is, of course, very sweet, made with Non-GMO Cane Sugar. Yay! I am not restricted and would rather have sugar, than a sweetener and aftertaste.
The flavor is very close to that of my favorite name brand, and I guess for a single bottle, the price is comparable. I love my flavored coffees so much that I buy my favorite flavors in packs of 4, to save money, and because they last longer.
This Caramel Syrup would definitely be a contender if sold in 4 packs at a comparable price to my regular brand. It is a very yummy caramel syrup and I would absolutely recommend it!

review.user_review_title: Not a lot of flavor. Doesn't taste like Vanilla. Very thin.
review.user_review: This Sugar Free Vanilla Syrup by Good Times Coffee Co. does not have an authentic Vanilla flavor. The flavor it does have is very weak. It is also very thin, almost like slightly thick water, not like a syrup. It tastes more like a simple syrup made with Sucralose, with a slight bit of flavor added, but not quite Vanilla. It's hard to describe. It is okay for sweetening coffee and adding a tiny bit of flavor. I added a few drops of Vanilla Flavoring along with it, and it kicks it up a notch. I really love the non sugar free Caramel Syrup by this company. It is absolutely yummy, and tastes of real caramel! This one is just not my favorite.

review.user_review_title: You can never have too many... syrups or pumps!
review.user_review: I'm a DaVinci Syrup lover, and it seems I've grown tired of buying the 12oz. bottles. I've started buying the larger bottles by the 4 pack, as they are more cost efficient, and I don't run out of my favorites so quickly. Now that I'm starting to use them not only for coffee but for snow cones and sodas, I need more flavors and more pumps. This Gold Coffee Syrup Pump 2 pack has been added to the two bottles of my newest yummy syrups, and I'll have to purchase more as the need arises. They fit perfectly, are much easier than pouring from the bottles, and it keeps my coffee and drink bar neat and tidy. If you have syrups in big bottles, I absolutely recommend these lovely gold pumps.

review.user_review_title: Love this! One of my favorite flavors as a kid...and now!
review.user_review: This Pink Bubble Gum Hawaiian 🍧 Snow Cone Syrup is, by far, my favorite flavor by this brand yet. Bubble Gum was my favorite flavor in anything as a kid and, it turns out, it is still my favorite snow cone flavor! I know this is nothing but sugar syrup and flavor, but it's good to treat yourself and your grandkids to a nice nostalgic treat now and then. Of course, it's only nostalgic to us "old folks", but it makes a great time for sharing stories about your fun times as a kid. This Pink Bubble Gum flavor gets 6 thumbs up from me and the twin grandsons! Definitely recommend!

review.user_review_title: Great for snow cones and smoothie bowls!
review.user_review:
This is my first time trying any of Hypothermias' Sugar Free flavored syrups. This Pina Colada flavor with Monk Fruit and Erythritol has a great taste and just enough sweetness. I didn't know how I would like the sweeteners, as I usually use Sucrose or sugar. They are a little different from Sucrose, but I like the sweetness they give. They don't have the after taste that Stevia has and I like that.
This flavor works great in my frozen yogurt and collagen powder smoothie bowls. I add a little of the syrup, along with some frozen Pineapple, shaved coconut and almonds, and blend away in my Ninja Smoothie Bowl blender attachment. It turns out so yummy! Of course, it also makes great snow cones, too. The grandkids loved having one over the weekend.
I think this is a great tasting and very versatile syrup. It would go wonderful in a multitude of home-made treats. I can't wait to try other flavors and I would definitely recommend this one!

review.user_review_title: So yummy!! Love green apple anything, and this syrup is A+!
review.user_review: This Hypothermias 3 Pack of  STRAWBERRY BLUE BUBBLE GUM GREEN APPLE Snow Cone Syrup & Hawaiian Flavor Syrups is so yummy! I've only slightly tasted the strawberry and blue bubble gum and they were delish by themselves. However, I could not wait to use my Ninja blender to make a green apple snow cone! I love green apple anything, and this syrup did not disappoint. It's sweet and tart and if you don't over do it, it makes for the best snow cone! I accidentally added a bit too much at first, and it was too sweet, but fixed it by making more shaved ice. What a yummy accident! These syrups are great for a now and then tasty treat. I would definitely recommend them, and not just for the kiddos!

review.user_review_title: No artificial flavor or off tastes, just naturally yummy! A couple of irks...
review.user_review:
This Explorer Elixirs Premium Syrups Himalayan Sea Salt Caramel Flavoring is really yummy. I can't have just plain coffee, I always make flavored coffee and this Himalayan Sea Salt Caramel Flavoring just takes it up to a whole other level of yummy! I also appreciate that it's made with real sugar and all natural ingredients.
Though I love the glass bottle and I will be reusing it when empty, it is a bit hard to pour into your coffee or a spoon. A little runs down the side of the bottle every time I use it, needlessly wasting the precious liquid yumminess. An included pump would've been nice to prevent this.
Also, as another reviewer noted, there is Himalayan Salt in the syrup, but no nutrient value for Sodium listed on the label. It seems that the company may use the same label for all the syrup flavors, but Sodium content is a very important bit of missing information.
I love this flavored syrup in my coffee! Aside from my couple of irks from above, the taste is flavorful and authentic, without any chemical or artificial sweetener taste. That is because it is all natural, and I really love that. It also comes beautifully packaged and gift ready. Hopefully, they will correct the label, and maybe think of including a pump. Even so, I would still absolutely recommend this Flavored Syrup.

review.user_review_title: More like Kool-aid. Thin and not a strong enough flavor. 3.5 stars ⭐

target.user_review_title: Lovely, subtle rose flavor and scent
target.user_review: Love the subtle rose flavor of this lovely tea!!!!  So elegant and nice. Smells and tastes heaven. Rose flavor does NOT overwhelm, just subtly compliments to make a fantastic cup of tea!!!

description: Blended in late summer when the roses are in full bloom and at their most fragrant, Rose Petal Black, also known as ‘Meigui Hong Cha’, combines rich Keemun tea and red rose petals. Keemun is a small leaf tea from the Qimen county of Anhui province, best known as the main ingredient for English Breakfast blends. Although there is a whole universe of rose varieties and flavors, we believe the ideal petals for combining with Keemun come from the red roses native to Qimen county. They have a distinct sweet, cooling aroma that lends great balance to the blend. Rose Petal Black pairs well with rich and slightly spicy foods. It also makes a delicious iced tea. One of our favorite recipes is to prepare a sauce from Rose Petal Black and serve it over vanilla ice cream.

description: Product Description

Enjoy a rich blend of fragrant hand-picked tea from the foothills of the breathtaking Himalayan mountainside in the Darjeeling region of India. Stimulating yet smooth, enjoy this elegant and sophisticated brew. Just one sip and you will know why Darjeeling is known as the champagne of black teas.
About the Brand

The Bigelow Tea Story Beginning the moment our founder, Ruth Campbell Bigelow created "Constant Comment" Tea in her kitchen in 1945, our family has focused on just one thing trying to make the finest teas possible. Over the years we have introduced many new flavors as well as concepts in tea. Today we offer a selection of deliciously different blends of teas and green teas, a wide variety of herbal teas and teas flavored with real fruit juice. Today Bigelow Tea is the number one specialty tea company in the United States. And to think it all began with the first legendary black tea flavored with golden orange rind and sweet spice "Constant Comment"Tea. Bigelow takes immense pride in providing the tea drinking community with the best tea at a great value. We only use hand- picked teas, real spices, flavors and herbs. The flavors and blends we have created are second to none. Some of our teas contain up to twenty different ingredients! And because tea is a leaf that can dry out we take steps to protect it. To keep the teas fresh, we seal our tea bags in protective packets. We simply have to protect those delightful flavors. That's why a cup of Bigelow Tea is aromatic and delicious; a true indulgence for the senses.

Pour 212F water over the tea and steep for 4 to 5 minutes. Remove the sachet. Relax and enjoy.

The Historic Royal Palaces organization helps everyone explore the story of how monarchs and people have shaped society, in some of the greatest palaces ever built.

review.user_review: Absolutely LOVE this tea brand and have MANY favorites. While this black tea is excellent in that it is NEVER bitter, the Black Currant is too subtle for my taste. That being said, it is still an absolutely marvelous tea, I just prefer stronger flavor notes in my teas. That is why Paris is still my number one favorite!!!  You just can't go wrong with this brand IMO.

description: Harney and sons was founded on a commitment to deliver customers the finest quality tea possible. This promise, made 30 years ago, serves as the company's guiding principle. Today, Harney and sons tea remains family owned and managed, with three generations of Harney's preserving their founder's tradition of fine tea and traveling the world in search of the finest ingredients. A Harney family collaboration gave rise to their ht line: unique and uncommon tea blending. Ht is grounded in the Harney tradition of providing the finest quality full-leaf teas and herbs. Ht blends are the result of true mastery in tea blending, bringing together the history in which tea steeps and the future tea possesses. Harney and sons' ht chocolate mint tea is a lovely after-dinner tea. China black is the base of this tea, which is blended with Oregon peppermint leaves for a mix of green and black leaves in your sachet. The mint in this tea makes it wonderfully refreshing, while sweet like a dessert from the chocolate. Comes to you in a beautiful tin containing 20 tea sachets.

description: Mike Harney has enjoyed many a pot of tea in the famous Parisian tea shops. In homage to the city, he created what's become one of Harney & Sons' most popular and beloved blends worldwide. Paris is a fruity black tea with vanilla and caramel flavors, and a hint of lemony Bergamot. The aroma is delightful!Mike Harney has enjoyed many a pot of tea in the famous Parisian tea shops. In homage to the city, he created what's become one of Harney & Sons' most popular and beloved blends worldwide. Paris is a fruity black tea with vanilla and caramel flavors, and a hint of lemony Bergamot. The aroma is delightful!Harney & Sons was founded on a commitment to deliver customers the finest quality tea possible. This promise, made 30 years ago, serves as the company's guiding principle. Today, Harney & Sons Tea remains family owned and managed, with three generations of Harney's preserving John's tradition of fine tea and traveling the world in search of the finest ingredients. It is not only the Harney mission to deliver quality tea products to their customers, but also to educate the world of tea history and taste. Whether through their dedicated customer service team, their published guides to tea drinking, or their two tea tasting shops, the Harney & Sons team works to pass on their passion of tea to a wide audience. From lugging heavy tea filled chests down their basement stairs, to stocking shelves at stores nationwide, Harney & Sons remains committed to delivering their customers a superior tea drinking experience.

review.user_review_title: Fantastic flavor, perfect balance, NO bitterness, ever!!!!!
review.user_review: I am a tea fanatic and drink many kinds.  I love this company's PARIS tea (also the Vanilla is wonderful) and since I also love green tea I tried this Pearl Jasmine. I am pleased to say it is absolutely wonderful, no bitterness and always the perfect balance flavor. I can't wait to try many others that Harney & Sons offer. Excellent quality tea!!!!!

description: Harney & Sons most popular flavored tea !! Three types of cinnamon are hand-blended into a delightful Asian black tea and accented with a hint of orange. The result is remarkably assertive tea. Harney & Sons Fine teas is proud to offer loose teas in stunning silken sachets. The perfect marriage of loose tea quality and teabag convenience, these sachets meet the demands of even the most discriminating tea drinker. About Harney & Sons It started more than 30 years ago, when American tea was a poor commodity drunk only as teabags. John Harnev?s hobby of blending teas blossomed from pastime to passion, and Harney & Sons Teas was born. John?s goal was simple: to offer the finrse teas at an everyday price, making tea an everyday luxury. Today John Harney and his sons Michael and Paul search the tea gardens of the world to bring their customers the cream of the crop. Their delicious blends ? and commitment to the quality and consistency - have made Harney & Sons a top name in tea providers. Beyond home use, Harney & Sons Teas are available in many of the finest restaurants, hotels and gourmet shops across the country. Ranging front robust First Flush Darjeeling to delicate Mutan White, Harney & Sons? more than 200 varieties of tea are designed to suit our cttstomers? every mood. Personally sourced and professionally blended, they meet the highest standards of taste and aroma. From the tea garden to the tea cup, Harney & Sons is the best source for fine teas.

product.title: Harney & Sons Classic Hot Cinnamon Spice Tea, 20 Tea Sachets, 1.4 oz
features: Our most popular flavored tea worldwide, Hot Cinnamon Spice is an assertive blend of black teas, three types of cinnamon, orange peel, and sweet cloves.

This is one of our oldest flavored tea blends. John Harney developed it in the beginning of the 1980s. Over the decades its popularity has only grown, and now it is our most popular tea. People love its combination of strong spices and sweetness. And since there are no sugars (we tested it), it is safe for everyone to enjoy.
China black is the base of this tea so the leaves are dark brown. There are pieces of cinnamon bark and orange peel covered with cinnamon dust.
Brewing instructions: Use boiling water (212F) and pour over sachet. Brew for 4 to 5 minutes.
Ingredients: Black tea, orange peel, cinnamon, cloves. Contains Natural & Artificial flavors

review.user_review: Great NATURAL cold brew ice tea!!!  Have used this for years, all year round, and love the fact it is quick and easy, and all natural. Great value on Amazon.  The Peach flavor is so tasty it needs no sweetener at all. Delicious drink with ZERO calories. Works for me!!

description: Celestial Seasonings Peach Cool Brew Iced Tea allows you to make a refreshing, ice-cold beverage in just 5 minutes. Our blend of black tea and natural fruit flavors brews in cold water, eliminating the hassle of boiling water in a teapot or microwave. With zero calories and just 5 mg. of caffeine per serving, our iced tea is ideal for drinking almost any time of day. Simply steep one iced tea bag in 8 fluid ounces of cool water for 5-10 minutes. To reduce excess waste, our peach tea bags are stringless and come packaged in recycled boxes. Includes six 40-count boxes of Celestial Seasonings Peach Cool Brew Iced Tea. Celestial Seasonings teas are an invitation to bring the perfect balance to your day. From herbal teas to chai and matcha lattes and everything in between, there’s a Celestial blend that’s just right for any occasion. We blend our teas using the finest herbs, teas, spices and botanicals available, and we lovingly package them in engaging, thoughtful boxes that truly represent the goodness found inside.

features: VANILLA BEAN: Mighty Leaf's Vanilla Bean tea combines the rich, bold flavor of Ceylon and China black teas with naturally sweet vanilla for a full-bodied, fruity cup of tea that's perfect for a dessert-like treat any time. Enjoy plain or sweetened.

BLACK TEA POUCHES: Black tea, sourced as whole loose leaf tea & crafted in our commercially compostable silken tea pouches, delivers health benefits along with an unsurpassed flavor experience. Taste flavors too big for ordinary tea bags with Mighty Leaf.

PUT THE KETTLE ON: Mighty Leaf's innovative Whole Leaf Tea blends bring you the boldest flavor with all the benefits of the full tea leaf. Brew it with our tea bags or use your own infuser or tea ball with our loose leaf tea. Enjoy the whole flavor.

AT MIGHTY LEAF we're passionate about sharing the whole leaf tea experience with tea enthusiasts around the world. Our teas showcase larger, bolder tea leaves, giving you a complex taste you can’t find anywhere else.

review.user_review_title: Fantastic Vanilla aroma, but NO discernible taste of Vanilla.

That being said, as stated, this BRAND is excellent, but I prefer the PARIS flavor best so far.

product.details: {"Brand": "KOPABANA", "Variety": "Alligator Pepper", "Item Form": "10 pods", "Unit Count": "10.00 Count", "Specialty": "Organic", "Package Dimensions": "8.6 x 4.8 x 1.4 inches; 3.21 Ounces", "UPC": "054491258440", "Manufacturer": "KOPABANA", "Country of Origin": "Ghana"}
product.title: KOPABANA (10 Pods) Organic Alligator Pepper/Mbongo Pepper Spice Seed Pods/Non-GMO/Guinea Pepper -
features: Spice Up Any Dish Use Alligator Pepper in any dish of your choosing to wow your dinner guests, or simply spice up your everyday meals. Once you try this spice for the first time, you’ll understand just what all of your meals have been missing, and you’ll never be able to look back!

Alligator Pepper is the bright, dynamic, punchy West African spice that works with every dish! Its name deriving from the reptilian-like bark on the seeds’ pod, you’ll be able to amaze all of your family and friends with the elevated meals you create with Alligator Pepper!

THE QUALITY OF ALLIGATOR PEPPER: Alligator Pepper, one of the most luxurious yet popular spices in West Africa, is sold as an entire pod containing the pepper seeds. Native to the swampy habitats along the West African coast, Alligator Pepper adds a more dynamic flavor to dishes when compared to other, more common spices.

AMAZING HEALTH BENEFITS: Not only does it add eccentric flavor to meals, but Alligator Pepper also provides as a good source of various minerals, such as calcium, magnesium, and zinc. Additionally, Alligator Pepper contains a surplus of antioxidants, providing numerous benefits to help reduce inflammation in the body!

MULTIPLE USES: Alligator Pepper can be used as a spicy aroma in soups and stews, or added as flavoring to various rices. Additionally, since it is sold as a whole pod, you can grind the pepper to your preference, either finely or coarsely, allowing you to control the spice factor in any dish you cook. Finally, Alligator Pepper can be used as an excellent spice rub for fish and other meats — just toast the peppers in a pan first!

INSTRUCTIONS: It is recommended to pound a single whole pod of Alligator Pepper in a pestle and mortar prior to adding to foods, but Alligator Pepper can be used in variety of flexible ways that best suit your cooking needs. Try crushing the seeds to release the most wonderful combination of flavor notes!

A little Frito-Lay history

In 1932, Herman Lay, the founder of the H.W. Lay Co., started selling LAY’S potato chips right out of his Ford Model A. Now, 75 years later, LAY’S chips are still being made with genuine, trusted ingredients. And after nearly a century in the “chip business,” we’re not stopping anytime soon. Enjoy the traditional taste of LAY’S Sour Cream and Onion Flavor Potato Chips all on their own, pair them with your favorite dip, or mix things up with your own culinary creation. The trusted taste of LAY’S Sour Cream and Onion Flavor Potato Chips makes them a perfect ingredient for many delicious recipes.
Recipe inspiration
Take the tasty adventure beyond the bag, and use LAY’S chips to whip up something delicious enough to gather the whole family around.
Sour Cream and Onion Flavor Chicken Chips
Description
Give dinner a tasty twist with LAY’S Sour Cream and Onion Flavor Potato Chips.
Ingredients:
2 – 8 oz chicken breasts
½ cup flour
4 eggs, beaten
1 large bag LAY'S Sour Cream & Onion Flavored Potato Chips, crushed fine

This recipe and others are available on the Frito-Lay website at www.fritolay.com/recipes. Disclosure: Frito-Lay is not liable or responsible for the outcome of any recipes from this website, as the ingredients used cannot be controlled nor can the environment where the recipe is made.
Instructions:
1. Between 2 sheets of plastic wrap, pound chicken breast with a mallet to a ¼-inch thickness.
2. Remove the top layer of plastic wrap, and dust the flattened chicken breasts with flour.
3. Use a brush to lightly brush the egg onto the floured breasts until coated.
4. Place chicken breasts, egg side down, onto a baking sheet lined with a bed of crushed LAY'S chips.
5. Dust the bare side of the chicken breasts with flour, brush them with egg until coated, and then cover them with crushed LAY'S Sour Cream & Onion Flavored Potato Chips.
6. With a small rolling pin, roll the chip-covered chicken breasts to approximately ¼-inch thickness.
7. Using a round cookie cutter stamp out the chicken “chips.”
8. Place chicken chips on a sheet pan and bake at 325°F for 10 minutes or until an internal temperature reaches 165°F.
