Chocolate Chip & LAY’S Potato Chip Cookies (Gluten Free)
Description
Try this recipe for a delicious twist on the traditional chocolate chip cookie. LAY’S perfectly seasoned chips give a salty-sweet crunch with every bite.
Ingredients:
5 oz LAY'S Classic Potato Chips (about 4 cups or 75 chips), processed till finely minced but not mealy
2 cups all-purpose gluten-free baking flour or your favorite blend
1/2 tsp xanthan gum or guar gum
1/4 tsp sea salt
2 tsps baking powder
1/2 tsp baking soda
1 1/2 cups light brown sugar
1/2 cup canola oil or butter (chewy or crisp)
1 1/2 Tbsps vanilla extract
2 Tbsps agave nectar
1/2 cup brewed coffee
2 tablespoons unsweetened coconut
1 egg
1/2 cup miniature milk chocolate chips

Recipe created by: Susan Magrini of Cooking with Diabetes. This recipe and others are available on the Frito-Lay website at www.fritolay.com/recipes. Disclosure: Frito-Lay is not liable or responsible for the outcome of any recipes from this website, as the ingredients used cannot be controlled nor can the environment where the recipe is made.
Instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F.
2. Process 4 cups of LAY'S Classic Potato Chips and weigh until you have 5 ounces (about half the bag).
3. In a large bowl, whisk together baking powder, xanthan gum, salt, baking powder and baking soda.
4. Stir in the brown sugar and mix until combined.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk together the oil (or butter), vanilla extract, agave and half cup of brewed coffee.
6. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, stirring until smooth. If the dough is too stiff, add more coffee as needed to soften. The finished dough should be thick.
7. Stir in the potato chips.
8. Roll dough into walnut-size balls and place 2 inches apart onto a sheet pan lined with parchment paper. Bake on the bottom rack for 15 to 17 minutes.
9. Remove from oven to cool for 5 minutes, then transfer cookies to a cooling rack.
10. Repeat until all dough is used.

description: When it comes to kettle style chips, nothing beats the thick, home-style crunch of LAY’S Kettle Cooked Potato Chips. LAY’S Sea Salt & Vinegar Flavored Kettle Cooked Potato Chips are a crunchy thick slice of home-style taste. Each lip-smacking batch is uniquely made to deliver a hearty crunch that will surely satisfy even the most discerning potato chip aficionado. Take a minute to relax, unwind, and savor–one delicious bite at a time.
Crafted with Care
LAY’S Sea Salt & Vinegar Flavored Kettle Cooked Potato Chips are made with a perfect blend of sea salt and a measure of bright tangy vinegar for kick; few flavors pair so perfectly with potato chips.
So What Makes a LAY’S Potato Chip “Kettle Cooked”?

Step 1. LAY'S starts with quality farm-grown potatoes and slices them nice and thick.Step 2. Small batches of thick-sliced potatoes go into a kettle.Step 3. A unique, slow cooking process creates extra-crunchy potato chips.Step 4. Authentic, real ingredients and delicious flavors are then added.Step 5. Finished potato chips are immediately packaged.Step 6. Grab a handful and enjoy every last crunchy bite.
Perfect for Every Occasion

From the everyday snack to the impromptu get-together, LAY’S Sea Salt & Vinegar Flavored Kettle Cooked Potato Chips are the perfect addition to any occasion. And with LAY’S take-home bags, you can share more delicious flavor by the handful.
Convenient 8.5-ounce bag. Perfect for sharing at home with friends or at picnics; they make a pantry staple the entire family will enjoy.
Convenient 8.5-ounce bag. Perfect for sharing at home with friends or at picnics; they make a pantry staple the entire family will enjoy.

LAY’S Sea Salt & Vinegar Flavored Kettle Cooked Potato Chips are thicker cut and cooked in smaller batches than our regular potato chips using a process that creates the hard-bite crunch potato chip fans have come to love.

LAY’S Sea Salt & Vinegar Flavored Kettle Cooked Potato Chips are thicker cut and cooked in smaller batches than our regular potato chips using a process that creates the hard-bite crunch potato chip fans have come to love.
We start with farm-grown potatoes, so the ingredients are trusted and fresh-tasting.
We start with farm-grown potatoes, so the ingredients are trusted and fresh-tasting.
LAY’S Sea Salt & Vinegar Flavored Kettle Cooked Potato Chips do not contain gluten ingredients, artificial flavors, or preservatives.
LAY’S Sea Salt & Vinegar Flavored Kettle Cooked Potato Chips do not contain gluten ingredients, artificial flavors, or preservatives.
Every bag of LAY’S Kettle Cooked Chips is packed fresh and delivered straight to you from Frito-Lay, the snack company you know and trust.
Every bag of LAY’S Kettle Cooked Chips is packed fresh and delivered straight to you from Frito-Lay, the snack company you know and trust.
A Little Frito-Lay History

In 1932, Herman Lay, the founder of the H.W. Lay Co., started selling LAY’S potato chips right out of his Ford Model A. Now, LAY’S chips are still being made with genuine, trusted ingredients. And after nearly a century in the “chip business,” we’re not stopping any time soon. Here at Frito-Lay, we continue to innovate so that we can provide reliable, well-crafted products that are as good as they are fun.

review.user_review:
I enjoy these wintergreen flavored lifesavers. The flavor is refreshing without being too intense or overpowering. I also like the texture of these lifesavers. They are not as hard as conventional lifesavers; they have a softer texture, which is more enjoyable to chew as it crushes gently.

Each mint is individually wrapped, which makes these a great choice for candy dishes.

I usually have one to two after lunch and my breath feels fresh for the rest of the afternoon. A good choice of breath-fresheners!

I enjoy these wintergreen flavored lifesavers. The flavor is refreshing without being too intense or overpowering. I also like the texture of these lifesavers. They are not as hard as conventional lifesavers; they have a softer texture, which is more enjoyable to chew as it crushes gently.

I usually have one to two after lunch and my breath feels fresh for the rest of the afternoon. A good choice of breath-fresheners!

description: Product Description

These hard-candy mints are ideal for freshening your breath after morning coffee or a long lunch break or as a sweet treat in the afternoon. Keep a pack at your desk or, better yet, become the office champion and share some Life Savers Mints with those in need. After all, isn't it time you enjoyed the minty side of simple?

description: Elevate your homemade meals with the rich, full-bodied flavor of Swanson Natural Goodness 33% Less Sodium (1) Chicken Broth. Swanson lower sodium (1) chicken broth brings together the perfectly balanced flavors of farm-raised chicken and fresh-picked vegetables with 33% less sodium (1). And just like homemade, our lower sodium (1) broth is 100% natural and non-GMO, with no MSG added (2), no artificial flavors or colors, and no preservatives. More convenient than chicken bouillon, this gluten-free chicken broth is a versatile ingredient for your everyday cooking, adding flavor and moisture to both entrees and side dishes. It’s great as a soup base, and it can be used instead of water to boost rich flavor in rice, pasta and veggies. Swanson Chicken Broth is a must-have-for your holiday cooking, bringing richer, elevated homemade flavor to mashed potatoes, stuffing and more. It’s not just any broth. It’s Swanson. In addition to chicken broth, Swanson offers a variety of other delicious broths, including Beef and Vegetable. (1) Contains 570mg sodium per 1 cup serving vs. 860mg sodium per 1 cup serving of regular Swanson chicken broth (2) Except for the small amount naturally occurring in yeast extract

description: Featuring all the benefits and great taste of slow-cooked broth, LonoLife's Paleo/Keto-friendly, protein-packed, and nutrient-dense reduced sodium chicken bone broth keeps you fueled when you're crunched for time — at home, at the office, in a college dorm, or on the road. Ideal for those following low carb, Paleo, and Keto diets, this easy-to-digest broth is packed with collagen-rich protein and fiber that provides a number of different health benefits — from improving joint health to nourishing hair, skin, and nails to improving digestive and immune systems. LonoLife makes its chicken bone broths the old-fashioned way with the highest quality ingredients, hearty roasted bones and a rich, savory blend of chicory root, sage, thyme, black pepper, and sea salt — and a variety of herbs and spices that's a carefully guarded family secret. Reduced sodium chicken bone broth is available in a scoopable 8-ounce container that provides 15 servings. LonoLife Reduced Sodium Chicken Bone Broth has 10 grams of protein per serving. LonoLife creates healthy, Paleo-Keto friendly bone broth soup that is convenient for busy, active, and healthy lifestyles.

review.user_review: This broth tastes like a whole, oven roasted chicken... however I did make a mistake.. I was really trying for the bone broth.  I will use this.. but going back for the bone broth.  This broth offers 25 calories per packet - (there are 4 tubes per box - makes 8 oz when mixed with hot water) - 700mg sodium (they do offer a lo so version)  - 2g total carbs - zero sugar and zero dietary fiber. Less than 1gm protein (go for the bone broth - it packs 9 or 10gms of protein).  Ingredients: chicory root, soup base (salt, yeast extract, natural flavors), chicken broth, dried chicken, torula yeast, chicken flavor (yeast extract, salt, maltodextrin, natural flavors), sage, thyme, black pepper.  Arrived quickly and in excellent condition ( I have prime). The expiration on the boxes was excellent as well - Aug 15, 2021.  These tubes are AWESOME for traveling - which is what I mostly use them for.  I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful!

review.user_review_title: Pacific Foods ginger chicken bone broth
review.user_review:
UPDATE BELOW...I LOVE this flavor and the individual size is so good for many reasons. I just wish I could find it locally more easily. It's a rich chicken bone broth with a light ginger add to the flavor - it's the perfect balance for my tastes - but everyone likes something different! Bottom line is I like the flavor - and the protein punch of a tasty bone broth. Pacific Foods offers the best taste and best quality version in my opinion.
UPDATE: 10/09/2021 Sad to say that I got the wrong soup and it is really a hassle to return it for refund. Looking for a new outlet. The broth is 5 star - but I only like the chicken ginger - NOT the salt free plain chicken. Eh. If they didn't have the right flavor, they should not have just randomly decided I might like the salt free plain chicken. Uh - NO. Now I have to arrange a return. All a waste of my time.
UPDATE: 10/10/21.. I did receive a full refund and will donate the wrong item sent to the food bank. While the Pacific Foods product is a 5 star product, I will be seeking other outlets. I do appreciate the refund as this was not my fault in any way.

description: Pacific Foods Organic Bone Broth is a delicious, satisfying addition to your everyday routine. We slow-simmer organic chicken bones with onion, vinegar, ginger and sea salt for a savory bone broth full of naturally occurring protein. Traditionally sipped by the cup, this bone broth is ready to drink—just pour, heat and enjoy! This broth is great for anyone with special dietary needs, as it is gluten-free, soy-free, wheat-free and yeast-free. At Pacific Foods, we believe that making foods we're proud of is as much about the ingredients we use as it is about the actual recipe. We steer clear of additives, preservatives and common allergens, and GMOs. The way we see it, nature knows how foods should taste, and we just try to follow her lead.

And speaking of milk, each cup of siggi's® yogurt uses 4x the amount of milk than a regular cup of yogurt – making it rich in protein without all the sugar. siggi's® yogurt is thick and creamy – ideal as an addition to breakfast, a nutritious snack, or an afternoon pick-me-up. Pair with your favorite toppings, like fresh berries and granola, or enjoy as is. target.user_review: Fab gum

description: The iconic “chunk-shaped” gum, America’s #1-selling twist-wrap gum is individually wrapped and available in a variety of tasty flavors: Original (the classic, perfectly-pink twist), Pink-Lemonade, Blue-Razz, Apple, Sour Cherry, Grape, and Watermelon.   Created in 1928 by Fleer Candy Company accountant Walter Diemer (he claims he stumbled upon the recipe by accident), the gum featured comic strip featuring brothers Dub and Bub (replaced in 1950 by Pud). It grew in popularity and was even distributed as part of military rations during World War II. It also was part of the first-ever gum five-pack (1957).   Dubble Bubble joined the Tootsie family in 2003, adding its standing as the world’s favorite bubble gum brand to the world’s favorite candy lineup.

target.user_review:
Diamond Almonds
Almonds are a good source of magnesium. One ounce contain approximately 20% of the RDA for an adult recommended dietary allowance (RDA)
Recommended Dietary Allowance (RDA) the amounts of selected nutrients considered adequate to meet the known nutrient needs of healthy people. The RDA is based on scientific knowledge and has been presented by a committee of the Food and Nutrition Board (FNB) of the National Academy of Sciences (NAS). The Canadian equivalent is the Recommended Nutrient Intakes. RDA is generally accepted throughout the world as a valid source of information. At least 40 different nations have as well as organizations have published standards similar to the RDA.

Magnesium is the fourth most abundant mineral in the body and is essential to good health. Approximately 50% of total body magnesium is found in bone. The other half is found predominantly inside cells of body tissues and organs. Only 1% of magnesium is found in blood, but the body works very hard to keep blood levels of magnesium constant.
Magnesium is needed for more than 300 biochemical reactions in the body. It helps maintain normal muscle and nerve function, keeps heart rhythm steady, supports a healthy immune system, and keeps bones strong. Magnesium also helps regulate blood sugar levels, promotes normal blood pressure, and is known to be involved in energy metabolism and protein synthesis. There is an increased interest in the role of magnesium in preventing and managing disorders such as hypertension, cardiovascular disease, and diabetes. Dietary magnesium is absorbed in the small intestines. Are you taking enough magnesium in the diet? The recommended daily allowance is 300mgs/day for men, 350mgs for women. Magnesium is extremely safe by mouth - too much simply causes diarrhea. Try increasing the amount of magnesium you take by mouth until it causes diarrhea, then reduce the dose slightly so it does not. This is called taking magnesium to bowel tolerance (just like using vitamin C to bowel tolerance.

Almonds are a good source of Fiber.
One ounce contains approximately 12% of the RDA for an adult.
So, in summary, Almonds are a very healthy snack, so what's left to say?

Two things:
1st be cautious about "bowel tolerance" or "happy bowels" if you prefer.
2nd Taste. I realize that taste is a personal thing. That's why they make chocolate, strawberry, and vanilla.

Here's my current favorites"

1st Blue Diamond Dark mint dark chocolate (reminds me of the chocolate mint Girl Scout Cookies with less sugar).

2nd Blue diamond Dark Chocolate Oven Roasted
3rd Blue diamond Blue Butter Toffee
4thd Blue Diamond Almonds Bold Habanero BBQ (reminds me of BBQ potato chips again with less sugar).
5th Bold Blazin Buffalo Wing
6th Blue Diamond Almonds Cinnamon Brown Sugar
7th Blue Diamond Almonds Lime `n Chili
8th Blue Diamond Almonds Smokehouse
9th Bold Wasabi & Soy Sauce

But that's just me: you might have a completely different take on these flavors.
4th and 5th are very close.

Gunner
May, 2012

review.user_review:
Diamond Almonds
Almonds are a good source of magnesium. One ounce contain approximately 20% of the RDA for an adult recommended dietary allowance (RDA)
Recommended Dietary Allowance (RDA) the amounts of selected nutrients considered adequate to meet the known nutrient needs of healthy people. The RDA is based on scientific knowledge and has been presented by a committee of the Food and Nutrition Board (FNB) of the National Academy of Sciences (NAS). The Canadian equivalent is the Recommended Nutrient Intakes. RDA is generally accepted throughout the world as a valid source of information. At least 40 different nations have as well as organizations have published standards similar to the RDA.

Magnesium is the fourth most abundant mineral in the body and is essential to good health. Approximately 50% of total body magnesium is found in bone. The other half is found predominantly inside cells of body tissues and organs. Only 1% of magnesium is found in blood, but the body works very hard to keep blood levels of magnesium constant.
Magnesium is needed for more than 300 biochemical reactions in the body. It helps maintain normal muscle and nerve function, keeps heart rhythm steady, supports a healthy immune system, and keeps bones strong. Magnesium also helps regulate blood sugar levels, promotes normal blood pressure, and is known to be involved in energy metabolism and protein synthesis. There is an increased interest in the role of magnesium in preventing and managing disorders such as hypertension, cardiovascular disease, and diabetes. Dietary magnesium is absorbed in the small intestines. Are you taking enough magnesium in the diet? The recommended daily allowance is 300mgs/day for men, 350mgs for women. Magnesium is extremely safe by mouth - too much simply causes diarrhea. Try increasing the amount of magnesium you take by mouth until it causes diarrhea, then reduce the dose slightly so it does not. This is called taking magnesium to bowel tolerance (just like using vitamin C to bowel tolerance.

Almonds are a good source of Fiber.
One ounce contains approximately 12% of the RDA for an adult.
So, in summary, Almonds are a very healthy snack, so what's left to say?

Two things:
1st be cautious about "bowel tolerance" or "happy bowels" if you prefer.
2nd Taste. I realize that taste is a personal thing. That's why they make chocolate, strawberry, and vanilla.

Here's my current favorites"

1st Blue Diamond Dark mint dark chocolate (reminds me of the chocolate mint Girl Scout Cookies with less sugar).

2nd Blue diamond Dark Chocolate Oven Roasted
3rd Blue diamond Blue Butter Toffee

review.user_review:
Diamond Almonds
Almonds are a good source of magnesium. One ounce contain approximately 20% of the RDA for an adult recommended dietary allowance (RDA)
Recommended Dietary Allowance (RDA) the amounts of selected nutrients considered adequate to meet the known nutrient needs of healthy people. The RDA is based on scientific knowledge and has been presented by a committee of the Food and Nutrition Board (FNB) of the National Academy of Sciences (NAS). The Canadian equivalent is the Recommended Nutrient Intakes. RDA is generally accepted throughout the world as a valid source of information. At least 40 different nations have as well as organizations have published standards similar to the RDA.

Magnesium is the fourth most abundant mineral in the body and is essential to good health. Approximately 50% of total body magnesium is found in bone. The other half is found predominantly inside cells of body tissues and organs. Only 1% of magnesium is found in blood, but the body works very hard to keep blood levels of magnesium constant.
Magnesium is needed for more than 300 biochemical reactions in the body. It helps maintain normal muscle and nerve function, keeps heart rhythm steady, supports a healthy immune system, and keeps bones strong. Magnesium also helps regulate blood sugar levels, promotes normal blood pressure, and is known to be involved in energy metabolism and protein synthesis. There is an increased interest in the role of magnesium in preventing and managing disorders such as hypertension, cardiovascular disease, and diabetes. Dietary magnesium is absorbed in the small intestines. Are you taking enough magnesium in the diet? The recommended daily allowance is 300mgs/day for men, 350mgs for women. Magnesium is extremely safe by mouth - too much simply causes diarrhea. Try increasing the amount of magnesium you take by mouth until it causes diarrhea, then reduce the dose slightly so it does not. This is called taking magnesium to bowel tolerance (just like using vitamin C to bowel tolerance.

Almonds are a good source of Fiber.
One ounce contains approximately 12% of the RDA for an adult.
So, in summary, Almonds are a very healthy snack, so what's left to say?

Two things:
1st be cautious about "bowel tolerance" or "happy bowels" if you prefer.
2nd Taste. I realize that taste is a personal thing. That's why they make chocolate, strawberry, and vanilla.

Here's my current favorites"

1st Blue Diamond Dark mint dark chocolate (reminds me of the chocolate mint Girl Scout Cookies with less sugar).

2nd Blue diamond Dark Chocolate Oven Roasted
3rd Blue diamond Blue Butter Toffee
4thd Blue Diamond Almonds Bold Habanero BBQ (reminds me of BBQ potato chips again with less sugar).
5th Bold Blazin Buffalo Wing
6th Blue Diamond Almonds Cinnamon Brown Sugar
7th Blue Diamond Almonds Lime `n Chili
8th Blue Diamond Almonds Smokehouse
9th Bold Wasabi & Soy Sauce

But that's just me: you might have a completely different take on these flavors.
4th and 5th are very close.

Gunner
May, 2012

description: It's not easy to turn off your chocolate cravings and give up sweets. Now you don't have to. Our Dark Chocolate Oven-Roasted Almonds are covered in real cocoa powder and loaded with rich chocolate flavor, blended with just the right amount of sugar and naturally no-calorie stevia extract. By combining the creamy rich flavor of real dark chocolate with our almonds, packed with nutrition and naturally loaded with vitamin E, we turned a tough challenge into a delicious snack you can enjoy every day.

target.user_review:
Eating a bowl of Cheerios is a bland affair. The only reason to eat it over its many variants is that it’s not only the healthiest among them but one of the healthiest cereals on (in) the market. It’s toasted whole grain oats and not much else. You’d have to read the ingredients list to even know there’s a tiny amount of sugar added. It’s also GMO-free, which makes it a top breakfast choice for healthy living. Almost any other Cheerios tastes better; General Mills suggests adding fresh strawberries; but, for what’s it’s worth, the plain yellow box will keep you living longer.

marcellee.com

review.user_review:
Fruity Pebbles; imagine flattened Rice Krispies tie-dyed in various colors; tasted better when I was a kid. That taste was never really fruity, despite the name, but the distinct (artificial) flavor it does have was stronger and sweeter. Perhaps the Flintstones became health-conscious and decided to go with less sugar. Perhaps my taste buds have changed over the millennia. I don’t know, but eating a bowl of Fruity Pebbles, or several small bowls to avoid milk sog, has gone from an experience that was great to one that’s merely good.

marcellee.com

review.user_review:
The problem with Vanilla Chex is that they’re mixed with regular Chex. The cereal consists of both sugar-coated Chex flavored with natural vanilla and plain rice Chex, in other words, which results in a sort of anticlimactic eating experience. The two don’t mix particularly well because you (I) typically have a craving for one or the other. Imagine eating a bowl of Cinnamon Toast Crunch if half of it didn’t have any cinnamon, or sugar, on it.

marcellee.com

description: At General Mills, we’ve been making food people love for more than 150 years, including some of your family's favorite cereals. Whether you love Honey Nut Cheerios or Wheaties, Lucky Charms or Cinnamon Toast Crunch, you can feel good about loving cereal. All Big G cereals have at least 10 grams of whole grain per serving, and are fortified with vitamins and minerals. In addition, 75% of our cereals today are made without artificial flavors or colors from artificial sources, and have been that way for a long time. We're also working to remove those ingredients from the rest of our cereals.

review.user_review:
This cereal, one of Mom’s Best, is a more natural version of Post’s Cocoa Pebbles. That one has artificial flavor added. This one doesn’t. There are four main ingredients; rice, sugar, coconut oil and cocoa, but it’s the latter that gives the cereal its sweet chocolatey flavor. The aftermilk reminds me of those little cartons of chocolate milk we used to drink in elementary school.

review.user_review:
Make no mistake about it. Berry Colossal Crunch is a direct rip-off of Cap’n Crunch’s Crunch Berries right down to the name. The main difference with this version is that it has marshmallows added, and marshmallows; the little nonfluffy kind traditionally found in cereals marketed to kids; can make even the blandest brands taste good. It’s sugar central, as your pancreas may remind you later in life, but health smealth. When added to a cereal that already tastes good, the level of deliciousness begins to peak the scales. This aftermilk alone, colored with a sweet blend of synthetic dyes; Blue 1 plus Red 40 plus Yellow 5 and 6; could be bottled as a separate drink.

marcellee.com

review.user_review:
Oh yes. This cereal is delicious. It's O-shaped corn pieces with "good things in the middle", like real oatmeal. This is a Quaker product, after all. The caramel-like taste, which I'd compare to Cap'n Crunch or old school Mr T, Gremlins and Batman cereal, is sweetened with honey, graham (cracker) flour and brown sugar.

It's not a good-tasting but a great-tasting cereal, easily one of the best I've ever tried. But; get this; it's too crunchy. No, it wont get soggy in milk, at-least not in any reasonable amount of time, but that's the problem because it makes for a hard chew. If it had the texture and consistency of, say, Cheerios, it'd be perfect.

marcellee.com

target.user_review_title: EXTREMELY salty, and I love salt!  TOOOOO salty!
target.user_review: I tasted the salt long after eating it....even when I wake up the next morning!  And I am the first to complain when pretzels aren't salty ENOUGH!  Salt is one of my vices.  This is just crazy, sickeningly salty.  And it wasn't just one bag.  I love popcorn so much that if my favorite brand of popcorn isn't on sale, but this brand is, I have purchased it a few times.  However, I actually worried about the amount of salt being so bad for my health for the first time with this particular brand!  Just a warning.

description: Product Description

Back when Dan and I first started popping popcorn in our Mankato garage, we wanted to teach our kids the value of hard work and have a little fun along the way. We also wanted a snack we felt good about feeding them. Hugely flavorful snacks made with real, simple ingredients -- you know, ingredients you don’t have to scrunch up your face to say. Snacks packed with positivity, not guilt. Snacks that keep the joy in everyday snacking (and snacking and snacking…). With bright bags that radiate all the love and fun that went into them from the beginning. After all, isn’t that what snacking should be about? We couldn’t agree more. Enjoy. XO, Angie Always simple. Always real. 100% awesome. Perfectly sea-salted, this otherwise classic popcorn clocks in at a mind-boggling 35 calories per cup. This 9 oz family sized-offering featuring a resealable zip top is big enough to share, but we won’t tell if you don’t. From your lunch tote to a wine-filled romcom night with the girls, you’re about to get snack-cessful up in here.
From the Manufacturer
Real, simple ingredients.

Nothing but ingredients you’ll love! BOOMCHICKAPOP is certified gluten-free and uses non-GMO ingredients in all products. Nothing artificial. Our great-tasting popcorn is also made with 100% whole grains. It’s a better-for-you snack with one-of-a-kind flavor
The brand’s heart and soul.

A founder with vision, honesty and a contagious spirit. Angie’s belief in doing things differently led the way for BOOMCHICKAPOP. With her husband, Dan, Angie has brought a new spark and attitude to everyday snacking. Angie’s bringing the boom with BOOMCHICKAPOP.
100% whole grains.

BOOMCHICKAPOP popcorn is made from 100% whole grains. Popcorn that’s packed with the power to energize you throughout your day. It’s a nutritious snack that makes you feel your best so you can be your best.
Fun and flavorful.
Our name says it all. Where there’s BOOMCHICKAPOP you’ll find bold flavors and a whole lotta fun. Reach for a better-for-you snack and live each and every day with a positive, upbeat attitude.
Small handcrafted batches.
Our values are from southern Minnesota, where there’s only one way of doing things — the right way. BOOMCHICKAPOP has always been and will always be prepared right by the hands of people who care.
Get real, bold flavors.

BOOMCHICKAPOP popcorn is delicious and nutritious for any time of the week. Enjoy Sweet & Spicy Popcorn, Lightly Sweet Popcorn, Sweet & Salty Kettle Corn, Sea Salt Popcorn, White Cheddar Popcorn, Caramel & Cheddar Popcorn Mix, Salted Caramel Popcorn and Sweet Barbeque Popcorn.
About the Startup
Describe your product in 3 words.
Real, simple ingredients.
How did you come up with the idea for this product?

Angie and Dan Bastian wanted to do something fun with their kids while showing them the value of hard work. The dedicated Spanish teacher and nurse practitioner started with a huge kettle in their garage. Bag by bag, event by event, their amazing recipe turned into a booming business.
What makes your product special?

BOOMCHICKAPOP will never compromise on what’s right. It’s a brand with a larger-than-life soul and a company with a fun purpose to live carefree without apologizing for doing so. BOOMCHICKAPOP is a better way to add more flavorful fun to your movin’-and-groovin’ life.
What has been the best part of your startup experience?

We work with the best employees. Retired teachers. Grandparents. Teenagers. Hardworking parents. The list goes on. We individually surprised all of our original employees with a gift after we were bought. Let’s just say we changed some lives forever. It was truly amazing.

review.user_review: The first thing I noticed about Angie's Boom Chicka Pop Popcorn is how remarkably fresh it tastes with the wonderful crunch of fresh popcorn!  I really like that this popcorn has sea salt, but NOT too much. This actually has a few less calories than Skinny Pop, which IS GREAT!  I do miss the somewhat more buttery taste that Skinny Pop has...which I don't know how they do since this popcorn and Skinny Pop claim to have almost the exact same ingredients.  Delicious popcorn, and I recommend it.

review.user_review:
Skinny Pop is not too salty, too dry or too greasy. It is tender but crunchy...I don't know how they managed that. To me, it is just delicious. Of course, I love that it is so low calories and has NO Trans Fat and NO Cholesterol. I had actually quit eating popcorn before Skinny Pop because the Low Fat popcorn was dried out and tasteless, and the only other kind you could find was either loaded with the artificial Butter taste, or too greasy....or both! I highly recommend your trying Skinny Pop.

description: Do you remember old-fashioned, buttered popcorn? Like the popcorn you can still get at movie theatres? We do. In fact, we used to make it. It was heavy on buttery topping and other artificial flavors. Our fans asked us for something with less topping, but with that same great taste, and we came up with SkinnyPop – skinny on ingredients! We don’t think anyone should feel guilty about snacking on our products. Popcorn is a whole grain food – it contains the entire kernel. Because of this, it is high in fiber, rich in nutrients and has a low glycemic index. There is “no artificial anything” in our products – meaning we do not add any artificial or synthetic ingredients, colors, flavors, or preservatives to them. No Artificial Anything and still DELICIOUS.

target.user_review:
I changed my review from three star to one star since the top reviewers on this item are misleading shoppers by claiming such statements that are not true at all like """According to Nutiva, no hexane is used in the processing of this oil. Hexane is a petroleum-derived solvent used in all kinds of industrial applications, from shoe manufacturing to roofing. Interestingly, because hexane's primary molecular structure is carbon, it can be passed off as "organic." Do a little research; "cold-pressed," "organic," AND "hexane-free" are key considerations when selecting your coconut oil for nutrition purposes."""

This is the same VCO that is sold by all other producers except the real quality VCO producers where they use hand press which costs more since there is no heat or no hexane, it is all hand labored. The same VCO that is sold in the big box store for four a pound is the same as this. All you need to do is read their supplier and you will see that this VCO is produced by the same huge conglomerates in Asia that produce for everyone else and supplying their coconut for this brand as well as all other VCO brands except once again only a handful brands that prouce hand pressed. This is a brand that used to claim EXTRA VCO few years ago but now due to so much competition and so many VCO producers, they have removed that marketing word "VIRGIN" completely when there was never ever any virgin VCO for sell at all. This is not the highest nutrient VCO since it has hexane just like majority of VCO brands despite misleading reviews by many.

description: Nutiva Organic, Steam Refined Coconut Oil from non-GMO, Sustainably Farmed Coconuts is rich in lauric acid and MCTs, making it one of the world's most nourishing and versatile superfoods. Unlike other oils on the market, Nutiva’s Steam Refined Coconut Oil is extracted and processed using steam instead of hexane or other dangerous chemicals. At Nutiva, we start with organic, non-GMO Southeast Asian coconuts, sustainably harvested, dried, chopped, and steam processed to naturally extract the purest, flavor and aroma free coconut oil on the market today. This lack of odor and neutral profile make it great for use in all of your recipes where a coconut flavor is not desired. Nutiva Organic, Steam Refined Coconut Oil is ideal as a high heat cooking oil for sautéing and stir frying and is a healthful addition to vegetarian, vegan, raw, whole food, paleo, ketogenic, and gluten-free diets. The purity and nutrient density of Nutiva Organic, Steam Refined Coconut Oil make it good for you both inside and out. Use the luscious, soothing oil as a natural skin moisturizer, eye make-up remover, deep conditioning hair treatment, or combine it with Nutiva Coconut Sugar and your favorite essential oil for an exfoliating, refreshing body scrub. Nutiva was founded in 1999 with a single purpose in mind - to Revolutionize the Way the World Eats. Our role is to produce and promote organic, nutrient dense superfoods that are good for you and good for the planet. Social and environmental responsibility is a core part of Nutiva’s culture and business. From sourcing organic products, to obtaining fair trade certification, to greening our facilities and operations, to funding tree planting at schools in our local community, we are constantly seeking ways to better protect our environment and ensure a better quality of life for employees, customers, and the communities we serve.

features: NATURALLY EXTRACTED and NUTRIENT DENSE: Nutiva’s all-natural steam refining process yields a pure, taste and odor free, nutrient-rich oil containing 63% medium chain triglycerides and 50% lauric acid without the use of dangerous and harmful chemicals or hexane.
NEUTRAL FLAVOR AND ODOR: Nutiva Organic, Steam Refined Coconut Oil has a neutral odor and flavor making it an ideal option for use in any recipe where a coconut flavor is not desired.
IDEAL FOR COOKING: Nutiva Organic, Steam Refined Coconut Oil has a higher smoke point at 400°F than virgin coconut oil (350°F) and is perfect for frying and sautéing.

COMMITMENT TO QUALITY: Nutiva partners with organic farmers to source the world’s finest fresh, organic virgin coconuts and stringently adheres to USDA certified organic and non-GMO guidelines to deliver superfood that is good for you and good for the planet.
EASY TO USE PACKAGING: Nutiva Organic, Steam Refined Coconut Oil is packaged in safe, convenient, BPA-free packaging.

review.user_review:
I thought Nutiva was really trying to push their quality when they started talking about their FT VCO but this is not it. Just because of a stamp one can not improve the quality of their product. This is just a cold pressed VCO without the high quality standards of what FT VCO happens to be. Read the labelling carefully.

Nutiva has posted the following on their Website; ""Please note that there is no difference between Virgin and Extra-Virgin Coconut Oil. We previously called our coconut oil "extra-virgin" to emphasize our commitment to quality, however as we move into international markets we have removed the term to comply with international regulations that disallow the term. Be assured that our product quality has not changed in any way. For more information on this click here."" There is a difference, it is illegal to claim virgin in few places in the world since virgin is only a definition used for olive oil, not for any other oil. Many producers were using virgin but due to competition of so many producers of VCO pupping everywhere in Asia, many are regrouping for better sales. This is the same as non-FT VCO but at a higher pricing.

I use VCO in the mix for my hair, shaving cream, soap, hand lotion, face lotion, body lotion, tooth paste as well as I make popcorn and consume it straight out of the jar for its nutrients. Years ago, I was able to get raw, hand pressed coconut oils from fresh coconuts from Mexico produced right here in US but due to popularity of VCOs, many producers have been creative in making money by misleading shoppers as well as many misleading reviews by shoppers certainly has hyped the business of VCO to another level. Extra Virgin Coconut Oil is a lie since Extra Virgin applies only to olive oil and infact the VCO market has become so saturated that many producers are removing extra from their labeling and calling it virgin coconut oil, no more extra virgin. In Canada where the best VCOs are produced, it is illegal to even use the term, extra virgin for coconut oil but in US the laws are very relaxed. There is no Extra Virgin coconut oil, only virgin, there is no pure, no #1, no 100%, no premium liquid, or any of those terms used for coconut oils. There is no coconut oil especially produced for beauty product which is any different than for cooking or consumption either as a salad dressing or right out of the jar with a spoon. The higher the grade, the higher the nutrients, everything else are marketing tools to sell coconut oil for more money.

review.user_review:
REFINED or UNREFINED: The decision to choose between refined vs. unrefined is dependent upon the intention or use of the oil. Unrefined coconut oil has a smoke point of 280 degrees Fahrenheit, whereas, refined coconut oil's smoke point is 365 degrees Fahrenheit making it great for high heat cooking or sautéing.

GRADE A: Unrefined, Fair Trade, Certified organic by the USDA, Canada Organic, BC Certified Organic, Ecocert, first pressed VCO and Kosher. Hand pressed and cold-pressed to produce raw oil from fresh coconuts in as little as two hours.
GRADE B: Unrefined, Fair Trade, Certified organic by the USDA, Kosher, cold-pressed from fresh coconuts. Unknown if first pressed, Not Ecocert, Not raw oil produced in couple hours or less like Grade A.
GRADE C: Unrefined, Certified organic by the USDA, Kosher, cold-pressed from fresh coconuts. Unknown if first pressed, Not Fair Trade, Not Ecocert, Not raw oil produced in couple hours or less like Grade A.
GRADE D: REFINED, Certified organic by the USDA, Kosher, cold-pressing/expeller pressing. Unknown if first pressed, Not Fair Trade, Not Ecocert, Not from fresh coconuts but from copra, Not raw oil produced in couple hours or less like Grade A.

This is GRADE C VCO. I consume GRADE A and B with a spoon right out of the jar but for popcorn I go with GRADE C. I do not consume refined or GRADE D. When heated, just like any food item, VCO loses its nutritional value. As a beauty product, I mix VCO with CO+AO since CO+AO are my favorite oils for my skin. Not a FT VCO which are the best of best, not a extra virgin oil since it is a lie, this is only a three star VCO or lower grade.

I use VCO in the mix for my hair, shaving cream, soap, hand lotion, face lotion, body lotion, tooth paste as well as I make popcorn and consume it straight out of the jar for its nutrients. Extra Virgin Coconut Oil is a lie since Extra Virgin applies only to olive oil and infact the VCO market has become so saturated that many producers are removing extra from their labeling and calling it virgin coconut oil, no more extra virgin. In Canada where the best VCOs are produced, it is illegal to even use the term, extra virgin for coconut oil but in US the laws are very relaxed. There is no Extra Virgin coconut oil, only virgin, there is no pure, no #1, no 100%, no premium liquid, or any of those terms used for marketing reasons. There is no VCO especially produced for beauty line which is any different than for cooking or consumption either as a salad dressing or right out of the jar with a spoon for healthy nutrients for a high quality VCO. The higher the grade, the higher the nutrients. Everything else use to promote VCO are marketing tools to sell coconut oil for more money.

description: Coconut Oil, 32 ozOrganic & Extra VirginCoconut oil is a natural energy source because it contains MCTs (medium chain) “good fats” the body uses to produce energy. As a dietary supplement, Coconut oil is a good addition to physical activity, exercise and weight loss programs. Our Coconut oil is certified Organic, Non-GMO, Pure extra virgin, has Zero trans fat and Zero hydrogenated fat. Coconut oil can be taken as a dietary supplement, used for cooking or used for skin & hair care.DosageAs a dietary supplement, take 1 to 4 tablespoons daily. May be used as a spread or added to salad dressings & smoothies. The item is a semi-solid product.If the product has been kept/stored in an area or facility that would put the product in higher than “typical room temperatures”, the product will start to transform into a liquid form. This is a typical trait of all semi-solid products, not just inclusive of this particular product. As the product would come to room temperature, it will again become solidified. This process, in becoming solidified may take a few hours, dependent upon the environment the product has been exposed to. The “solids” at the bottom of the jar when stirred the product, would be particles that had not turned to liquid form. Again, the “watery” state indicates was due to the temperature the product had been exposed to. The product has various uses – many in which the product can be utilized in liquid form and semi-solid. Thus depending upon what the consumer desires of the product, having the product in semi-solid form, creates this ability to transform to the needed use for the consumer.

Nutiva Organic Steam Refined Coconut Oil is ideal as a high heat cooking oil for sautéing and stir frying and is a wholesome addition to vegetarian, vegan, raw, whole food, paleo-friendly, ketogenic, and gluten-free diets. The purity and nutrient density of the coconut oil makes it good for you both inside and out. Use the luscious, soothing oil as a natural skin moisturizer, eye make-up remover, deep conditioning hair treatment, or combine it with Nutiva Organic Coconut Sugar and your favorite essential oil for an exfoliating, refreshing body scrub. Refined coconut oil will have a different color when it's compared to virgin coconut oil. Nutiva's Organic Refined Coconut Oil is made with an organic steam process, some color may remain in the final product. No chemicals or solvents are used in this organic approved process. Refined coconut oil can naturally have a yellowish color to it. Nutiva was founded in 1999 with a single purpose in mind - to Revolutionize the Way the World Eats. We produce organic, nutrient-dense foods that are good for you and good for the planet. Social and environmental responsibility is a core part of Nutiva’s culture and business. From sourcing organic products, to obtaining fair trade certification, to greening our facilities and operations, to funding natural food initiatives in our local community, we are constantly seeking ways to better protect our environment and ensure a better quality of life for employees, customers, and the communities we serve.

review.user_review:
This is not organic.
There is no EV VCO anywhere, it is only a marketing gimmick.
It is not VCO, it is much, much more. It is full of additives including sugar at a high price.
It contains carrageenan which causes inflammation.

I use VCO in the mix for my hair, shaving cream, soap, hand lotion, face lotion, body lotion, tooth paste as well as I make popcorn and consume it straight out of the jar for its nutrients. Years ago, I was able to get raw, hand pressed coconut oils from fresh coconuts from Mexico produced right here in US but due to popularity of VCOs, many producers have been creative in making money by misleading shoppers as well as many misleading reviews by shoppers certainly has hyped the business of VCO to another level. Extra Virgin Coconut Oil is a lie since Extra Virgin applies only to olive oil and infact the VCO market has become so saturated that many producers are removing extra from their labeling and calling it virgin coconut oil, no more extra virgin. In Canada where the best VCOs are produced, it is illegal to even use the term, extra virgin for coconut oil but in US the laws are very relaxed. There is no Extra Virgin coconut oil, only virgin, there is no pure, no #1, no 100%, no premium liquid, or any of those terms used for coconut oils. There is no coconut oil especially produced for beauty product which is any different than for cooking or consumption either as a salad dressing or right out of the jar with a spoon. The higher the grade, the higher the nutrients, everything else are marketing tools to sell coconut oil for more money.

description: Product Description

Add excitement to your favorite dishes and promote a healthy lifestyle with our Kelapo Extra Virgin Coconut Oil. Harvested from exclusive coconut palms in Sri Lanka, this 100% organic, trans fat free oil can be used as an all-natural, flavorful, and energy packed, butter alternative. Kelapo Extra Virgin Coconut Oil can be used as a replacement for butter and other oils. The unique flavors of our extra virgin coconut oil turn any ordinary meal into a truly indulgent experience. We harvest our coconuts from the lush, tropical island of Sri Lanka. Our fair trade farmers collect the fruit at its peak ripeness, and extract the extra virgin coconut oil through a cold expeller press. Kelapo Extra Virgin Coconut Oil is 100% natural, unrefined, certified organic, and Fair Trade Approved. We choose to use amber colored plastic jars for aesthetic appeal. The amber color represents the brown coloring of a coconut shell, while the coconut oil is a stark, bright white on the inside, like the coconut meat. Amber containers also help reduce light to the coconut oil and help maintain the freshness and shelf life.
Amazon.com

Add excitement to your favorite dishes and promote a healthy lifestyle with Kelapo Extra Virgin Coconut Oil. Kelapo Extra Virgin Coconut Oil provides a flavorful alternative to butter and other oils that is 100 percent natural, organic, and free of unhealthy trans fats. The unique flavor of this extra virgin coconut oil can turn any ordinary meal into a truly indulgent experience.
Kelapo Extra Virgin Coconut Oil is:
100 percent natural and unrefined
100 percent natural and unrefined
100 percent free of trans fat
100 percent free of trans fat
Certified organic
Certified organic
Vegetarian certified
Vegetarian certified

Fair Trade Approved Recommended Use: Use extra virgin coconut oil as a 1-to-1 replacement for butter and other oils in cooking and baking. For best results, do not refrigerate. Kelapo Extra Virgin Coconut Oil comes from coconuts harvested at the peak of ripeness from the lush, tropical island of Sri Lanka. Kelapo's fair trade farmers extract the extra virgin coconut oil through a cold expeller press ensuring a 100 percent natural, unrefined product. Kelapo Coconut Oils are certified organic and are Fair Trade Approved. The amber colored plastic jars Kelapo Coconut Oil comes in reduce light to the coconut oil to help maintain freshness and shelf life. Try Kelapo Extra Virgin Coconut Oil in this recipe: Homemade Chicken FlautasMakes 18 flautas (about 4 servings)INGREDIENTS:Kelapo coconut oil for frying + 2 additional tablespoons3 cups cooked and shredded rotisserie chickenSeasonings: 1 teaspoon each paprika (regular or smoked) and garlic powder; 3/4 teaspoon each kosher salt and ground cumin; 1/2 teaspoon chili powder; 1/8 teaspoon cayenne; freshly ground black pepper, to taste24 corn tortillas, 6 to 7 inches in diameter2 cups crumbled queso fresco cheese DIRECTIONS:Preheat the oven to 325°F. Fill a Dutch oven or cast iron pot with a few inches of coconut oil and heat on medium-high until it reaches 375°F.While oil heats, melt the additional 2 tablespoons of coconut oil in a skillet over medium heat. Combine the chicken with all seasonings in a large mixing bowl, then add to the skillet and cook until warmed through. Adjust any seasonings to personal taste.Cook flautas in batches of 3 to 4 (1 tortilla=1 flauta). Be sure to return oil to 375°F between batches.Warm tortillas to soften in microwave (20 secs) or steamer.Roll two tablespoons of chicken mixture sprinkled with crumbled queso fresco into each tortilla. Secure with a toothpick(s).Gently lower rolled flauta into oil with tongs and hold them gently clamped closed for a moment to help the shell set.Cook until very crisp and light golden in color, about 1–2 minutes.Shake excess oil back into pan and place cooked flautas to on a paper-towel lined sheet pan in a warm oven.Serve with sour cream, salsa, or guacamole, plus your favorite salad for a complete meal.

Preheat the oven to 325°F. Fill a Dutch oven or cast iron pot with a few inches of coconut oil and heat on medium-high until it reaches 375°F.

While oil heats, melt the additional 2 tablespoons of coconut oil in a skillet over medium heat. Combine the chicken with all seasonings in a large mixing bowl, then add to the skillet and cook until warmed through. Adjust any seasonings to personal taste.
Cook flautas in batches of 3 to 4 (1 tortilla=1 flauta). Be sure to return oil to 375°F between batches.

Cook until very crisp and light golden in color, about 1–2 minutes.

description: Nutiva Organic, Steam Refined Coconut Oil from Non-GMO, Sustainably Farmed Coconuts is rich in lauric acid and MCTs, making it a nourishing and versatile food for cooking, baking, and beauty. Unlike other oils on the market, Nutiva’s coconut oil is extracted and processed using steam instead of hexane or other dangerous chemicals. At Nutiva, we start with organic, non-GMO Southeast Asian coconuts, sustainably harvested, dried, chopped, and steam processed to naturally extract the purest, aroma and flavor-free coconut oil on the market today. The neutral profile makes it great for use in all of your recipes where a coconut flavor is not desired. Nutiva Organic Steam Refined Coconut Oil is ideal as a high heat cooking oil for sautéing and stir frying and is a wholesome addition to vegetarian, vegan, raw, whole food, paleo-friendly, ketogenic, and gluten-free diets. The purity and nutrient density of the coconut oil makes it good for you both inside and out. Use the luscious, soothing oil as a natural skin moisturizer, eye make-up remover, deep conditioning hair treatment, or combine it with Nutiva Organic Coconut Sugar and your favorite essential oil for an exfoliating, refreshing body scrub. Refined coconut oil will have a different color when it's compared to virgin coconut oil. Nutiva's Organic Refined Coconut Oil is made with an organic steam process, some color may remain in the final product. No chemicals or solvents are used in this organic approved process. Refined coconut oil can naturally have a yellowish color to it. Nutiva was founded in 1999 with a single purpose in mind - to Revolutionize the Way the World Eats. We produce organic, nutrient-dense foods that are good for you and good for the planet. Social and environmental responsibility is a core part of Nutiva’s culture and business. From sourcing organic products, to obtaining fair trade certification, to greening our facilities and operations, to funding natural food initiatives in our local community, we are constantly seeking ways to better protect our environment and ensure a better quality of life for employees, customers, and the communities we serve.

Barlean's is the only brand which will not provide any images of the back of their labelling. That is so they will confuse customers in purchasing a EVCO which has no certification for Fair Trade which is priced higher due to higher standards required in treatment of employees of their product in third world countries. It is not Kosher either which gives it a higher standard as well. It is in a dark container so you will not be able to see the consistency of the mix either. More importantly it is sold for higher price that other EVCO coconuts with Fair Trade certification and Kosher certification all for financial gain with few hundred reviews on Amazon for a misleading ingredients for health.

I use VCO in the mix for my hair, shaving cream, soap, hand lotion, face lotion, body lotion, tooth paste as well as I make popcorn and consume it straight out of the jar for its nutrients. Years ago, I was able to get raw, hand pressed coconut oils from fresh coconuts from Mexico produced right here in US but due to popularity of VCOs, many producers have been creative in making money by misleading shoppers as well as many misleading reviews by shoppers certainly has hyped the business of VCO to another level. Extra Virgin Coconut Oil is a lie since Extra Virgin applies only to olive oil and infact the VCO market has become so saturated that many producers are removing extra from their labeling and calling it virgin coconut oil, no more extra virgin. In Canada where the best VCOs are produced, it is illegal to even use the term, extra virgin for coconut oil but in US the laws are very relaxed. There is no Extra Virgin coconut oil, only virgin, there is no pure, no #1, no 100%, no premium liquid, or any of those terms used for coconut oils. There is no coconut oil especially produced for beauty product which is any different than for cooking or consumption either as a salad dressing or right out of the jar with a spoon. The higher the grade, the higher the nutrients, everything else are marketing tools to sell coconut oil for more money.

REFINED or UNREFINED: The decision to choose between refined vs. unrefined is dependent upon the intention or use of the oil. Unrefined coconut oil has a smoke point of 280 degrees Fahrenheit, whereas, refined coconut oil's smoke point is 365 degrees Fahrenheit making it great for high heat cooking or sautéing.

GRADE B: Unfiltered, Fair Trade, Certified organic by the USDA, Kosher, cold-pressed from fresh coconuts. Unknown if first pressed, Not Ecocert, Not raw oil produced in couple hours or less like Grade A.

review.user_review:
SPECTRUM (14g serving in %)
Linolenic Acid=.5
Lauric+Caprylic+Capric Acids=40~58/6~7/6~7
Omega 6 Linoleic Acid=.8~4.0
Omega 9 Oleic Acid=3~12
Temperature=unknown
Press=Cold when contacted
Refined or Unrefined=unrefined

Let's look at some facts... Spectrum is an organic producer which sells refined as well as unrefined EVCO in many different labellings, different containers, glass to plastic. Not a Fair Trade EVCO but one of only handful of producers that does not claim Extra Virgin anywhere on their labelling at all since there is no Extra Virgin EVCO anywhere sold in US when majority of others producers try to sell it as EVCO and use EVCO as a marketing tool. This is a GRADE C mix.

REGULATIONS: It's important to note that, while Europe has rigorous standards in place for the terminology of cold pressing (fully unrefined oil extracted at temperatures below 122 degrees F), the phrase 'cold pressed' has been used erroneously in the U.S. for a number of years, often employed as a marketing technique for oils which have been expeller pressed or even refined (which exposes the oil to temperatures of up to 470 degrees F).

COOKING: Since coconut oil is heat stable, it can be baked into desserts, and substituted for EVOO or vegetable oil. I will never give up cooking with EVOO, since to me EVOO is the best oil. I cook with EVOO not EVCO but for my popcorns, I go with EVCO.

SKIN: EVCO is massage oil, so is almond oil. Almond oil is the best skin conditioner. EVCO and almond+castor oil are the best for all my scabs when mountain biking since it keeps the skin soft and moist which does not allow it to dry which becomes very compelling to scratch and remove the scab which is a no, no.

FACE: After shaving, lotion is always better than cream since lotion is lighter than cream and does not block hair pores so I always apply EVCO on my skin. With that said, I never apply any EVCO above my lower eyelids especially when wearing contact lenses or doing sports since EVCO can be very disturbing and damaging to the eyes and the contact lenses especially when applied on forehead regardless if I am sweating or not. EVCO is the best cream for my lips instead of those chemicals sold as a lip balm.

HAIR: leave-in conditioner, I place it on my hair before I head out to the beach for surfing. No need to use shampoo to remove EVCO, ocean salt removes EVCO.

SUNSCREEN: I mix EVOO and EVCO in a bowl, place the bowl in a hot water, blend the mix, add non-nano zinc oxide powder and then let it cool. Few minutes later, I add few drops of almond oil and wheat germ oil. Blend the mix, pour in small containers and place it in refrigerator. I insure that I choose the best ingredients that I am familiar with.

SCRUB: I blend few different oils and spices together to get the right mix for my skin. I blend EVCO, EVOO, avocado, raw honey, turmeric, coffee, germ wheat oil, almond oil, castor oil and ginger. Avocado and germ wheat oils high in vitamin E soften skin, castor oil removes black spots on the skin, EVOO is a hydrator and antioxidant, EVCO and raw honey are antibacterial, coffee exfoliates and tightens loose skin, turmeric reduces inflammation and ginger fight illness. I mix and add few drops of cold boiled water as needed a drop at a time till the mix forms a paste. I spread the mix over my skin and rub. I let it dry and rinse off in the shower. Afterward I apply almond, EVOO and EVCO.

SHAVING CREAM: Grate half of a soap bar, add EVOO and castor oil, add distilled water, mix well, apply low heat, stir till water evaporates, add EVCO, pour mix in a small container with a cap for a day for the best home made organic shaving cream with USDA organic ingredients.

TOOTHPASTE: Scientists tested coconut oil against Streptococcus mutans - a sugar-loving bacterium that clings to teeth and produces acid causing them to rot. When the oil was treated with digestive enzymes it became a powerful killer of the bug. I make sure to rub some on my gums and teeth before going to bed since that is when bacteria in mouth increases.

description: Spectrum(R) Certified Organic Virgin Coconut Oil, sourced from the Phillipines for premium quality, adds the true coconut flavor of the tropics to any dish you're cooking. Whether it's a Thai coconut shrimp sauté or pineapple upside-down cake, this oil's clean and natural coconut taste is just right for the kitchen. With 9g of Medium Chain Triglycerids per serving, it's a perfect addition to morning coffee or a pre-workout smoothie. Plus, use this oil as an alternative to butter - smooth over warm banana pancakes, spread on toast with a dash of cinnamon, or melt over lightly seasoned popcorn. Its versatility makes it the perfect oil for your culinary exploration.

description: Product Description

Our Extra Virgin Coconut Oil is among the healthiest, most versatile dietary oils in the world-and it's RAW. Years ago, I was able to get raw, hand pressed coconut oils from fresh coconuts from Mexico produced right here in US but due to popularity of VCOs, many producers have been creative in making money by misleading shoppers as well as many misleading reviews by shoppers certainly has hyped the business of VCO to another level. Extra Virgin Coconut Oil is a lie since Extra Virgin applies only to olive oil and infact the VCO market has become so saturated that many producers are removing extra from their labeling and calling it virgin coconut oil, no more extra virgin. In Canada where the best VCOs are produced, it is illegal to even use the term, extra virgin for coconut oil but in US the laws are very relaxed. There is no Extra Virgin coconut oil, only virgin, there is no pure, no #1, no 100%, no premium liquid, or any of those terms used for coconut oils. There is no coconut oil especially produced for beauty product which is any different than for cooking or consumption either as a salad dressing or right out of the jar with a spoon. The higher the grade, the higher the nutrients, everything else are marketing tools to sell coconut oil for more money.

REFINED or UNREFINED: The decision to choose between refined vs. unrefined is dependent upon the intention or use of the oil. Unrefined coconut oil has a smoke point of 280 degrees Fahrenheit, whereas, refined coconut oil's smoke point is 365 degrees Fahrenheit making it great for high heat cooking or sautéing.

GRADE A: Unfiltered, Fair Trade, Certified organic by the USDA, Canada Organic, BC Certified Organic, Ecocert, first pressed VCO and Kosher. Hand pressed and cold-pressed to produce raw oil from fresh coconuts in as little as two hours.
GRADE B: Unfiltered, Fair Trade, Certified organic by the USDA, Kosher, cold-pressed from fresh coconuts. Unknown if first pressed, Not Ecocert, Not raw oil produced in couple hours or less like Grade A.
GRADE C: Unfiltered, Certified organic by the USDA, Kosher, cold-pressed from fresh coconuts. Unknown if first pressed, Not Fair Trade, Not Ecocert, Not raw oil produced in couple hours or less like Grade A.
GRADE D: Unfiltered, Certified organic by the USDA, Kosher, cold-pressing/expeller pressing. Unknown if first pressed, Not Fair Trade, Not Ecocert, Not from fresh coconuts but from copra, Not raw oil produced in couple hours or less like Grade A.

description: Spectrum(R) Certified Organic Virgin Coconut Oil, sourced from the Phillipines for premium quality, adds the true coconut flavor of the tropics to any dish you're cooking. Whether it's a Thai coconut shrimp sauté or pineapple upside-down cake, this oil's clean and natural coconut taste is just right for the kitchen. With 9g of Medium Chain Triglycerids per serving, it's a perfect addition to morning coffee or a pre-workout smoothie. Plus, use this oil as an alternative to butter - smooth over warm banana pancakes, spread on toast with a dash of cinnamon, or melt over lightly seasoned popcorn. Its versatility makes it the perfect oil for your culinary exploration.

description: 16 fl oz jar of TRADER JOE'S ORGANIC VIRGIN COCONUT OIL ************************************************** Trader Joe's Organic Virgin Coconut Oil is truly AMAZING! To make Trader Joe's Organic Virgin Coconut Oil, starts with freshly harvested coconuts that are de-husked and grated. The meat of the coconut is dried to remove the water, and then it's cold pressed and filtered to remove any remaining pieces of the fruit. That's the process. Nothing more. By producing the oil in this way, the nutrients, flavor characteristics and aromas of fresh coconuts are retained. Use Organic Virgin Coconut Oil in cooking - it stands up to relatively high heat and imparts a distinctive flavor - in salad dressings, for baking, and even as a moisturizer for dry skin. It's true! It will fluctuate from a liquid to a solid state, depending on the temperature at which it's stored, so don't be surprised when the solid-looking oil you bought in the store turns into a liquid when the jar's been stored in a warmer pantry.

product.title: Dr. Bronner's - Organic Virgin Coconut Oil (Whole Kernel, 14 Ounce) - Coconut Oil for Cooking, Baking, Hair & Body, Unrefined & Fresh-Pressed, Rich & Nutty Flavor, Fair Trade, Vegan, Non-GMO
features: USDA ORGANIC & FAIR TRADE INGREDIENTS ONLY: Dr. Bronner’s Regenerative Organic Certified Virgin Coconut Oil is expeller-pressed from fresh, carefully dried coconut kernels. Contains only 1 ingredient—simple & delicious!

DR. BRONNER'S ORGANIC VIRGIN COCONUT OIL IS VERSATILE: Our Virgin Coconut Oil is perfect for cooking, baking, hair & body! Use for stir-frying, sauces & baking. Moisturizes hair & skin, good for oil pulling and oral health.

CLIMATE-FRIENDLY FARMING: Our sister company in Sri Lanka works with farmers to implement regenerative organic practices that enrich soil, promote biodiversity and sequester atmospheric carbon—building resilience in the face of a changing climate!

OUR TWO COCONUT OILS: Our White Kernel Coconut Oil has the brown inner skin removed for a milder taste, while we retain it for the Whole Kernel, resulting in a slightly nuttier taste. Both oils can be used interchangeably for cooking and body care.

NOW, REGENERATIVE ORGANIC CERTIFIED: Our coconut oil is pioneering Regenerative Organic Certification—a holistic agriculture certification focusing on animal welfare, farmer and worker fairness, and requirements for soil health and land management.

review.user_review: Tried an assortment case with black cherry, grapefruit lime and green apple. I previously had the grapefruit lime and it wasn't half bad. Couldn't pass up trying this option for the great price of $15 for a 12pk. These have 300mg caffeine and all the usual energy drink ingredients. The noticible difference to me on muscle pharm is the taste. They don't have that overly sweet taste. For me most times I don't care about sweetness, it's more the flavor tasting like it's name . These tasted decent without tasting "sugary" imo. Black cherry tasted like cherry without tasting like bubblegum cherry if you know what I mean  . That may be a selling point to many fellow users of these drinks. While I wouldn't buy these all the time, they are good enough to mix in my drink rotation based on taste and definitely on price 😊

description: RED BULL GIVES YOU WINGS

In 1987, Red Bull not only launched a completely new product, it created a whole new product category — energy drinks. From day one, Red Bull has been giving wings to people and ideas, setting many milestones in sports and culture.
When To Drink

Red Bull is appreciated worldwide by a variety of people such as top athletes, busy professionals, college students and travelers on long journeys. Red Bull was the first global energy drink brand to address the consumer need for sugar free energy drinks and launched its Red Bull sugar free variants.
What's Inside The Can
Caffeine
: Caffeine has already been known for its stimulating effects on the human body by ancient civilizations who consumed it from natural sources like tea, coffee, cacao beans & cola nuts.
Taurine
: Taurine is an amino acid, naturally occurring in the human body and present in the daily diet. It is involved in a wide range of biological processes.
B-group vitamins

: Vitamins are essential micronutrients that are required for maintaining normal body functions. B-group vitamins play an important role in energy metabolism, such as the build-up and breakdown of carbohydrates and protein.
Aspartame & Acesulfame K

: Aspartame and Acesulfame K are among the most-tested and most-used sugar substitutes worldwide. Both have an excellent safety profile.  4 Red Bull Sugarfree  You add to your basket a 4 pack of Red Bull Sugarfree, 8.4 Fl Oz per can.
Sustainability

Red Bull is very aware of its environmental responsibility and is constantly striving for improvement. Red Bull has made a conscious decision to use 100% recyclable aluminium cans, and we developed our Red Bull Coolers which use up to 45% less energy than conventional fridges.

description: Neuro SONIC combines a functional dose of caffeine (100 mg) and L-Theanine (50 mg), both derived from green tea. Neuro Sonic is clinically studied to increase energy and sustain the effect up to 3.5 hours, plus reduce fatigue and improve “executive” function. Executive function involves a set of skills that allow people to plan, organize and complete tasks such as flexible thinking, planning and prioritizing, organization and task initiation—mental functions that students to seniors perform daily.*Results as reported in a double-blind, placebo-controlled, adaptive crossover trial on Neuro SONIC. Currently being prepared for publication (2017).

product.title: evian Natural Spring Water, Naturally Filtered Spring Water in Bulk-Size Water Bottles, 42.27 Fl Oz (Pack of 4)
features: NATURALLY REFRESHING: Our pure bottled natural spring mineral water is always a refreshing, naturally hydrating drink. Its quality and taste make it perfect for serving by the glass, or drinking directly from the bottle at home, at school or at the gym.

NATURAL HYDRATION: evian's bottled water starts off nestled in the French Alps before delivering natural hydration and naturally occurring electrolytes. It's a great way to rehydrate post-workout, or as a refreshing drink on your lunch break or commute.

OUR NATURAL SPRING WATER has a balanced mineral composition and naturally occurring electrolytes that give it a distinctive, smooth taste, unique among bottled waters. It's the perfect rehydrating beverage, delicious either cold or at room temperature.

CRAFTED BY NATURE: evian natural spring water begins as snowflakes and mountain rain, naturally filtered through glacial rocks for over 15 years, giving evian its purity, mineral content and neutrally balanced 7.2 pH for delicious natural spring water.

DRINK GREEN: evian is committed to the environment & respecting the water cycle. Our recyclable plastic bottles contain up to 35% recycled plastic. They're perfect for your backpack, purse or gym bag, or keep them in your fridge for refreshment anytime.

description: Icelandic Glacial is a premium natural spring water, possessing exceptional balance featuring a naturally low mineral content and a naturally alkaline pH of 8.4. Icelandic Glacial is further distinguished as the world’s first certified carbon-neutral natural spring bottled water for product and operation. Using 100% natural green energy to fuel its production, allowing for delivery of premium bottled water to consumers around the world while maintaining a net-zero carbon footprint. Available nationally in retail, convenience, drug and mass outlets as well as online through Amazon. Various sizes available in BPA-free PET and glass options for both still and sparkling line. Sparkling flavors of Sicilian Lemon, Tahitian Lime, Tarocco Blood Orange and Indonesian Lemongrass offered in PET.

product.title: Icelandic Glacial Natural Spring Alkaline Water, 500 mL (6 Count)
features: EXCEPTIONALLY PURE: Icelandic Glacial is sourced from the legendary Ölfus Spring in Iceland, one of the world’s most pristine ecosystems. It possesses a naturally low mineral content that does not crowd the palate with heavy metals, minerals or silica. A water so pure, nothing is added; nothing is taken away.
NATURALLY ALKALINE: Icelandic Glacial is naturally alkaline with a pH level of 8.4.
CARBON NEUTRAL: Icelandic Glacial was the world’s first bottled water to be certified CarbonNeutral for both product and operation.

ICELANDIC GLACIAL FULFILLS YOUR HYDRATION NEEDS: Icelandic Glacial has a variety of spring water available including classic sparkling as well as Elderflower, Tahitian Lime and Sicilian Lemon sparkling flavors.

product.title: RainForest Artesian Water from Costa Rica. Aluminium Reusable Bottle 16.9 oz / 500 mL. (4 Pack)
features: Smooth Artesian Water - Quench your thirst with RainForest Artesian Bottled Water. This refreshing water is naturally sourced from Campos Lapa Verde in Costa Rica. Smooth and refreshing, our spring water bottles provide a taste of nature’s gift.

Comes in Plastic-Free Reusable Bottles - Make an earth-conscious choice with a RainForest Water Pack. We use plastic-free reusable water bottles and caps to ensure 0% plastic waste. Our aluminum bottle is recyclable forever, allowing you to hydrate responsibly and #kissplasticgoodbye.

Filtered By Nature - Our natural spring water is harvested from an artesian water spring and flows naturally to our state-of-the-art bottling plant. Our water is sourced without human intervention and is slowly filtered by Mother Nature. Savor the magnificent taste of our mountain spring water.

Perfectly Balanced and Smooth - Different from mineral water, which is processed with minerals and salts during filtration, the artesian water in our bottled drinking water naturally gathers soft minerals like calcium, magnesium, iron, and chloride as it flows from the source to production line.

description: Historic Lynchburg Tennessee Whiskey Apple Cinnamon Barbecue Sauce (16 FL.OZ. / 454 g): This family recipe was created around the turn of the century, almost five generations ago. The old folks wanted a distinctive flavor and realized that local Tennessee Whiskey was the answer. The family is proud of their delicious barbecue sauce and they are committed to providing the finest traditional old time quality barbecue sauce available. We recommend that our sauce be basted on the last 5 to 10 minutes of cooking time to allow the flavor to penetrate the meat and then serve, well browned, right off the grill. Ingredients: Tomato Concentrate, Apples, Molasses, Brown Sugar, Sugar, Honey, Pineapple, Soy Sauce, Apple Juice, Worcestershire, Spices, Onions, Garlic, Ginger, Cinnamon, Natural Flavors, Jack Daniel's Whiskey, Sodium Benzoate

description: Create bold Texas-style Barbecue flavor with Stubb's Original Legendary Bar-B-Q Sauce! Keep this tangy tomato-vinegar-molasses-and-black pepper mouth-watering flavor on hand for chicken, wings, ribs, beef, pork and even baked beans. C.B. “Stubb” Stubblefield didn’t just make barbecue – he made friends. Opening his first restaurant in Lubbock in 1968, Stubb barbecued in the hickory pit behind his place and filled the jukebox with vintage blues music. This original flavor barbecue sauce that tastes like homemade, slow-simmered sauce brings his legacy to life – it’s the real deal. Made with gluten-free ingredients and no high-fructose corn syrup…. just finger-licking flavor. For quality barbecue done right, use Stubb’s Sauces, Rubs & Marinades, all made with his secret ingredient “Love and Happiness.”

product.title: 4 Rivers – Smokehouse Signature BBQ Sauce;  Multi-regional Flavor With an Ideal Combination of Sweet and Savory. No High Fructose Corn Syrup. Perfect Complement for Beef, Pork, and Poultry. 16 fl oz
features: 4 RIVERS SIGNATURE TASTE – Our founder, John Rivers, personally blended the 4R Smokehouse Signature Sauce to bring together the favorite BBQ flavors of the South. His multi-regional recipe provides an ideal combination of sweet and savory with a smoky, spicy finish that complements pork, chicken and beef. No matter your method – roasting, slow-cooking, or grilling – 4R Smokehouse Signature Sauce is engineered to bring out the best in your food.

MULTI-REGIONAL FLAVOR -- The beauty of barbecue lies in its diversity of flavors. That’s why John Rivers created his 4R Smokehouse Signature Sauce to honor the best regional barbecue traditions. Whatever your preference – Kansas City, Memphis, the Carolinas, or Texas – our Signature Sauce’s complex flavors give you a uniquely premium, house-made sauce for every occasion.

BARBECUE HOW IT SHOULD BE -- We at 4R believe that only quality ingredients can create quality food. All our 4R products are made in house with love and expertise, using the best ingredients available. It’s what sets 4R apart.

BARBECUE MINISTRY – Founded in 2009 by John Rivers in Winter Park, Florida, 4R believes in quality people, quality ingredients, and quality food. What began as a charitable fundraiser for a young woman with a terminal illness has become the most beloved barbecue restaurant in Florida. Our Barbecue Ministry is dedicated to supporting the community, impacting lives, and providing the best tasting food, bar none. Join the family, and taste the difference for yourself.

target.user_review: The first order was delivered fairly quickly and without incident. The oil is fresh with a light, distinctive flavor suitable for cooking or finishing. The second order was problematic-- the oil was delivered with a broken seal. Apparently, the company does not permit refund/return. Poor quality control because the oil must have been opened prior to packing and shipping; the cap requires twisting to separate a plastic ring from the top, something that cannot happen after packing and in the shipping process. Poor quality control. Dangerous especially in these times. Too bad because it is a decent oil.
