product.title: Mánamu Ultra Premium MONOVARIETAL Extra Virgin Olive Oil · Bag-in-Box 3L · 100% Made With Pure GREEK Koroneiki Olives · 100% PURE Cold Pressed · 101.4 Fl Oz (3L)
features: GREEK ULTRA PREMIUM EXTRA VIRGIN OLIVE OIL > SUPERIOR CATEGORY Ultra Premium Extra Virgin Olive Oil, 100% PURE. NOT diluted, mixed, or reduced with other varieties of olives or types of oils. Extracted directly from the well-known MONOVARIETAL Koroneiki Olives in Historic Orchards in Messinias, Greece. Give your kitchen that authentic Mediterranean flavor. Now available in a 3-liter box!

ECO-FRIENDLY 3-LITER BOX > Our Mánamu Bag-in-Box is one of the most Eco-friendly options, it is equivalent to six 500 ML glass bottles of Olive Oil. Ecological box with an airtight-bag inside that will keep the Olive Oil fresh for longer and up to 24 months. Bag-pourer for easy and controlled use. Nobody will be able to manipulate the contents of the box once it is sealed

ULTRA PREMIUM CERTIFICATE > Our Mánamu Olive Oil is certified as Ultra Premium due to its low degree of acidity of 0.2-0.3%. Fresh and clean taste, harvested by hand. Cold Pressed at less than 27°C to preserve all the natural, healthy, aromatic and flavorful virtues of the wonderful Koroneiki Olives.

HEALTH BENEFITS > High levels of POLYPHENOLS (antioxidants) and rich in Omegas for health benefits, such as improving the immune system, lowering cholesterol and blood pressure. Certified Extra Virgin Olive Oil is a natural superfood, it does NOT contain gluten / cholesterol / sodium. Excellent natural substitute for butter.

LIFESTYLE > Enjoy with the company of your loved ones. Our Mánamu Olive Oil is very special to try alone or as a dressing. An excellent complement with most foods (salads, vegetables, fruits, meats, poultry, beans, seafood, grains, dairy products and dough, among others). Our Premium Olive Oil is also highly recommended for all your cooking needs (raw, sautéing, frying, baking & grilling). It has a high flash point of over 400°F.

REAL OLIVE OIL > Ingredients: 100% Greek Extra Virgin Olive Oil certified as a single origin - Centenary Orchards located in the region of Messenias, Greece (Southwestern Greece) - Natural Juice - Koroneiki Variety - Very low acidity of 0.2 -0.3% (more than three times lower than the maximum limit (0.8%) of the Extra Virgin Olive Oil category) The lower the acidity means its fresher, healthier and more natural.
DIRECT ATTENTION TO OUR CUSTOMERS > We source directly without intermediaries, from Greece to your kitchen. We are premium sellers of high demanding Greek Products.

review.user_review: Based on the reviews, I expected a stellar taste experience, which, disappointingly, did not happen. It is a decent, journeyman oil with a bright grassy green flavor--almost chartreuse! Greek oils are my favorites because of the taste and higher polyphenols. This one I would likely use for cooking rather than finishing, when a subtler and more complex flavor is preferred that does not overpower or distract from foods. Secondarily, the pour spout produces a thin trickle of oil, rather than a smooth stream; it can take a bit of time to measure out a tablespoon or two. The bottle is beautiful, dark glass with art images. The price is reasonable for an imported Greek oil. All things considered, not sure if I will purchase again.

review.user_review: There were delivery "issues": the package may have been lost, but was at any rate delayed. The seller was not helpful in resolving this. However, the oil finally arrived. The bottle makes a beautiful presentation; it is heavy, dark green glass. The stopper top is crafted to "look like" wood with a cork bottom, but is more likely a synthetic material formed to appear like a high-end wood top with a cork stopper. This is an odd choice for an organic, small batch oil. Pouring the oil requires care as the final drops of oil slide over the lip of the top and must be carefully cleaned off. As for the oil? It is adequate. It is light, with no after taste or bitterness, and thus works well as a finishing oil that will not clash with a passable balsamic vinegar, mixed with butter, or used alone. It has no distinguishing notes. I think that the price is steep, all things considered.

description: Our Arbequina olives are crushed by huge rolling stones and pressed in a pile of some 60 round straw mats like in medieval times. review.user_review_title: Peppery oil in Drippy Tin Jar
review.user_review: The oil is "okay." I am an olive oil aficionada; that is, when it comes to olive oil, I have an especially refined palate. This is a medium-weight oil, not light, thin, or quickly absorbed on the tongue. The taste is ordinary with a slight peppery aftertaste. It is suitable for cooking, but not for dipping or for use to finish a dish. An additional, and not insignificant problem, is the packaging: fine oil tends not to be packaged in a tin can (which this is) and the pour spout drips oil sideways and collects along the rim (which has to be cleaned, and it wastes oil). The price is moderate and therefore competitive. I wanted to try it based on other reviews, and will use it, but will not purchase it again.

description: Fountain Flavor Chocolate Chip Mint by OliveNation is a concentrated flavoring thats perfect for sherbet, sorbet, hard and soft-serve ice cream, smoothies, shakes, diet drinks and more. It adds gourmet taste to all of your homemade frozen treats and beverages without adding calories. You can even use Fountain Flavor Chocolate Chip Mint with your soda machine. Try it in your favorite baked goods recipe as a substitute for a bakery emulsion. Fountain Flavor Chocolate Chip Mint is water-soluble, kosher, gluten-free, sugar-free, and calorie-free. How do you use Fountain Flavor Chocolate Chip Mint? For a four-cup ice cream, shake, or frozen dairy recipe, add 1 tablespoon of Fountain Flavor to your other ingredients. How does Fountain Flavor Chocolate Chip Mint work in baked goods? Fountain Flavor Chocolate Chip Mint is water-based, so it doesnt evaporate a quickly as an extract. The end result is a very flavorful and fragrant dessert. It also distributes evenly in batters and icings. In addition to frozen treats, shakes, and baked goods, what are some other ways to use Fountain Flavor Chocolate Chip Mint? You can use it to flavor whipped cream, icing, frosting and buttercream. Try it in a pudding or filling, too. Are there any recipes that you should not use Fountain Flavor Chocolate Chip Mint? Choose an extract instead of a Fountain Flavor in candy and chocolates recipes because of their liquid concentrations. Though, you can use Fountain Flavor in candy fillings.

description: Clear Cherry Flavor Organic Compliant by Olive Nation gives baked goods the taste of fresh cherries. Try the fruity flavoring in cookies, pies, ice cream, and more. You can flavor candies, beer, wine, and chocolates with it, too. Our organic-compliant cherry flavoring is colorless, so it won't change the color of white cakes. Order the delicious flavoring today to add the tart-sweet taste of cherries to your baked treats. The delicious flavoring pairs especially well with vanilla and chocolate. Clear Cherry Flavor Organic Compliant is gluten-free and sugar-free. Can Clear Cherry Flavor Organic Compliant be used in Frosting or Smoothies? You can add a small amount of the flavoring to whipped cream, frosting, smoothies, and shakes. Like baking extracts, the flavoring is suspended in alcohol, which cooks off during baking or cooking. For no-bake applications, we recommend that you use a small amount to maintain the flavor of your dish. Here are some delicious ideas for working with Clear Cherry Flavor: Make a cherry-flavored filling. Make homemade cherry ice cream. Boost the flavor of cherry cheesecake. Flavor a fruit sauce, salad dressing, or vinaigrette.

description: Caramel Extract Smooth, creamy and full of sweet flavor, Caramel Extract is a perfect blend of color, taste and balance for your delectable desserts. Add to cinnamon buns, dips, chocolate chip cookies, cakes and cream recipes for an explosion of infused natural caramel flavor that compliments many other natural flavors like apple, vanilla and chocolates. Take a basic sugar cookie recipe to new heights or enhance the flavor of your favorite icing. Add to butter creams for a smooth taste or serve a hearty dip alongside apple slices for a fun appetizer. The recipes are endless, the ideas are there; all you need to do is open your mind to the possibilities. Easy Caramel Dip Easy, quick and a crowd pleaser! One 8oz package of cream cheese, softened Â¼ cup of packed brown sugar 2 tsp Caramel Extract Blend all ingredients until smooth. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve alongside fruits and crackers for an amazing dipping experience. Homemade Caramel Corn Bring the sweet snack of the carnival in to your home! 2 cups of packed brown sugar Â½ cup of karo syrup 1 cup of butter 1 Â½ tsp caramel extract 1 cup unpopped popcorn Start out by popping the kernels and set aside. In a large saucepan, boil the brown sugar, butter and karo syrup for five minutes. Stir in the caramel extract. Pour over the popped kernels and stir gently to combine. Spread the coated popcorn out on a baking sheet lined with foil and a light coating of oil. Bake in a 225 degree oven for one hour, stirring every 15 minutes. PS. description: For a smoothly sweet flavor, chefs have been turning to butterscotch for decades. This sweet treat is made by combining just the right amount of melted brown sugar, butter and other ingredients. The mixture is traditionally allowed to harden into butterscotch candy and broken into pieces to enjoy, or it can be distilled into butterscotch extract that can be used in coffee, cocktails, and various food recipes. OliveNationâ€s Butterscotch Extract provides a rich butterscotch flavor using only the best ingredients. Our butterscotch extract utilizes the freshest unsalted butter, cane brown sugar, and other ingredients that are painstakingly distilled at optimum temperature to create a gourmet delight. The essence of butter and brown sugar, our butterscotch extract is a main ingredient in desserts, candies, and baked goods. It is even used to flavor liquors for designer cocktails and specialty drinks. While butterscotch extract is essential to some popular recipes, there are an endless variety of ways that the butterscotch extract can be used. Mix some of our butterscotch extract into your morning coffee for a special treat, or add it to brownie recipes for moist, sweet brownies that everyone will love.

description: Are you looking for delicious coffee available in a wide selection at a great value? Then San Franciso Bay Coffee is for you! description: Sweet Earth Baja Breakfast Frozen Burrito ofrece ingredientes que importan y sabor que ofrecen en una deliciosa comida congelada. Este burrito vegetariano de desayuno contiene huevos sin jaula, tocino vegetal, papas, pimientos de chile Poblano, Monterey Jack y quesos cheddar. Este burrito Sweet Earth incluye 0.56 oz de proteína, y es una buena fuente de calcio. Disfruta de una mezcla intencional de proteínas vegetales, verduras, hierbas y especias en este alimento vegetariano. Los alimentos Sweet Earth cuentan con un sabor excepcional y bondad en una variedad de diferentes productos de proteínas a base de plantas, moviendo la aguja hacia un planeta más feliz. Los burritos congelados Sweet Earth son aptos para microondas y pueden estar listos en tan solo 3 minutos. Mantener congelado hasta que esté listo para disfrutar.Sweet Earth Baja Breakfast Frozen Burrito bietet Zutaten, die wichtig sind und schmecken, die in einem köstlichen Tiefkühlkost liefern. Dieses vegetarische Frühstücksburrito enthält käfigfreie Eier, Speck auf pflanzlicher Basis, Kartoffeln, Poblano Chilischoten und Monterey Jack und Cheddarkäse. Dieser Burrito Sweet Earth enthält 16 Gramm Protein und ist eine gute Kalziumquelle. Genießen Sie eine gewollte Mischung aus pflanzlichem Eiweiß, Gemüse, Kräutern und Gewürzen in diesem vegetarischen Frühstück. Sweet Earth Foods bieten außergewöhnlichen Geschmack und Güte in einer Vielzahl von verschiedenen pflanzlichen Proteinprodukten und bewegen die Nadel zu einem glücklicheren Planeten. Sweet Earth Frozen Burritos sind mikrowellengeeignet und können in nur 3 Minuten fertig sein. Halten Sie sie gefroren, bis Sie sie genießen können.Sweet Earth Baja Breakfast Burrito Frozen מציע מרכיבים חשובים וטעם המספקים אוכל קפוא טעים. בוריטו ארוחת בוקר צמחונית זה מכיל ביצים ללא כלובים, בייקון מבוסס צמחים, תפוחי אדמה, פלפלי צ'ילי פובלננו, ג'ק מונטריי וגבינות צ'דר. בוריטו Sweet Earth כולל 16 גרם של חלבון, והוא מקור טוב לסידן. תיהנו מתערובת מכוונת של חלבונים, ירקות, עשבי תיבול ותבלינים במזון ארוחת בוקר צמחוני זה. מזונות Sweet Earth כוללים טעם יוצא דופן וטוב במגוון מוצרי חלבון שונים המבוססים על צמחים, מזיזים את המחט לעבר כוכב לכת שמח יותר. בוריטו הקפואים של Sweet Earth ניתנים למיקרוגל ויכולים להיות מוכנים תוך 3 דקות. שמרו על הקפאה עד שהם מוכנים להנאה.يوفر البوريتو المجمدة سويت إيرث باجا للإفطار المكون من مكونات خاصة وطعم تقدم طعام مجمد لذيذ. يحتوي هذا البوريتو النباتي للإفطار على بيض خالٍ من الأقفاص، ولحم الخنزير المقدد النباتي، والبطاطا، وفلفل البوبلانو، وفلفل الفلفل الحار، ومونتيري جاك وجبن شيدار. يحتوي هذا البوريتو من سويت إيرث على 16 جرام من البروتين، وهو مصدر جيد للكالسيوم. استمتع بمزيج مقصود من البروتين النباتي والخضروات والأعشاب والتوابل في طعام الإفطار النباتي هذا. تتميز أطعمة سويت إيرث بنكهة وجودة استثنائية في مجموعة متنوعة من منتجات البروتين النباتية المختلفة، حيث تتحرك الإبرة نحو كوكب أكثر سعادة. بورتوس المجمدة من سويت ايرث قابلة للاستخدام في الميكروويف ويمكن أن تكون جاهزة في أقل من 3 دقائق. اتركها مجمدة حتى تصبح جاهزة للاستمتاع.Sweet Earth Baja Breakfast Frozen Burrito oferece ingredientes que importam e sabor que proporcionam uma deliciosa comida congelada. Este burrito vegetariano contém ovos sem gaiola, bacon à base de plantas, batatas, pimenta poblano, Monterey Jack e queijos cheddar. Este burrito Sweet Earth inclui 16 gramas de proteína e é uma boa fonte de cálcio. Desfrute de uma mistura intencional de proteína à base de plantas, legumes, ervas e especiarias nesta comida vegetariana para café da manhã. Os alimentos Sweet Earth apresentam um sabor e bondade excepcionais em uma variedade de produtos de proteína à base de plantas, movendo a agulha para um planeta mais feliz. Os burritos congelados da Sweet Earth podem ir ao micro-ondas e podem estar prontos em apenas 3 minutos. Mantenha congelado até estar pronto para desfrutar.Sweet Earth Baja 早餐 冷冻 Burrito 提供美味冷冻食物的美味配料。 这款素食早餐卷饼包含无笼的鸡蛋、植物培根、土豆、波布拉诺辣椒、蒙特里杰克和切达奶酪。 这款 Sweet Earth 卷饼含有 16 克蛋白质,是钙质的良好来源。 在素食早餐食物中,享受植物蛋白质、蔬菜、草药和香料的故意混合物。 Sweet Earth Foods 在各种植物蛋白质产品中具有独特的味道和美味,使针头朝着更幸福的星球。 Sweet Earth 冷冻卷饼可微波加热,只需 3 分钟即可准备就绪。 冷冻,直到准备享用。Sweet Earth Baja Breakfast Frozen Burrito 提供重要和風味的成分,以美味的冷凍食品製成。 這款素食早餐捲餅包含無籠雞蛋、植物性培根、馬鈴薯、波布拉諾辣椒、蒙特雷傑克和切達起司。 這款 Sweet Earth Burrito 含有 16 克蛋白質,是鈣質的好來源。 這款素食早餐食品中,您可有意混合植物蛋白、蔬菜、草藥和香料。 Sweet Earth 食物在各種不同的植物蛋白產品中具有卓越的風味和優點,將針頭轉向更快樂的星球。 Sweet Earth 冷凍炸玉米餅可微波爐使用,只需 3 分鐘即可完成。 保持冷凍狀態直到準備享用。Sweet Earth Baja Breakfast 겨울왕국 부리토는 맛있는 냉동 음식에 전달되는 물질과 맛을 제공합니다. 이 베지테리언 브렉퍼스트 부리토에는 케이지 프리 계란, 식물 기반 베이컨, 감자, 포블라노 칠리 페퍼, 몬테레이 잭 및 체다 치즈가 포함되어 있습니다. Sweet Earth 부리토는 16g의 단백질을 함유하고 있으며 칼슘의 좋은 공급원입니다. 식물성 단백질, 채소, 허브 및 향신료를 의도적으로 혼합한 채식주의 아침 식사 음식을 즐기세요. Sweet Earth 음식은 다양한 식물 기반 단백질 제품에서 탁월한 맛과 장점을 특징으로 하며 바늘을 더 행복한 행성으로 옮깁니다. Sweet Earth 냉동 부리토는 전자레인지 사용이 가능하며 3분 안에 준비할 수 있습니다. 즐길 준비가 될 때까지 얼려주세요.

review.user_review: Love Amy's frozen meals. This has healthy ingredients that are easy to understand, great taste, decent size and price reasonable

description: Amy's Mushroom Risotto Bowl is a delectable dish the whole family is sure to enjoy. Tender, organic Arborio rice meets the rich flavor of porcini mushrooms and young green peas in a creamy sauce. Those looking for the easy way to achieve perfectly cooked risotto need look no further! Convenient and easy to prepare, this Amy's Mushroom Risotto Bowl contains milk and non-GMO ingredients, is gluten free, soy free and tree nut free, and is suitable for kosher diets. Since 1987, we at Amy’s Kitchen have produced delicious, convenient foods for people who are sometimes too busy to cook. Amy’s is a family-run business, and we supervise every aspect of our business and take pride in customer satisfaction. description: GOODNESS IS OUR GUIDING PRINCIPLE. We choose what’s best for our customers, our farmers, our employees and our planet. It’s a tall order, but we wouldn’t have it any other way. We’re not in the business of making shareholders happy. In fact, we don’t have shareholders. We’re in the business of cooking delicious, organic vegetarian meals for everyone. We were organic before it was a national certification. So when the U.S. Department of Agriculture decided to create standards for organic, they looked to us for guidance. Together with other industry leaders, we helped pioneer the organic food industry and, more importantly, we helped make organic food available to more people. All of our dishes are non-GMO and we’re a proud supporter of GMO labeling initiatives. Because we believe that people have a right to know what they put in their bodies. We were also the first to market with non-BPA-lined cans, and we’re happy to see many other food companies following our lead.

target.user_review_title: Nice Tea But It's NOT Organic
target.user_review:
I asked the seller a couple of questions about this tea. One was rather specific. Is this USDA Certified Organic? They skirted around the question & indicated it claims organic with the fake organic symbol on the bag. This is of course illegal in the USA.

The stupid pyramid tea bag sachets are made from corn. Great. GMO corn most likely. This is not a Non GMO Verified product. I will NOT use these bags.

I cut the tea out of the bag & use my tea infuser. The tea is very good. Mushrooms don't always work with green tea. Personally I prefer my mushroom powders with things like home made hot cacao & sometimes in organic pu-erh tea which is a robust super dark, coffee looking hot cuppa.

The tea leaves in this are beautiful. This is so surprising for tea bag tea which more commonly uses tea "dust". Also, the mushrooms are in little pieces. I provided two photos so you can see how lovely this tea is.

I've been enjoying this hot with organic dark maple syrup & organic Oatsome Barista oat milk (sadly I cannot tolerate dairy). It is very good. It's even better with a wee nibble of dark chocolate. The in the mouth combination is near perfection.

There are 20 tea bags complete with glued on string & tags.

Country Of Origin aka COO: Taiwan.

review.user_review_title: Too Bitter To Be Ceremonial Grade - Not Organic
review.user_review:
I've been drinking organic ceremonial matcha tea for about a decade. To this day, I will always be grateful that I didn't cheap out with some sort of low end culinary grade. If I had, I may have never drank another cuppa matcha again.

This has a bitter finish & it leaves a lot of sludge at the bottom of my cup. A true organic Japanese ceremonial grade matcha requires nothing more than hot water. It is naturally sweet with no bitterness. Some may have stronger flavors & creaminess than others, but they should always be a vibrant green, sweet smelling & tasting, with no grit or sludge.

My All Time Favorites So Far:
Kagoshima Matcha by Japanese Green Tea Co. (https://smile.amazon.com/dp/B09FH2Z3M1)
Weil Matcha Kari (https://smile.amazon.com/gp/product/B099KT28XN)

I've also tried (all sold as Ceremonial Grade) over the past decade:

Very Good:
Pantenger, DoMatcha, Midori Springs, FKRO, SASZ Organic Okumidori, KOKORO EN

Good:
Encha, Terraris

Okay-ish:
Ippodo, Kenko (between okay & good), Pure Synergy (between okay-ish & disgusting), Koyoto Dew Matcha (between okay-ish & disgusting), KOORO, DRSG, Matcha Moon Gyokuro, teafy

Disgusting:
SmileTea, Imperial Tea, Teami, Super Matcha, Hybrid Herbs, Matcha Moon, Kuma Tea, Distinctly Organic, Use Matcha, Green Leaf Tea, Natures Bluepring, Eco Heed, Viva Naturals, Matcha Works, Chaism (China)

It's Been Too Long, I Don't remember, so Probably Not too great lol:
Yamasan Kyoto Uji, Kawashimaya, Medimatcha, MatchaForGood, Zenato, PAIS, Akira, Matcha Organics, Be Love Body

Jade Leaf:
No ceremonial grades by Jade Leaf have been good. I think I tried about 5 different types by Jade Leaf before I gave up on them. For non ceremonial grade their Artisanal "Ceremonial" Matcha Green Tea Powder for Lattes is good when made as a latte; heavy on the whitener (I use Oatsome Barista organic oat milk) & sweetener. It is NOT ceremonial grade as advertised.

review.user_review_title: Bitter, Astringent Matcha From China | *Updated From 1 Star - Tea Improved Greatly
review.user_review:
Updated to 3 Stars March 14, 2023:

In December the seller contacted me asking me to give them another try. I ignored the email & forgot about it for a long while with the holidays & all that. Finally I figured what the heck, why not? They claimed that they improved the tea. I had my doubts. But hey, they want to send me new improved organic matcha, I'm game.

What do you know? It IS better! Color me surprised. For matcha from China this new box they sent is surprisingly good. I would have updated this to four stars, but they asked me to change my review once I told them the tea was better. Nothing super wrong with that, but it did irritate me a little. Maybe I'm a turd. I don't know.

To be clear true matcha is from Japan & they (Japan) have some amazing matcha & some awful matcha (they also have stricter/cleaner growing methods). Usually matcha from China is nasty. This was nasty. Now it's not. Maybe they improved how they grow it &/or how they harvest it.

If you decide to try this & don't like it. You might want to contact the seller. They really do seem to want to have a good reputation & happy customers. After all, they didn't ask for a review change until I said that the tea was better than their previous tea.

Unlike the tea in the original review below, I am actually drinking this. I had to throw out the original tea it was so disgustingly bad.

review.user_review_title: Very Good Matcha For The Price
review.user_review:
I've been drinking organic ceremonial matcha tea for about a decade. To this day, I will always be grateful that I didn't cheap out with some sort of low end culinary grade. If I had, I may have never drank another cuppa matcha again.

This has a light sweet scent & thick & creamy mouth feel that can finish with a slight bitterness at times. While I never boil water for my ceremonial matcha, this is easily made bitter by heat. Reducing how hot the water is does greatly reduces the bitter finish, making it more much palatable & similar in taste to ceremonial matcha. A true organic Japanese ceremonial grade matcha requires nothing more than hot water. It is naturally sweet with no bitterness. Some may have stronger flavors & creaminess than others, but they should always be a vibrant green, sweet smelling & tasting, with no grit or sludge.

For the price & quantity, this is actually pretty decent.

USDA & JAS Certified Organic.

review.user_review_title: Too Bitter To Be Ceremonial Grade
review.user_review:
I've been drinking organic ceremonial matcha tea for about a decade. To this day, I will always be grateful that I didn't cheap out with some sort of low end culinary grade. If I had, I may have never drank another cuppa matcha again.

This has a bright green color & thick & creamy mouth feel that ends with a surprising bitterness. While I never boil water for my ceremonial matcha, I've never had a brand that was this easily made bitter by heat. Reducing how hot the water is does reduce the bitterness, making it more palatable. However, it is not 100% free from a bitter finish like higher quality matchas. It is easy to whisk with no gritty foam.

I've been torn between rating this at 3 or 4 stars. I think 3.5 would be fair. 4 seems a bit too generous.

USDA & JAS Certified Organic.

My All Time Favorite So Far:
Kagoshima Matcha by Japanese Green Tea Co. (Link: https://smile.amazon.com/Kagoshima-Organic-Matcha-Green-Powder/dp/B09FH2Z3M1)

product.title: Dr Steven Gabriel Lab Tested Organic Japanese Matcha Green Tea Powder | 4x more Theanine compared to regular Ceremonial Grade | Highest EGCG & Antioxidant Rich
features: True Japanese Ceremonial Grade Matcha: Ceremonial Grade Matcha in the Japanese tea industry MUST be made with shade grown, first harvest tea leaves. We work directly with our farmers to produce true ceremonial matcha that is shade grown for 3-4 weeks. Only the top 3 Spring leaves in the Matcha tree are handpicked once a year for our Matcha. The result is a nutrient dense, vibrant green, intense flavoured Matcha which tastes sweet, creamy and silk with no astringency.

100% Organic: USDA Certified Organic with an organically certified tea farm. Lands are free from pesticides and harmful fertilizers at least 3 years prior to certification and undergo strict annual inspections and audits.

Highest Theanine & EGCG: Each batch is Lab tested to contain 80-110mg/2g of Theanine and 180mg/2g of EGCG. Higher Theanine content means the Matcha will be sweeter, greener and more nutrient-dense. EGCG is a superfood, anti-aging catechin that Matcha is known for.

Single Origin Matcha from Japan: Other matcha is typically made from a blend of tea leaves from various farms, making it impossible to know where the matcha is from, or what's in it. Our special batch Matcha is grown in a single estate tea farm Kagoshima in rich organic volcanic soil, cultivated by a 5th generation soil master. This region is superior to matcha grown in overly harvested tourist areas like Uji in the Kyoto region.
Fresh Ground: Matcha loses potency if it is ground right after harvesting and placed in storage for months. Our matcha is fresh ground to order and sent to our customers.
Love It or Your Money Back: if you are not 100% satisfied with your purchase of our Matcha for any reason, we'll refund your order in full, no questions asked.

I've been drinking organic ceremonial matcha tea for about a decade. I recently decided to try a variety of brands I hadn't tried yet to see if I'd find a new favorite & I did. This tea out of the 5 total I ordered at the same time rates as the best tasting. You can smell it's sweetness the moment you open it. The color is bright & rich. It whisks smooth. Not bitter at all with a creamy mouthfeel & slight sweetness. No grit in the foam & no sediment at the bottom. What a fabulous find on Amazon!

Best:
Kagoshima Tea Organic Ceremonial Grade Matcha Green
2nd Place:
FKRO Organic Ceremonial Grade Okumidori Matcha
3rd Place:
HelloBio Organic Ceremonial Matcha Infused

I've also tried (all sold as Ceremonial Grade) over the past decade:

Very Good:
Pantenger, DoMatcha, Midori Springs

Okay-ish:
Matcha Xen Okumidori, Matcha Xen Uji, Ippodo, Kenko (between okay & good), Pure Synergy (between okay-ish & disgusting), Koyoto Dew Matcha (between okay-ish & disgusting)

Disgusting:
SmileTea, Imperial Tea, Teami, Super Matcha, Encha, Hybrid Herbs, Matcha Moon, Kuma Tea, Distinctly Organic, Use Matcha, Green Leaf Tea, Natures Bluepring, Eco Heed, Viva Naturals, Matcha Works

It's Been Too Long, I Don't remember, so Probably Not too great lol:
Yamasan Kyoto Uji, Kawashimaya, Medimatcha, MatchaForGood, Zenato, PAIS, Akira, Matcha Organics, Be Love Body

Jade Leaf:
None by Jade Leaf have been good. I think I tried about 5 different types by Jade Leaf before I gave up on them.

description: One of the few Japanese teas to be designated a national treasure, Uji Matcha is one of Japan’s oldest traditional beverages. Served in tea ceremonies and on its own, this vibrant green tea powder comes from leaves grown only within the Kyoto prefecture -- renowned as the birthplace of Japanese tea.  Ranked amongst the most quintessentially sought after Japanese products, our super premium culinary grade Uji Matcha has a rich fragrance, vibrant green color, smooth texture, and delicate aftertaste. You can enjoy our Uji Matcha on its own or in other high-quality culinary creations. Our 100% USDA Organic Matcha green tea powders are premium ceremonial grade teas that are perfect for the traditional Japanese Matcha Tea experience. Our Organic Matcha is grown without pesticides or harmful fertilizers, harvested by hand and stone ground to preserve its nutritional qualities.  A little history about Matcha: Matcha is a finely ground green tea powder that has been used for centuries in Japan as a ceremonial beverage. It has become an increasingly popular drink around the world due to its health benefits and energizing effects. However, much like fine wine, matcha can come in many different grades and quality levels so it's important to understand what you're actually buying before making your purchase. At the upper tier, Ceremonial grade matcha is the highest quality available and will typically have very fine particles with a deep green color (sometimes called "jade"). Ceremonial grade tea has been traditionally used for centuries by Zen priests and legend has it that it was used to promote spiritual awakening.

It doesn't have the sweet scent of some ceremonial matchas, but it makes up for that in flavor. It whisks up beautifully with no sludge or lumps at the bottom. It is bright green in color with a smooth sweet flavor that is not bitter.

review.user_review_title: The best tasting ceremonial grade matcha I have had the pleasure of sipping in a very long time.
review.user_review:
I have tried a lot of different certified organic ceremonial grade matcha from amazon vine & haven't been thrilled with any of them until now. This matcha is perfection. It is some of the best tasting ceremonial grade matcha I have had the pleasure of sipping in a very long time.

I noticed immediately upon opening the canister, the sweet & fresh grassy smell. The color is a vibrant green. It mixes beautifully with no lumps. The taste is smooth. Zero bitterness. It doesn't need sweetener. It's perfect.

I've been drinking USDA/JAS Certified Organic Ceremonial grade matcha for a little over a decade. I've had a lot of types. The low end stuff that really has no business calling itself ceremonial can usually be consumed if enough sweetener is added. Basically, a latte. The good stuff, like this brand, requires nothing. It stands on it's own.

If you've never had matcha or have only had culinary grade & as a result claim you don't like matcha, I don't blame you. Culinary is garbage. It's a dull dark green without a hint of sweetness & plenty bitter. Don't be put off by the tiny canisters of ceremonial grade matcha. It doesn't seem like much for the price, but depending on how many cuppas you enjoy per day, one canister could last you a month (1 cuppa per day). Don't boil the water. You want hot water, not boiling. This isn't black tea. Green tea is ruined by boiling water. Make sure your matcha is from Japan. Heck, make sure all of your tea is from Japan. Tea from Japan has the least amount of heavy metals. Last, look up how to drink ceremonial matcha so you can enjoy it properly.

review.user_review_title: Not Bad, But Not Ceremonial Grade
review.user_review:
The color of this is a dull light green, not a bright spring green. The first taste is actually good, but it finishes with too much astringency. If it was priced lower I'd say it's not bad for what you get, but I get better, sweeter, & smoother tasting certified organic ceremonial grade matcha for less that this. This is not a good price for what you get.

If you've never had matcha, don't get this. Too many people get cheaper culinary grade for their first try & then declare that they hate matcha. I'd hate it too if that's what I drank. Culinary can work in overly sweetened lattes, but for a true cuppa quality matcha, spend the extra money & get ceremonial grade. DoMatcha, Pantenger, & Kenko are all organic affordable options with good flavor to get you started.

I wont go so far to call this matcha culinary grade, but it most definitely is not ceremonial. It requires a bit more sugar to make the flavor more palatable. It's not terrible, but there are much better teas available. I don't regret getting this, but I doubt I'd get it again.

review.user_review_title: Surprisingly Good Ceremonial Matcha From China
review.user_review:
I've been drinking organic ceremonial matcha for many years. I realize it has become popular of late, so now there are a lot of matcha options out there. You can get Chinese ceremonial matcha or traditional Japanese ceremonial matcha. I prefer to get authentic organic ceremonial Japanese matcha & as a rule, try my best to avoid Chinese matcha.

When I ordered this, there was no mention of where the tea is from. Only that it is certified organic ceremonial matcha. When it arrived, I discovered it's from China. For this reason alone I took off a star.

The matcha is surprisingly good. Better than a lot of so-called ceremonial matchas on the market. It is not bitter. It is a nice bright green. Not a dirty green, dull green, or brownish green. It is a beautiful bright green. The flavor is very good. It also mixes well. If it wasn't from China, it would be darn near perfect.

If you are new to matcha, pay attention. You can get two types, ceremonial or culinary (& as mentioned above they can come from China or Japan). If you just want to enjoy a nice cuppa, get ceremonial. If you want to put it in a smoothie or use it in baking, you can get the cheap culinary grade if you want. Culinary is never as bright a green & it never tastes as sweet & smooth as ceremonial. Culinary is also much more bitter. You will also want to prepare your ceremonial matcha properly. You can order a matcha set which is a wonderful way to enjoy the tea (yes, I have my own matcha bowls, whisks, etc.) or you can use a regular tea mug. The key is to add just a tiny bit of water to the powder to form a paste, then finish adding the water & whisk or stir. If you do not make a paste first, it will never fully incorporate & you will get a lousy cuppa. Also, never use boiling water. It brings out bitterness & ruins the tea. Hot water will do just fine.

Overall, I am rather pleased by this Chinese matcha (I can't believe I'm saying that!).

description: Matcha is one of the most valuable green tea product, made with complicated technics and under strict conditions, dedicated for aristocrats only in the past.  Our matcha is made respecting all traditional processes: The leaves come from yabukita tea trees – a specie cultivated by Japanese and dedicated for matcha, all using traditional methods and without adding anything. This Zenato USDA organic ceremonial grade matcha green tea powder is made of the top level tender, first harvest tea leaves full of vitamins and amino acids, It is a good choice for matcha fan with experiences organizing a matcha ceremony. It tastes greatly fresh with pure flavor of tender green tea leaves, almost no bitter taste, it is ideal for making both thin and thick matcha (few or lots of powder), providing a rich amount of nutrition and antioxidants. It lets you enjoy the pure lovely taste of matcha without need to be mixed with anything else.
Tips for consummation and storage

- Matcha should be kept away from heat, moisture, light and air exposure, it’s suggested keeping it in your refrigerator and get it well-sealed.  - As a kind of green tea without any additive, matcha doesn’t really “expire” quickly but its taste will downgrade through time especially when not well stored, thus we recommend consuming it within 2 - 3 months since the first opening. When outdated, you can still use it for bakery.  - Overheating will damage the chlorophyll in matcha and make the beverage yellow, it is not suggested to consume this ceremonial matcha with boiling water, enjoy it with water of 158 ℉ ideally. - Matcha is milled premium tea leaves so they are not dissolvable, please whisk it and consume it before precipitating.

H2O is one of the most powerful - and essential - elements on the planet. At Bai, we’ve reimagined and expanded water’s superpowers beyond basic hydration. And we really went for it. Bai is…. vitamin C and antioxidant-infused, exotic-Flavored, infused with little-known coffee fruit, tea extract infused for natural caffeine, naturally sweetened, colored & flavored, and contains 1 gram of sugar and 10 calories per bottle. Bai is a plant-powered antioxidant infusion that delivers more than you’ve ever expected from regular H2O. We wondered what water could truly be, and we made it wonderful. A drink that tastes great and is also good for you? It’ll be love at first sip.

review.user_review: I just drank one of these. I didn’t have any problems with my order like some of these other reviews had. My order was perfect! I got what I paid for just fine. Now that I drank it, I want to see if it keeps me awake today with the caffeine in it. That’s my concern. I wanted a boost today. I did my house cleaning. And I have to read information in my course today. So I want to be awake! I don’t want this stuff putting me to sleep, cos it’s a bit boring. But for now… highly recommend!

description: At Bai, we’ve reimagined and expanded water’s superpowers beyond basic hydration. Bai® beverages are antioxidant, plant-powered infusions that deliver more than you ever expected from regular H2O. We wondered what water could truly become, and then we made it. Bai, It’s WonderWater™. Now, get the boost of energy you need and the great taste you want with Bai Boost™, available in three exotic fruit flavors: Buka Black Raspberry, Watamu Strawberry Watermelon and Togo Tangerine Citrus. Bai Boost is made with clean ingredients including plant-based energy from tea extract to help get you charged up. With 110mg of caffeine (as much as a cup of coffee) from tea extract, plus all the hydration beneﬁts of a water beverage, Bai Boost is antioxidant-infused with a good source of vitamin C, and contains 1 gram of sugar per bottle. With no artificial flavors or sweeteners, Bai Boost delivers a refreshing, delicious flavor for those seeking better alternatives to high-calorie drinks containing synthetic caffeine not found in nature. Feel good about getting a plant-based energy boost with the great taste of Buka Black Raspberry, Watamu Strawberry Watermelon and Togo Tangerine Citrus flavored infusions from Bai Boost!

description: this just in: there’s some good news for good people who like good stuff—there’s more of it (because we put more in there). sweetened with plant-based monk fruit and stevia leaf extracts, it's a great choice for those looking for a sugar-free option. you know the bottle of liquid beverage that has a color moment everywhere it goes? yeah, you know the one.  well, xxx is the same zero sugar acai-blueberry-pomegranate flavored water beverage with vitamins and deliciousness, but now it’s a bazillion times more good because of all the nutrient enhancements and its sports-level hydration. and yes, it still has an iconic color moment everywhere it goes (we could never change that).  okay, okay, let’s get to the point. what does this upgrade mean for you? it means vitamins. and electrolytes. and more nutrients. which are all good things. with zero sugar and 0 calories per 20oz bottle.  it also means this vitaminwater xxx has three types of antioxidants to help fight free radicals: vitamin A, vitamin C and selenium. and that's bad news for the people who like bad stuff.  so, make sure to pick up a pack if you’re a do-gooder or a good stuff appreciator or a color icon, just like us.

description: Give your taste buds a summertime treat year-round with new Watermelon mint smartwater, the vapor-distilled water You love infused with natural fruit and herbal flavors. It's the perfect way to stay hydrated when you need to recharge while working at the office or commuting home, or when you need a refreshing treat as a part of your health and wellness routine. Each drop of smartwater is purified through vapor distillation, a process inspired by the clouds and the way water is purified in nature. You won't find any sugar or calories in any bottle of smartwater. What you will find is electrolytes added for taste and purely balanced pH, giving you a refreshing way to hydrate. Each sip of watermelon mint smartwater is like a sip of spa Water, giving you a taste that's pure and crisp with a tasty summertime appeal. Watermelon mint smartwater is available in 700 Ml bottles-the perfect Size for when you need that quick moment of refreshment. And don't forget to try all of our delicious flavor-infused waters including pineapple Kiwi, Strawberry blackberry and cucumber Lime.

review.user_review:
I just drank one of these just now. It was really good. I was tired from doing housework. It’s hot in here. I’m sweating a lot. I drank this and it gave me some pep in my step! The flavor is super good! I wanted a little more than just plain water today. Really happy with this. Must buy more! Highly recommend!

Update: 08/16/2022- so far I’ve tried 3 flavors of this drink. They’re all really good! I had the black cherry today. I had the orange raspberry and kiwi strawberry. Really love it! But most of all, I feel better after drinking them. I don’t feel run down anymore from working around the house and sweating a lot. When you put them in the fridge they get really cold and they’re so refreshing to drink.

This is how Gatorade does water.

target.user_review_title: Tastes good and I feel brilliant
target.user_review: If you have not ever tried nootropics, you should. Your brain will function at a better rate and why not have it get started while you are having a cup of coffee? It tastes just fine. It isn't bitter and it doesn't make you jittery. Of course, I haven't had a full pot of it yet. Who knows, tomorrow I may be extra energized

review.user_review: This Turkish coffee tastes pretty darn good. Now, I don't have a fancy Turkish cezve, Nor do I have the espresso cup. But, I can still make a cup of coffee without one. You can do this by getting a cup that can withstand heat. Add your water. Add your sugar and your coffee. Stir them together then put your cup on a medium heat. When it gets hot, you will see foam. Remove your cup from the heat and let the foam settle. Do this again at least one more time. Pour it in a mug or cup and let sit so the grounds can settle. Enjoy your coffee.

review.user_review: This coffee has a great coffee smell. That is always a great first sign. Then you make your pot or cup of coffee however you choose - I use an automatic coffee maker. The coffee aroma would make me get out of bed. Then you pour yourself a cup or mug or 32 ounce size double walled stainless steel container, add any sweeteners and/or cream, MCT oil mix. Add a dash of whip cream on the top with some Irish whiskey in the cup. It is your cup of coffee so have it your way. Take that sip and enjoy the rest of the morning. This is a good coffee.

description: Life is better with coffee: The first cup on a cold morning. The second cup after a late night. The one you get with a friend after a meeting that could have been an email. Segafredo Zanetti®’s blends don’t just invigorate your senses and fuel your day, they turn drinking coffee into an experience—and each of our blends offers a different one.
Our Brillante blend eases chocolate and molasses into a light roast through spritely notes of citrus and butterscotch. The result is a distinct, expressive blend that is also great for cold brew.

We make sure every ingredient, method, and bean is worthy of your cup. To keep your coffee at the peak of freshness, store in an airtight container in a cool, dry place and use within a week of opening. Life is better with coffee. And Segafredo Zanetti® makes coffee better.

review.user_review_title: I am now using this can of coffee
review.user_review: It is a smaller grind than I usually get in my coffee grinder, so there is some sludge in the bottom of the pot. The coffee is an all around type coffee. Not too strong, not too weak. It is an enjoyable cup of coffee. Even my husband has been drinking this coffee. He normally doesn't drink my pot of coffee with me, but he has been enjoying the leftover coffee for making iced coffee and he is asking more often if I have leftovers.

description: Since 1878, coffee lovers have been starting their day with a taste of always great coffee from Hills Bros. From the beginning, brothers Reuben and Austin Hills made an unwavering commitment to quality and Hills Bros Coffee was born. From the finest beans and most innovative roasting methods to our delectable blends, Hills Bros has been crafting delicious coffee without compromise to happy coffee drinkers worldwide. This French Roast dark blend is satisfyingly bold from the first sip to the last. Our ground coffee is made from coffee beans that are hand-selected from the finest growing regions around the world. Blended and roasted the same way since we started, you are guaranteed to consistently get a great cup of coffee.Hills Bros ground coffee is gluten free and Orthodox Union Certified Kosher, and our recyclable stainless-steel cans keep the coffee fresher longer. From the finest beans and most innovative roasting methods to our delicious blends, Hills Bros has delighted customers, blending and roasting amazing coffee for over a century. Today, Hills Bros Coffee continues to be crafted without compromise. Whether it’s your start to the day every morning, your afternoon pick-me-up or after dinner wind down, the authentic taste of always great coffee from Hills Bros will always be something to look forward to.

review.user_review_title: Yeah, I would drink any of the blends
review.user_review: I like my coffee. I drink different flavors. Usually I stick to arabica bean coffee that is unflavored. Like this Columbian coffee. This is a medium roast, so it isn't strong. But it isn't too weak either. I like my coffee and sometimes I even switch to pods or capsules, just for a change and use my Keurig or my Nescafe Gusto maker. Of course, I typically drink my coffee made in a pot instead of a cup. This fulfills the need for my pot of coffee each morning.

review.user_review_title: My guy loves his cold coffee
review.user_review: My husband likes his coffee cold. I do not. So, these work perfectly for him. No more making hot coffee and pouring it over a bunch of ice. This, you put to steepacks to 4 cups of water. Let it sit in the fridge for 10-12 hours and you have perfectly cold coffee, waiting for you to add your choice of sweetener, creams, flavors, etc. My husband is on the simple side, he just like 1/2 a glass of ice with coffee poured over and a lot of cream with his coffee. Instead of sugar, we use stevia, so he sweetens how he wants.

description: Our deliciously smooth Alpine Roast coffee combines Colombian beans that are precisely ground with the ease of a  SteePack filter to deliver the ultimate refreshing cup of Cold Brew coffee. Enjoy the notes of cocoa, plum & caramel.  Ensure high-quality coffee every time with product specifically picked for their cold brewing qualities. Two SteePack Filters yield 1 pitcher of Cold Brew (six 8 oz cups). No coffee maker needed. How to Cold Brew with Green Mountain Coffee Roasters, start with pouring four cups of cold water into a pitcher. Then add two Coffee SteePack filters (its normal for the SteePack filters to float.) Set in the refrigerator for 8-12 hours. Remove SteePack filters and add three cups of cold water to your pitcher (add more or less for your desired strength.) Two SteePack filters yield six cups of Cold Brew Coffee. Store in your fridge for up to a week.

GROUND COFFEE: Coffee grind size is important!  Coarsely ground coffee to allow optimal steeping.

review.user_review_title: Mushrooms used in China for medicinal benefits for thousands of years and you don't taste them
review.user_review: Mushroom coffee has been around for a while. I have had the mushrooms without the coffee but this company includes arabica beans that have a dark roast. The mushrooms have been dried and extracted and, as with the coffee, are 100% organic. In each cup, you get 100mg of caffeine from the coffee beans. The mushrooms give you the extra energy and it also helps with your immune system. Your first taste may not be the best tasting coffee you have ever had, but it isn't bad. And you get the benefits of the mushrooms, which are densely packed with nutrients. Cordyceps are even used to make your kidneys stronger. All in all, definitely worth the try and as you continue to drink it, you will become accustomed. The mushroom is so mild, people can't even detect it and would never know unless you tell them.

description: Sweet Sticks Edible Art Decorative Cake Paint

Edible Art Decorative Paint by Sweet Sticks is revolutionary paint made in Australia. With a unique blend of 100-percent edible ingredients, they can paint, dry and be rub free on many surfaces, making cake decorating quicker, easier and more effective. These paints take away the need to mix luster and alcohol together, a method that most of the time makes a big mess and causes money loss. Simply shake, pour and paint. Paints on fondant, buttercream cakes (chilled), royal icing, sugar cookies, marshmallows, gold leaf, deco magic, confectionery, ganache, modeling chocolate and more. Sweet Sticks edible paint can be applied using many different techniques, including brushes for detailed work. The manufacturer recommends using a quality sable brush or sponge. Sponge work also looks great on buttercream, fondant and royal icing. The paint is ready to use from the bottle, so there is no need to thin it out or mix it with any other ingredients. Once applied, it dries quickly and the pigment is sealed within the surface — no dust or smudges. If you require a water color effect, you can achieve that by adding cake decorators alcohol (high grade 95-percent alcohol) to your palette. Keep away from children and store in a dry cool place. Do not consume in liquid form. Wash used brushes with hot, soapy water, paper towel or baby wipes. Getting started: shake well before and during use. Try different paint brushes. Some streak, some do not. Take the time and play with your paints. Become familiar with them. Mix and match your own colors if you like. Why you are going to love it: Once dry, the paints are rub free. No fuss. The color is true. What you see is what you get. 100-percent food grade. Free of gluten, dairy and peanuts. A little bottle goes a long way.

The paint is ready to use from the bottle, so there is no need to thin it out or mix it with any other ingredients; once applied, it dries quickly and the pigment is sealed within the surface — no dust or smudges; if you require a water color effect, you can achieve that by adding cake decorators alcohol (high grade 95-percent alcohol) to your palette

Keep away from children and store in a dry cool place; do not consume in liquid form; wash used brushes with hot soapy water, paper towels or baby wipes; getting started: shake well before and during use; try different paint brushes: some streak, some do not; take the time and play with your paints; become familiar with them; mix and match your own colors if you like

Why you are going to love it: once dry, the paint is rub free; no fuss; the color is true; what you see is what you get; 100-percent food grade; free of gluten, dairy and peanuts; a little bottle goes a long way

description: We have developed a unique form of color and packaging for our products. To provide greater efficiency, quality, value and convenience for the decorator we created Soft Gel Paste™, a pourable, highly concentrated gel, breaking with the industry standard of a hard paste in a jar. We purposefully chose a bottle that looked different from anything else on the market—a squeezable bottle with a flip-top cap. This allows color to be dispensed in individual drops for clean and easy to repeat control from one application to the next. These highly concentrated soft gel food colors are formulated with the necessary die concentration levels needed to achieve the most vibrant and brilliant shades. Soft Gel Paste colors have a viscosity that offers the convenience of a pour-able gel, making it easier to measure amounts or duplicate shades. Only a small amount is needed to tint icing, fondant, marzipan, gum paste, or dough without affecting the consistency, and it will not break down buttercream or non-dairy icings like liquid colors. Product made in the United States. Ingredients: Water, sugar, and one or more of the following U.S. certified colors: Blue 1 (E133), Blue 2 (E132), Yellow 5 (E102), Yellow 6 (E110), Red 3 (E127), Red 40 (E129), titanium dioxide (E171), mica pigment, vegetable gum, modified corn starch, citric acid and less than 1/10 of 1% sodium benzoate and potassium sorbate as preservatives. *Due to the calibration differences between computer monitors, tablets, etc., the color you see here may not exactly match the finished product.

description: How to paint with Edible Art Metallic Decorative Paint by Sweet Sticks
Before you start:

Tip 1. Shake the bottle well to ensure the solid and liquid ingredients mix together to form an even consistency to paint with. You can also open the bottle and stir the mixture with the end of your paint brush before shaking. Shake the bottle each time before using the paint, including between sessions. If your paint is transparent, the ingredients haven’t mixed together Tip 2. Play with your paints, become familiar with them. Each color has different pigmentation, so get a feel for each color. Edible surfaces are all different, so also paint on different painting surfaces; the metallic paints can be applied to fondant, crusted buttercream cakes (chilled), sugar cookies, marshmallows, confectionery, ganache, modeling chocolate, macarons and fruits. Do not use these metallic paints on Italian or Swiss meringue buttercream as these surfaces keep the paints from air-drying and leave them in liquid form. Tip 3. These Metallic Paints prefer wide, flat brushes with soft bristlesTip 4. Have hot soapy water and paper towels on hand. When done with one color, wash your brush gently and dry at once with a paper towel; you can also wash the brush with dishwashing liquid in your hand, then rinse with hot water
How to paint:

Tip 1. Don’t load your brush with too much paint — it’s easier to build up the color than take it away. If another coat is needed (depending on your desired color), wait for the first coat to dry; thick coats of paint will take much longer to dry. Tip 2. This paint is designed to be used straight from the bottle. You can add a drop of 95-percent high-grade alcohol to thin the paint when needed.

Before you start, Tip 2 (tip 1 in first paragraph): Take the time to play with your paints, become familiar with them; each color has different pigmentation, so get a feel for each color; edible surfaces are all different, so also play with the paint on different painting surfaces; the metallic paints can be applied to fondant, crusted buttercream cakes (chilled), sugar cookies, marshmallows, confectionery, ganache, modeling chocolate, macarons and fruits

Do not use these metallic paints on Italian or Swiss meringue buttercream as these surfaces keep the paints from air-drying and leave them in liquid form; Tip 3 (in “before starting”): These Metallic Paints prefer wide, flat brushes with soft bristles; Tip 4. Have hot soapy water on hand with paper towels; when finished with one color, wash your brush gently and dry at once with a paper towel; you can also put (in your hand) dishwashing liquid, wash the brush in it and then rinse with hot water

How to paint: Tip 1. Less is more, so don’t load your brush with too much paint; it’s easier to build up the color than take it away; if a second coat is needed (depending on your desired color), wait for the first coat to dry; thick coats of paint will take much longer to dry; Tip 2. This paint is designed to be used straight from the bottle; you can add a drop of 95-percent high-grade alcohol to thin the paint when needed

Drying the paints: Tip 1. Wait 24 hours for these paints to air-dry; conditions like temperature and higher humidity can affect the drying process tremendously, so please allow time for this too; a fan can be used to speed the drying process; if paints aren’t air dried correctly, you may be left with a bitter taste; please note what these paints can paint on before you begin; Tip 2. When using these paints on Buttercream, allow time for drying before placing the cake back in the fridge

target.user_review: My second fave coconut water after Taste Nirvana in the can. I like these twist top containers and I first tasted it by buying a lot of the organic Foco on sale at a farmer's market. Tasted authentic, not weird, not salty, not like "cereal milk" as some do, or sickly candy sweet like some do. A very refreshing and not toooo sweet coconut water. I've got it on Subscribe and Save along with Taste Nirvana and enjoy both.

review.user_review_title: Very odd taste--like coconuts, or pina colada heavy on the coconut, with weird chemically tastes....
review.user_review: This is the kind of drink you'd have to get used to. I bought it to try one day when I hadn't had lunch and it was after 6pm and I was having my hair done--so went next door to the GNC for a protein drink and decided to try it. I drink coconut water nearly every day and I love the taste of coconut, so why not? Well, it is weird. I assumed it would be, cause it's got whey protein. But it's not so horrible you couldn't develop a taste for it if you wanted to. I just drank it down hard and fast to get the protein hit until I could eat a meal. But, really, a bit on the icky side. I can only say: try it. We all have different tolerance levels for those weird protein drink effects.

I think the taste is similar to the WHOLE FOODS brand coconut water. Just okay. Not horrible. Not sweet and killer good. I still prefer Taste Nirvana and the raw one that WHole Foods sometimes has in the refrigerated section (that sometimes turns pink).

This is pricey bought without discount. Amazon's price at 24 is better. For the cost, I expect to be wowed. BUT...I won't turn down a can if offered one. :) (I would turn down VitaCoco and even ONE these days. What the heck happened to ONE. It's been nasty-nasty lately when I've been offered a serving by relatives. Ick.)

I didn't try this from buying on Amazon. I got a couple cans on sale at Whole Foods. If this sold for a buck a can, I'd stock up. For 2 bucks a can: I don't think so. I'd rather pay more for Taste Nirvana and get a sweeter, happy-making coconut water.

Again, taste buds differ. Some folks prefer a less intense sweetness. But for me, this doesn't cut it for the price.

Nutritional Info (from company website, since I already drank and disposed of the cans):

ONE CAN = one serving
100 calories
Fat 0g
Sodium 132mg
Potassium 586mg
Carbohydrates: 25.4 g
Fiber 0g
Sugars 22g
Calcium 4%
Magnesium 6%
Iron 4%
Phosphorus 4%

review.user_review_title: Decent flavor--bit salty, not very sweet. Big plus is the great convenience. Future pantry staple, methinks!
review.user_review:
I love coconut water and have been drinking it since I was a kid, when the only way I liked it was from the coconut. When the explosion of coconut water in tetrapaks and cans came about a few years back, it was a boon to me. I've tried so many brands I've lost track, but in the past few months, I've settled into a few faves-- Taste Nirvana and some raw version Whole Foods sells that totally tastes like it came out of a shell within minutes of purchase.

I bought this because I thought it would be good to add potassium and minerals to smoothies and to have on hand for when I wanted coconut water but ran out of cans. (Subscribe and save is a monthly thing and Whole Foods charges more than I wanna pay for my fave brand.) Since it's organic, that's a big plus.

Well, surprise. This is pretty darn pleasant.

Mixes very nicely and easily, too. And you can CUSTOMIZE, which I think is the bonus of reconstituting it yourself. For a stronger flavor, add more. Simple.

I'm not aware of the origin of the coconuts, but the flavor reminds me of South American coconut water as opposed to the Thai/Asian. It's not that sweet and it's a little salty, saltier than the Thai-origin brands I've enjoyed. Saltyish like O.N.E. and VitaCoco, but actually nicer than both those. Reconstituted, this baby's better than some non-dehydrated brands. Imagine that! Surprised me, for sure.

I'll definitely rebuy. This is a very handy thing to have in my pantry, cause I hate being out of coconut water.

This goes on my list, another Navitas product that satisfied this customer.

review.user_review_title: Pretty bad, and I drink coconut water daily, have tried many brands!
review.user_review:
I adore coconut water. Have since I was a kid. Have had it out of the shell (we are Caribbean folks), chilled, and from assorted canned and bottled types, with and without sugar. I've tried a host. Some brands I did not wish to revisit--VitaCoco is funky tasting to me. New Zico (bottle) sucks. Old Zico (tetrapak) used to be nice, but after an intolerable and underhanded experience with their marketers online, I refuse to buy them anymore. O.N.E. is fine, and my sister loves it. I've had Harvest Bay, Amy and Brian, Nature Factor, and some names I forgt. I prefer Taste Nirvana these days, when I can't get the fresh (ie, froms hell) or raw organic one that Whole Foods sometimes stocks.

This was not good. Naked. Ugh. I was out and about, thirsty, and stopped into a Nutrition S'Mart to buy coconut water. This was the only brand they had that I hadn't tried, so I went for it. Ugh. Never again. I cannot recommend this to coconut water lovers.

But, hey, I like to at least try other brands. You never know which one will rock your world.

And, as they say, different strokes. You may like this brand.

But you might wanna give Taste Nirvana, Amy and Brian, O.N.E. and some others a shot first, ya know? :D

Happy gulping!

review.user_review_title: My favorite one so far--coconutty, delicious chewy bits of pulp, refreshing, not too sweet!
review.user_review:
I've been through so many trials with coconut water. While fresh from a real coconut is always gonna be a special, special thing, it's not always convenient. So, I resort to canned coconut water. I've tried various (and reviewed many on Amazon), including Zico, ONE, Amy and Brian, etc.

This is my current fave. It really has a taste similar to fresh coconut water--as much as canned allows, I suppose--without being weirdly sweet (as A&B can be, especially the small cans) or weirdly salty (as VitaCoco can be) or just plain milky awful (like Zico in the bottle). My sister likes O.N.E. best, but I like this one. Sweeter, less salty than many I've tried.

I've had the pulp and no pulp versions, and prefer this one. Just a bit stronger flavor.

For now, I keep stocked with this and have a can nearly every day. If I didn't have to watch calories, I'd have two a day, no kidding. I wish it came in a smaller serving (say, 60 calories worth like ONE). But hey, small quibble. It's 130 heavenly calories with 1000 mg of Potassium. Helps keep the blood pressure down.

All Natural Taste Nirvana Coconut Water with Pulp is a great source of electrolytes.Sweetly crisp and refreshing - every Taste Nirvana offering we bring you is always approved by the experienced taste buds from our multi-generational Thai family business.

review.user_review_title: Fabulous tasting coconut water...NOT unnaturally sweet in the larger cans. YES, too sweet and AWFUL in the small cans.
review.user_review:
I was leery of trying the Amy & Brian's again after having this experience: AMAZING pulp-free tall cans. Horrible candy-water 10 oz cans. So, I have several cases of the short cans I refuse to drink. Awful. But I went through the cases of the tall cans. Wonderful.

I wondered if the inconsistencies would show up in the tall cans, and I did not reorder. THEN..this big sale and sub/save showed up. Tempted me. I ordered TWO cases of this one, with the pulp.

WONDERFUL. I like it even better than the pulp-free (which is weird, as I normally avoid pulp-containing packaged coconut water). I even found myself enjoying chewing the bits of pulp.The flavor is NOT too sweet, very nicely coconutty, not at all sour or weirdly salty like the new Zico, nicer than ONE and VitaCoco.

So, I feel free to order more now. Clearly, there is some issue with the smaller cans. I strongly recommend you avoid those like the plague. They taste nothing like coconut water. They taste like you dropped some generic sugar candy in water and let it dissolve. Really icky sweet and NOT AT ALL coconutty. (I have had fresh out of the shell coconut water since childhood, my family being from the Caribbean, and have tasted virtually every brand available locally and on Amazon, and I know coconuts vary according to region and even harvest areas etc. Coconut water IS variable, so I don't expect homogeneous flavor. I do expect it to be coconut water and not candy water (or corn cereal milk like new Zico)). So, yeah, avoid small cans. Amy & Brian really need to look into why that stuff is disgusting, cause it's ruining their reputation whenever someone tastes that horror.

The Tall Cans: Yes, buy these. I've sampled out of four different cases sent to me, always good. The pulp-free was more sweet compared to the tetra pak CW's I've tried, and the higher carb count makes sense. I even emailed the A&B people about it, and they said it was due to the blend/selection of coconuts that theirs is sweeter with a higher carb count. I can see how the selection could do this. I like the sweeter flavor, personally, but always have with meals cause it is higher carbs. When I want to drink coconut water by itself--I choose a lower carb variety, like original Zico was or ONE in a smaller quantity than the 17.5 ounce can.

Thumbs up. Refreshing, sweet, coconutty, lovely. I love, love, love this coconut water in the TALL CANS.

But I beg the Amyy & Brian folks to investigate and revamp the processing for the smaller cans. That stuff is vile and I have two cases plus sitting in my kitchen that I cannot drink. (Add that to the Zico I can't stomach and preordered and that's a lot of my money going to waste cause companies can't get it right/screw with a tried-true formula).

Happy sipping!

review.user_review_title: Great in the tall can, horrible in these small ones--edited review: don't buy these cans, get 17.5 oz ones!
review.user_review:
Please see update at the end of this review. For fairness sake, I'm leaving original review I did when I tried the 17.5 oz cans intact. But the smaller cans do not contain the same quality product. Whether bad batch (one time) or just bad distributor/supplier for small cans (ongoing), I'd beware. Now, the original review, then the updates:

This is far and away my fave coconut water now that I'm self-exiled from the horror that is new Zico (they ruined a terrific product by making it from concentrate).

Note that this comes in cans, not tetra paks, and the cans are BPA-free. These are recyclable (well, as long as your area accepts cans.) Note as well that Amy & Brian's coconut waters are flash-pasteurized (like ONE and Zico and others). Unless you wanna risk crazy bacteria, coconut water must have some sort of pasteurization.

I've been sampling various amazon-available coconut waters looking for my new staple. History: I was a loyal Zico subscriber/drinker for a couple years. They changed. It's awful. I canceled my subscription. I've had and enjoyed O.N.E. in the tetra pak and Nature Factor's organic in a can. I've had and not liked as much VitaCoco and Harvest Bay. But all those are fine depending on your own taste preferences. Previously, I had also tried supermarket brands like Goya and Conchita. I'm always willing to try coconut water, looking for good price and great taste. I decided to try Amy & Brian's cause I learned about them from googling "coconut water taste tests" due to wanting to see what others thought of the brands out there. One taste test comparison mentioned this one tasted most like the actual coconut that was used in the taste test for comparison. Another taste test gave A&B props, too. So, yeah, got my attention.

This one is now my new fave. I have subscribed to the A&B pulp free in both can sizes.

Second fave based on flavor alone (not processing, container, etc) is Nature Factor's organic one. After that O.N.E. VitaCoco is good for those who prefer less sweetness, more of a slightly sourness. Something out there for everyone, right?

I can say this to coconut water lovers: those above are definitely worth trying to see if you enjoy them, too, before you decide on a permanent subscription. But do try this one if you enjoy a bit more sweetness. So good. But if you hate any sort of higher sense of sweetness in your beverages, this isn't for you. I'd recommend ONE or Vitacoco for you, or maybe Harvest Bay.

What makes this one a bit different than the good brands I've named:

Big can option or small can option: 17.5 ounces vs this one that's 10 ouncnes. I buy both now, cause some days I want the bigger can to take with me to Pilates.

Sweeter: Maybe it's where they get their coconuts from, but this brand has a delicious sweetness that is lacking on ONE, VitaCoco, Zico (old and new), and Harvest Bay. Nature Factor's is a bit sweeter than the previous, but Amy and Brian beats them all. I like sweet. :D Because another reviewer called it "unnaturally sweet", I emailed Amy & Brian via their website to ask if this is from concentrate or has sugar added or manipulated. I was told it's juice as it came from the coconuts, not from concentrate, no sugar added. So, I'm content.

Some facts:

8 oz = 76 calories
This is more than ounce per ounce for other brands, but this is probably explained by the sweetness (meaning more natural carbs). Worth noting for those who are on low-carb/carb-conscious diets. For the rest, it just means MORE FLAVOR.

I wish Amy & Brian would put the potassium count on the label, though. This matters to a lot of us, including those who need to watch K intake due to drugs that spare potassium or folks who have high blood pressure and want to see how much K in their diet controls it. To the manufacturer: PLEASE add potassium to labeling under the sodium. Thanks.

I love, love that amazon offers this on subcribe and save. Makes life easier. Thank you, Amazon, for this wonderful addition to your S&S coconut water offerings.

Enjoy and be healthy!

Update: I emailed Amy & Brian after I posted this review, and lo and behold, they will be adding Potassium and Magnesium to their labels. FYI, here are the counts:

Potassium: whole can: 780, 8 oz serving: 360
Magnesium: whole can: 31.2, 8 oz servinng: 14.4

I confirmed that A&B is "flash pasteurized", and got email from them to prove it, which is the same pasteurization used for the tetra paks, as I understand it, so the nutrients should be comparable. They heat their at a lower temp than, say, Zico's, but for a bit longer. If you google "Crossfit Adventure" and this coconut water brand name, you'll see the article about the specifics: A&B heats their juice to 160-165 degrees for 15-20 seconds so that the nutrient content is undiminished. Also, the can is not BPA - it is Aqualure 900~19%. The other brand I liked the taste of, Nature Factor, does heat up their CW to a very high degree, so that one may be of concern nutrients-wise. Not A&B.

They use Thai coconuts. :)

Addendum: For carb watchers-- The carb count for A&B is roughly twice that of others. I used the brands I had at hand at home (and a calculator) to save you time making comparisons. The number stands for carbs per ounce:

Amy & Brian: 2.375
Nature Factor Organic: 1.6
O.N.E.: 1.33
New Zico (from concentrate): 1.07

I think Old Zico was more like ONE in terms of carbs per ounce.

I wonder if the selection of coconuts can give higher sodium (see new Zico's much higher sodium count), then can the selection also be chosen to have higher carbs/more sweetness?

HTH

UPDATE: WHOA! Talk about variety. I have to say that my second order of Amy & Brian's is not as nice-tasting as the first. My first batch was really delicious and natural tasting. The second order tastes like candy-water. Seriously, it has an unnaturally sweet, unusual flavor. It's still not as offputting as the sour/cereal taste of the bottled Zico, but it's not something I'd recommend. So, a warning--you might get a great batch or a not so great one. But I thought you needed to know that flavor is not consistent (and it wasn't with original Zico, the one I used to drink the most, as coconuts will differ, coconut from coconut, therefore coconut water will have certain inconsistencies unless it's "jiggered" for consistency.) I hope, if you ordered, your batch is wonderful. But I am reconsidering my subscription, cause this variation is just a bit too disparate (a little change is fine, but from amazing to odd-sugary-candy-water will not do.) I have to amend my rating to three stars. HTH.

Update July 12, 2010: Okay, I couldn't resist the sale this month that gives me A&B for half off, so I ordered the large/tall can in the pulp version. FANTASTIC. It seems that every case I've gotten in the Tall cans is great. All the cases in the small cans are horrible. So, take my advice: skip these 10 oz cans and get the tall version of A&B, either with or without pulp. Delicious. A&B needs to research why those small cans are so bad versus the tasty and coconutty tall ones.

UPDATE: WHOA! Talk about variety. I have to say that my second order of Amy & Brian's is not as nice-tasting as the first. My first batch was really delicious and natural tasting. The second order in the 10 oz cans tastes like candy-water. Seriously, it has an unnaturally sweet, unusual flavor. It's still not as offputting as the sour/cereal taste of the bottled Zico, but it's not something I'd recommend. So, a warning--you might get a great batch or a not so great one. But I thought you needed to know that flavor is not consistent (and it wasn't with original Zico, the one I used to drink the most, as coconuts will differ, coconut from coconut, therefore coconut water will have certain inconsistencies unless it's "jiggered" for consistency.) I hope, if you ordered, your batch is wonderful. But I am reconsidering my subscription, cause this variation is just a bit too disparate (a little change is fine, but from amazing to odd-sugary-candy-water will not do.) I have to amend my rating to three stars. Hope the update helps you in making a decision.

Update July 12, 2010: Yes, I ordered two more cases of large cans of this brand in the pulp version, and it's fantastic. So, it seems the "badness" is limited (so far as I can tell) to the smaller cans. I'm editing the header of this review accordingly. Every single large can/case I've ordered has been delicious and refreshing and coconutty. The small cans are candy water and suck.So, AVOID THE SMALL cans until that problem is resolved. But I trust the taste of the large cans to have placed an order for 7 cases during this month's super sale of A&B. HTH.

review.user_review_title: My 2nd fave coconut water, better flavor than ONE, VitaCoco, Zico--BUT Amy&Brian's is best tasting of flash pasteurized
review.user_review:
I used to get several cases of ZICO on subscription here on amazon. But Zico changed their packaging AND processing (instead of fresh, it's now from concentrate). If it had still tasted the same, I prolly wouldn't care it was from concentrate, really. But when does a "from concentrate" drink EVER taste as good as natural. Have natural tangerine juice, then drink one from concentrate? Yeah, not the same.

So, I've tried O.N.E. and VitaCoco and assorted brands found in supermarkets and Latino stores over the years. But I always went back to Zico. Now that Zico is horrible (tastes and smells funny), I needed a new coconut water for my daily fix. I decided to try this since amazon offered it to me in a Gold Box Deal. Well, it arrived today and I LOVE IT.

It has a nice sweetness and a clean taste and it's got that refreshing quality that chilled coconut water gives. Heck, I even like it at room temperature. It's not the stinky-sour horror Zico now is.

I also like that it's organic. That's a bonus!

I agree with the other reviewer that the can is great for chilling it up real cold.

UPDATE: Apparently, this brand pasteurizes at quite high temps, so there is a legitimate concern that it loses nutrient content. I therefore recommend that, for those who want more than just a great taste, you either email the company and confirm if they have switched to flash pasteurization, or switch to Amy and Brian's (which flash pateurizes and has a BPA free container).

I disagree with the reviewer that says those other brands are tastier. I grew up drinking coconut water (my dad would split them open with a machete for us to sip straight out of the coconut), and this one tops O.N.E., which has been my Zico substitute until now, and VitaCoco (which I do agree is sourish and way down the choice list). But what "tastes good" is subjective and we won't agree on best taste. But I can tell you this tastes really close to real coconut water fresh from a tree in your backyard (though nothing beats the real, fresh thing). I'm assuming changes in flavor are to be expected since coconut water will vary from nut to nut. Even Zico was not consistent formerly, sometimes sweeter, sometimes more water, depending, I assume, on the batch of coconuts. Any drink that's from actual fresh juice will have variations (and I guess Zico went to concentrate in part to standardize the flavor). So, I may just have a crazy good batch here in my hands. :)

I've just signed on for a subscription and three cases are on their way to me, yay! Thanks, Amazon, for this alternative now that I'm exiled from Zico. Heh.

Update: I tried Amy and Brian's CW after this one, and I actually prefer the A&B due to the sweetness. It has that lovely light, clean, fresh taste that Nature Factor has, just sweeter. That may not be the best for everyone (some folks will want it less sweet, not more, due to the difference in carbs). But for me, I love sweetness, so I'm hooked. But you can't go wrong with either NF or A&B. Enjoy either or both--as I will. So great to discover fabulous new beverages that are healthful.

Addendum re Potassium: This possible potassium-compromising may end up being great for those who want, not just organic, but to minimize potassium intake but enjoy coconut water (ie, those on Ace Inhibitors or potassium sparing drugs, those with kidney function issues). I'd check with the company first--definitely-- to make sure of actual postassium content before considering it safe for the K-avoiding crowd. Something to consider, though, what with so many Americans on high blood pressure meds. But until the company confirms or denies or makes clear what it's ACTUAL end-product electrolytes/Potassium content is, K-avoiders should avoid all coconut water unless your docs okay it.
